DFSE7kvJW--EitEF1rzunw.text: You come here for the views, not the food. Very average food for a high price. More of a bucket list item.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

HagZpMKQHRuYTvRVTXfhLg.text: A MUST STOP if you are visiting London!  We did an alcohol fueled brunch outing and ended up staying for nearly three hours!!!  Of course no one minded as I am an American that lives part time in London I believe in tipping nicely!  Our group of six attempted to order the recommended things on the menu...only ordered one duck and waffle and ended up ordering two more during out visit.  The ride down the tower was equally enjoyable and thrilling!  Love this place!  You have to go!

Ba5wtiJ44o6G55dZBAms8Q.text: The best breakfast I had in London, ever!Food is very fine, and he menu change frequently. Only the drinks disappointed me a bit.It was the first time for me to get a Duck egg omelet. Amazing taste, mixed with cheese and mushrooms. The sourdough bread, aka the soldiers, are the perfect idea for dipping. Crispy, tasty, two word to define this experience.Then, I chose to go for the Belgian Waffle. It was like a firework in my mouth. To good to be eaten only one time!! Loved the way they prepared the banana, sliced and topped with a thin layer of glazed caramel :D (I still think about this)At the 40th floor, this is heaven!The view is impressive, but a reservation is required in order to enjoy this amazing space.Service is perfect.Great for a business meeting or your lover.

4n5pgQQAa2BSyuWvFqFc8A.text: Items ordered:Caffe Musetti CoffeeDuck and Waffle - Crispy Confit with Belgian Waffle, Fried Duck EggSpicy Ox Cheek Donut - Apricot Jam, Smoked Paprika, SugarWild Cornish Pollock Meatballs - Lobster Cream, ParmesanTorrejas - Maple Caramel Apples, Cinnamon Ice CreamLocated forty floors high in Heron Tower with panoramic views of downtown London available 24/7 a Sunday morning visit to Duck & Waffle seemed like a can't miss proposition, an 8am reservation secured in order to dine windowside during the breakfast-to-brunch transition.  Still a trendy choice nearly two years since opening its doors and accessed from the street via rapid transit elevator made of pure glass it was to a largely empty dining room that I entered the brightly lit space and with only a single server available for the first half hour my meal began with a leisurely pace - a pot of good coffee nicely complimenting the restaurant's signature plate, though a sign of things to come arose in black pudding 'already sold out.'  Happy to take in the scene as the room began to fill it was with great anticipation that I perused the menu of pending brunch and soon after the clock struck nine my server returned only to again disappoint with news that the restaurant's supplier had neglected to deliver any foie gras - the brulee I'd desired nowhere to be found, though a complimentary dish of my choosing was offered in its place.  Admittedly a bit annoyed after a second day of breakfast bait-and-switch it was at this point that I decided to place my faith in the staff and deferring to the kitchen as to what was best it was actually a duo that arrived, the first a crispy donut performing a tightrope act of savory and sweet while the sourced Rostang's quenelles de brochet in a sizzling Staub pot.  Clearly a talented kitchen despite their shortcomings in supply it was finally in dessert that I indulged and admitting my predilections for custard laden toast I cannot recommend the Torrejas enough as each bruleed bite gave way to a creamy crumb while stewed apples and ice cream merged into a sticky aromatic sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

HiylP8NPqRmrSoyx-Yjvgw.text: Well, well, well now!  Ain't this a sexy joint!  LOVED it!  They had me as soon as I stepped into the lift.  I squelled like a child!  And I was fortunate too.  We went on a clear night and the city rolled out before us as we ascended, all lit up and beautiful.Yup, it's true, this is another one of those venues where you follow the directions and turn up as instructed and question whether you're in the right place.  A weendy, windy corridor and an odd arrangement in the bar area.  But there's energy as soon as you step through the door.Lively music and a lively crowd, loud and buzzing with conversation.Great waiting staff, competent and charming.And then the food.  Well, the food, now that's kinda sexy too.  Mysterious.  An intriguing combination of flavours that you're not quite sure are going to work out.  But you give it a try, and you know what?  They do!  Come to think of it the drinks are sexy too.  For much the same reasons.I had the Wild Cornish Pollock Meatballs, and just in case that wasn't enough, I accompanied.  But don't be deceived by the tiny dish they put in front of you, it's incredibly filling and delicious!  The bread was unnecessary.And then my drink.  now, that was a really satisfying delight.  I had the JD&C.  Described as "Gentleman Jack whiskey, Aperol, cacao, DW salted cola reduction, cider vinegar".  Has that piqued your interest yet?  It certainly got mine!  And it was exquisite.  And all the while the city was radiant and shimmering beneath us.Duckies got their claws in me and I'll be back again!Great venue for groups or to impress a date.  ;D

K8Uk81loRcvvJ5Tsp3yi9Q.text: Oh, Duck and Waffle. I would love to give you a 5-star review. Unfortunately the pompous front of house was so rude that it left a bitter taste in my mouth when I was nibbling down on the (delicious) signature dish of confit duck leg, Belgian waffle and maple mustard. When my partner and I asked to be seated, I told the waitstaff "I like your necklace", to which she replied "you can stop flirting, I've found you a table". Eish. Perks: food is amazing, 24hour venue with STELLAR views over London is unmatched, otherwise very friendly service, great wine menu.Lows: bitchy comment, venue full of silent couples instagramming their food, bitchy comment, bitchy comment.

m_LmCLl2dL5hdQjLGSwt9Q.text: So what can I say about this after my man friend was soooooo adamant we needed to go here at 3 am? Really? Well let me tell you. This place is freakin amazing.  What more could you ask for in a place like this that has a nice view, open late, lots of people and amazing food.   You can't beat it.Food: ORGASM IN MY MOUTH is how I would describe the classic duck n waffle.  My man friend unfortunately kept sucking on the bone like more duck meat will magically appear. The combo of this place was pure ecstasy.  A must try.The other two dishes we also shared were the crispy pig ears.  Yum!! A good snack and also the BACON WRAPPED DATES!! nom nom nom.You can't go wrong with this place and its the perfect pit stop after a night of drinking.Your nightcap will probably end around 4 am :) but you will wake up in pure nostalgia.  happy eating !

CDgjmIFJaipOzyV-GW4cgQ.text: Gorgeous views, good food and great service.I was expecting really snooty service after the hurdles we went through to make reservations here (have to confirm resv before 10.30a day of resv. What a hassle when you're traveling. I've Already made a booking- that really ought to suffice). Additionally, when we were there, 20% of the tables were empty, the entire time. So much for making themselves so exclusiveThankfully, that was all the bad things abt duck & waffle.The service was attentive and polite the entire time. Our food was deliciousBeef carpaccio with foie gras : light, flavorful, foie gras was creamy goodnessDeviled duck egg: not the best I've hadSmoked chili pork cheeks on polenta: rustic, rich, flavorful Duck & waffle: fried duck confit was yummy, waffle drizzled with mustard maple syrup was great and the fried egg was a nice touch.Gnocchi with deep fried soft boil egg: sleeper surprise of the night. We wanted to lick the plateThe views were great. Stop by the terrace bar downstairs for a drink or 2 before heading off. Great for a night out esp with visitors

qIgnGYb1wb8ABJHTQIQteA.text: Famous place in London that everyone has to try for the view and their famous Duck and Waffle dish. So famous that i was a little bit disappointed with my guests as we were expecting a lot of that Duck and Waffle but in general, it is good and enough for the price.Never take a bottle of wine as it is extremely expensive but good surprise to eat one of their special bread with chorizo and cheese which was excellent.It is a really nice experience to go to Duck&Waffle as the view is impressive but it is very noisy during the evening with the music.And : Book the table at least 2 months before!!

P_d32FVjAcfUzEmOlwVscg.text: Amazing views of London from all angles. Not only does Duck and Waffle wow you with the views, but the food doesn't disappoint either. Highly recommend the duck and waffle signature dish. The pig ear chips are worth a try too, to share with friends (a little bit too much on your lonesome!). Book well in advance, and try to check when the weather is ace to get a spectacular view of this city!

9rAQS67ghDhi6sDjDZSIQw.text: Loved it! Amaazing view (best tables near the edges obviously) amazing food (you must get the duck and waffle) reasonably priced given location and good quality. We went for dinner, but I imagine its spectular all day long. Menu is quirky, but actually combinations of flavours which really work. Great cocktails, worth hanging around for a couple after. Anyone going for the first time will no doubt be impressed by views, food and service. Only slight problem was the girl on the next table didn't want her duck egg with her waffle (which tasted amazing) and my boyfriend nearly leaned over and asked if he could have it! Luckily just stopped him in time!

h0VsgRK35K4GEpF4bnOr-A.text: This amazing spot was recommended by a couple of local friends and foodies and it really sounded good do I decided to try of course.. When in rome. Or in this case London.As I enter the heron tower into what seems to be a secluded sort of hallway where we were approached by a gentleman with secret service type earpiece asking us for how many?!.. I then relax from my alert instinct and enjoy the elevator top all the way to the top to Duck & Waffle!As I walk into the place I noticed the sky high scenery as the place overlooked almost all of London a really good way to start I might say. I order the duck & waffle obviously and fell in love!! The crispy yet luscious and salty duck pair so well with the delicious syrupy waffle. I think I might even go as far to saying that it might be better than chicken and waffles. So close! To sum it all up this place a cool, chic and very current and when you have those 3 C's in a restaurant it is very hard to fail and it's open till 3am I believe!! What more can you ask for!! As a Californian,I definitely look forward to coming back next time I'm In London!! Cheers!!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & Waffle

fvKPvo5-k8XeJ6Lmfpkoqg.text: delicious - beef tartare, dorset crab, duck & waffleso so - spicy ox cheek doughnut (I liked the doughnut but disliked the texture of the ox cheek)

zXjFMX6hqKTy2lUU0QlKvg.text: Great for a night after club snack. The duck is great but the banana waffle even better. Booking is highly recommended!

wNuhY18u_7Y9Jnpy01WBUA.text: Amazing food.. Sweet and savoury. Great service and best views that will make you fall in love with London!!!We will have to come back again and again... The duck was divine.  Right skin crispiness and soft and succulent meat.  Did not expect oysters, but man were they amazing.The desert was to die for.  Not a usual fan of bread pudding, but ice cream and all.  Was hard to not have more.

w21ZjmqixgvwiNLoKAyVfw.text: wonderful food here to be honest.I would highly recommend this place for a late brunch or even after a night out :)

JWXUrEcfHRseUCM5omlaMw.text: Stunning views and fab food but an absolute pain to get a reservation at a sensible time.   Plan ahead if you want a regular time slot. I went for a special birthday breakfast and the waiters really took care of us.  We had a super view from our window side table. Of course we had the eponymous dish,  and yes,  it works and is fabulous.   For anyone who's ever had chicken with waffles in the USA, this will feel like a luxe version of that. The meals are really generous portions so arrive hungry!

pGH6ImUL--j5NuMssm6nOw.text: Definitely one of my favourite restaurants!Located in the Heron tower, you take a very swift life up 40 or so floors. Makes your ears pop! As you can imagine, the views are incredible.What makes this restaurant is the quirky menu. I would thoroughly recommend the BBQ-ed pigs ears. Sounds really gross but they just take like scratchings and come in a brown paper bag. The cocktails come in cool tin cans too! The signature dish is the duck and waffle and it's like nothing you've ever tasted! Sweet honey maple sauce, duck, egg and Belgian waffle. Sounds weird but trust me, it definitely works! The experience is all about sharing here so good to really know the people you go with! Can't wait for my next trip to duck and waffle :)

adiGSYCXQAu8wCVM-Bm_Qw.text: Great for special occasions and for a shake up to menu options. Ox donuts and duck n waffles are the best

eyrghkRSQk9O8A7_t1DZRA.text: Very busy but the view was great. I liked the food but it wasn't amazing. Would I go back again? Probably not; you can get duck and waffles in other places and spaces. Had a smooth service but wouldn't rave about this place.

oMTmkw2Kng1wKwawu9-u4w.text: What an overrated overpriced experience. I don't know who goes here. Tourists? Ok I'm from Los Angeles and I was curious- but the view is not enough. The food is meh, cocktails are fabulous but take forever and are expensive and there's nothing here I haven't seen/eaten or drank before in other better places. Save your money. Not worth it just so you can say you went. PS- I love a good open kitchen but the expediter/chef had giant gnarly burns on the backs of his arms - clearly from backing into hot oven doors or corners. But newsflash- That's why the rest of the kitchen is wearing long sleeves! Kind of gross and amateur to see. One burn ok, but learn your lesson man!

NAlRJdaImrd2P02dUdvk-w.text: Honestly, the view is undeniably beautiful.  It's totally worth it to take the lift up to the 40th (which is about 30 seconds - FAST!) and order a drink if you can find a seat from the informative and friendly bar staff (very few seats and about £13/cocktail on average) and then leave. If you actually make it into the dining room (they're open 24 hours, but apparently have some funky times where they temporarily close and communicate poorly about this to folks waiting) you're going to have to wait an hour plus and not ever have true clarity to when you'll be admitted.  The food sounds fancy, but really isn't top shelf considering their stature. Unique pairings and formats for each dish, but really didn't land for any of us. Service was unhelpful in explaining ingredients or size of each dish which surprised. Generally, this is overhyped if you're looking for anything more than a vantage point for drinks. I hear that it's neighbor sushi samba is far better, but you'll need a reservation.  Good luck...

1z7OTOiqTeJ37KqKKqrEGQ.text: Lovely view of London as it is on the 40th something floor in a skyscraper.  the design is cool and it is booked for dinner the next half year or so, however lunch is available. I had the duck and waffle which as ok. I had expected more to be frank. Still, the view was so stunning that it did not matter. Beer was expensive - think I paid 5-6£ for a small bottle.Go here for breakfast as the meals really sound terrific. Or book dinner next year!Nice staff but their English could have been better.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. My view

Pk4FCfQ7db_sT2z9roZ9Tw.text: Amazing view needless to say! Having that view while you are sitting there with good company and very fine wine automatically heightens your mood. Oh, and food was good, too! Had the tuna, grilled octopus, polenta, and smoked mackerel as starters! Octopus, a little too salty for my taste. Everything else very good and fresh! We then had Sea bass for 2! Cooked to perfection! The service started out spotty but the sommelier and the server that took care of us for the remainder of the evening made up for this one individual that was not very good for the service industry. Went there at 1430 after calling in advance to secure a table. I decided to wing it after reading reviews that people had to make a reservation two months in advance. I got lucky and I found myself even luckier having snagged a table right along the window enabling us to take in panoramic views of London. Quite breathtaking. Elevator ride up was a blast, too! Glass elevator ride all the way up to 40th floor. Call it the combination of experiences, call it the view, but it was worth it. It may seem like a touristy thing to do. We are from NYC and still have not managed to catch dinner at the Freedom Tower because that's not what you do when you are from the city but being in other cities as a tourist is fair game!

mzvDWdWZvB4rHkFUzW-rbw.text: The Duck & Waffle surpassed all my expectations. Although to be honest, I really didn't have any. A friend of mine who lives in London brought me here for a late night dinner. This place has a dress code so it is important to dress the part. No sandals, regardless of how sophisticated or in my case "classy sexy" your outfit. They almost did not let me in due to this, but a flash of a smile and a pleading please seemed to do the trick. The restaurant is located on the 40th floor of the Heron tower. The elevator is all glass, making for outstanding views and a fast thrilling ride up. The restaurant is posh and trendy with mood lighting and lots of chandeliers. The venue is large and the walls are all glass, allowing you to feast, talk, ponder while enjoying exceptional views of the city. The drinks were fun. We started with champagne and then moved on to their specialty cocktails. All their cocktails are made from vegetables making them fun and slightly healthier than your average libation. I ordered the Heritage Cocktail which consisted of patron, carrot juice and honey. My friend ordered the Pina-Kale-Lada, which consisted of rum, pineapple sherbet and kale. Was it good, you ask? Kale Yeah it was!For dinner we ordered 4 small plates. I was pretty resistant to the ox cheeks, however I gave in and I'm so glad I did. The OX CHEEK GRILLED CHEESE was PHENOMENAL. This is a bold statement, but it very well could have been the best thing I ate during my recent 2 weeks in Europe. I highly recommend it. We also ordered the MAPLE GLAZED CORNBREAD which was DELICIOUS. We could not eat at the Duck & Waffle without ordering the DUCK & WAFFLE which was also great, however if it was my restaurant I would name it "The Ox Cheek Grilled Cheese". Lastly we ordered the vegetable plate for good measure. By this time we were really full and this wasn't anything special. I am a firm believer that vegetables can be the most delicious item on a menu, as long as they are seasoned well. This dish could use a little work. Service was okay. We had to chase down the waiter on one occasion and he forgot our champagne. But he was not rude and we were provided with all our desires. Overall this was an incredible dining experience. The views, the ambiance, the drinks and the food were all exceptional.

rpeEXGPTcP5Y99E9tExnmg.text: This place was amazing. Ate here for late night dinner and lunch. Duck, Waffle and Egg is a must to get. Weird combination but it works and I had to come back for it again. Atmosphere was very cool and laid back. Night life amazing. Hennessy XO shot was expensive $60 USD (if I remember correctly). But this place was well worth it. A must stop by and check out if your in the area. Also to add restaurant is on 40+ floor amazing view of London during the day and at night!!!!! Amazing 5 stars for sure.

dmcQbts9pslhVZC1v2daJw.text: -SETTLE IN-Oh man... dude, I HAVE yelp because I'm entertained by the reviews and they're sometimes helpful in decision making but I've never actually written a review myself. I honestly feel like it's a bunch of adults telling on each other.. But this place was exceptionally horrid I actually had to write about it. I'm doing this to help you! You know, for the greater good. Like there were so many things wrong with our experience. I can't even believe that this place has any good reviews. SERIOUSLY. We would have gotten more satisfaction literally just giving away 75 quid to a homeless person. No joke!So we're on vacation here and we're night owls so it's like well into the night and we're hungry so we look up 24 hr food and this place pops up. It was kinda down the street, so we walk over not knowing there's a dress code. So the doorman tells us if we'd like to go change and come back we can. And we did. But he first upon greeting us, asked if we had a reservation. Mind you it's 3am. And he's the door guy.. like you know if there's a reservation. You'd have a list, being the doorman and all. Anyway fast forward to our second arrival. We changed and came back. He sees us walk up comes out and tells us "let me ask for a table" and goes in and leaves us in the rain. RUDE. AF! Anyhow we go up and the guy that was walking us in stops before seating us and tells us there is a requirement of one entree per person and asks if that's ok like we can't afford it. (Profiling ass) So we blow his mind and let him know that's ok. And he follows up with "are you sure?" Like are you kidding me?! And already right there, if you're telling people what they're required to order, you're already not as fancy as you're trying to be. You're strip club status.. "two drink minimum" hahaSo he seats us. And tells us the table is set for 1 hour and only food.. even tho there IS a late night cocktail menu, tho I'm not sure what time that ends at. But then proceeds to tell us they're cleaning so basically we just need to put up with the noise and all that comes with. So while we're sitting there, (literally the only patrons in there, so I'm not sure why the doorman couldn't just be cool about the dress code like we needed to impress the chef or something. and why he had to ask for a table like it was so jam packed) they're cleaning like he said but seriously it was just rude. They mopped quite literally at our feet with horribly smelly mop water. and were pulling out tables and chairs of immediate surrounding spots and spraying their cleaning solution in our vicinity. It was all just incredibly rude. Again, not keeping up with the fancy demeanor you're trying to uphold. Our waiter was a douche bag. I'm not even gonna get into the trouble we had whilst trying to order with him. But I will say that when he was clearing our plates before dessert, he was going to wipe down the table and literally touched my arm with his nasty wet rag. Like I'm sorry but I can't even move fast enough before you're in my personal space basically cleaning the table crumbs into my lap?! Also incredibly rude. So we get our dessert which was the caramelized banana waffle or whatever it was and really the whole reason we went was for waffles. But were forced to order some other crap before we could even get waffles. And 1) it comes out as a half of a waffle. A HALF OF A F-ing Waffle. So disappointing. And 2) they had the audacity to serve us some crusty ass, stale, not even exaggerating when I say like 3 or 4 day old waffle HALF. Like really bro?! Waffle is in your name? You couldn't even come correct with a fresh waffle half?! Was it going to interrupt all of the hooting and hollering the cooks were doing in the open facing kitchen. Which AGAIN, is so not classy for your "fine dining establishment." (More like a 'fine diner' and even that, is a compliment) This place is a major joke. And so over priced. Their sad excuse for a waffle.. (the half I was talking about earlier) is the same price range as their trash, main dish menu. GET A GRIP, Duck and Waffle!! I would never, NEVER EVER go back. The view couldn't even drag me back. And it's a pretty nice view. It's about ALL they have going for them. Overall, pretty horrifying experience. I gave up sleep to go there. Easily the most regrettable decision we've made on this trip. If I could give this place zero or negative stars, TRUST.. I would. *drops mic*

mSogCVT06sfvigZ4G24ZeQ.text: This place is the best breakfast spot in London hands down stafff and amazing for view on a whole another level open 24/7 which is even better from the states so chicken waffles were used to but duck and waffles was great  went 3 times in the 5 days i stayed in London

YAezTILw1MiiZtL_-54Jow.text: I loved it. I am not a big fan of duck I don't even order or at hakassan but this was unique and super good. I honestly loved it. It's better than chicken and waffle. This place is a must and it's amazing cause it closes super late so it's perfect for munchies lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Can I fly to London for this now

xTuA0Z_1Gnsrb0huIDsN4w.text: Situated on the 40th floor of a skyscraper (entrance is tough to see at the base of the sales force building; yellow and red signage). Beautiful views of London all around. Thought about ordering the beef cheek, but opted for the crispy roast duck. It was delicious, while the waffle was pretty standard. Their unique syrup with mustard seeds was a nice touch. Food was really good, and the service was excellent. Finished with a Filthy Martini at the bar to further enjoy the view. The French bartender was welcoming, informative, and an all around great fellow who greatly enhanced our experience. Cheers, mate!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

Bpk5W5lyOqTc_ue_nqSRrA.text: We heard about this place last minute and the only reservation we could get was at 8:30 in the morning... haha- so we went! Oh My God. What meal!!! And the view! It was a lot for that early but we took a nap afterwards so it was ok... Really decadent and DELICIOUS!! highly recommend
