Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. tile floors
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

DhS-PcFSSdQceRywofVRbQ.text: Firstly, make reservations a month in advance. We tried 2 weeks in advance for brunch and we couldn't get any times for any of the 3 days we had.You first take a swift trip up 40 floors on an elevator, emptying you into the impressive bar area of the restaurant. The restaurant has a very hip vibe - from lighting to music to the open kitchen.All items can be shared. We got the following:- Rosemary garlic bread: super fresh bread, great flavors from the rosemary and roasted garlic. Comes hot.- Spicy ox cheek donut: sweet and savory, this could be a meal in itself. Much bigger than we expected, meat well-stewed. - Foie gras creme brulee: my fave item on the menu. It has a burnt sugar coating and the Foie gras itself is delicious. It comes with a bread, but I liked it on the rosemary garlic bread - I could taste the Foie gras better.- Broccoli sprouts: don't overlook these! Surprisingly extremely good, comes with a duck egg. Spill the egg over the veggie, so good..and you get a veggie in!- Bone-in ribeye: skip. This is the one item I didn't like at all from the menu. Very basic, and didn't like how sweet the meat is.- Duck & waffle: of course had to try the signature dish.  The duck confit was cooked to perfection. Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside, with a duck egg on top The waffle was like any other waffle, and the mustard syrup was just ok. Still get it for the duck though!We were seated by the window on the Gherkin/Tower Bridge side. View is amazing..really raises the bar on the meal itself.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Rib eye

DD7z-OICfmVLmplEuL3W_A.text: Loved this place. The view is out of this world and the elevator will be the ride of your life. I really enjoyed my duck, waffle and eggs. Everything was perfect. Followed by a nice cup of tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. The Window View
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Just Right!!

P0FPaQM2MGH7yo5ZK-d1JQ.text: Duck & WaffleQuick Review: The food was just as breathtaking as the views.  The restaurant is situated at the top of Salesforce tower in London, its as if you are in a bird's nest eating above the city.  Extremely fresh food and awesome service.  I definitely recommend you try this place if you are visiting or local.FOOD (I suggest ordering a ton of plates to share):Rosemary & Garlic Baked Bread (6) - fresh and made to order, amazing flavors and you don't even need the butterAsparagus (11) - I could not believe that what I ate was just asparagus and a poached egg.  Definitely a must try!Yellowfin Tuna (12) - Super refreshing dish and very light, we got 2 orders.  Pea & Mint Ravioli (18) - OMG it was so yummy, the pasta was cooked perfectly and the filling was deliciousDuck & Waffle (17) - When its the name of the restaurant you know you have to try itWhole Sea Bass (36) - Either we were really full or this was just ok, I probably would not order this again if I was to return Chocolate Blondie (8.5) - yummy yummy yummy...super refreshing snack after a large meal. Not to sweet and it came with fresh fruit so thats healthy right....? :DSERVICE:Definitely make reservations.  You have to book weeks in advance but its definitely worth it.  Our reservation was at 5:45PM, which was a little early but it was because anything later was already booked.  You also only have a set time to sit at the table.  The customer service was excellent, our waiter was very kind and very attentive.  Ambiance: BEAUTIFUL views with a unique design.  Words cannot describe how magical this place was.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

TJht1ETN49nr9PlkwYI4sQ.text: Fantastic experience .. I really enjoyed it. Bear in mind though that you come here for the fantastic view and not the food which I found well meaning but a disappointing. I had the house breakfast followed by the grilled asparagus. Both dishes well presented but felt they could have used nicer sausages, mushroom and the asparagus was a bit heavy on the vinegar. That being said the view is impressive and the restaurant space is beautiful - when my parents are next in town I will be taking them here!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Grilled asparagus
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. The view from the bar / waiting area .. If you don't have a reservation chill and have a coffee.

qwrV3OkW8N_-C_CI7ugFbA.text: Every so often, it's good to have a little pomp and circumstance in your life.Even if the end result means that you're basically going to eat poultry and a waffle. If you want to get in at a decent hour, I highly recommend making reservations. I made mine a week out and I was still scheduled for 1:30am. Since it was within the first couple of days coming from the States, 1:30am suited us fine.So where's the pomp? You'll find it before you even get into the building. Velvet ropes and a guy checking your reservations. After we pass muster, we're allowed to enter the glass corner-of-the building elevator. What a beautiful ride. You can see Russia from here! ;)Walking into the restaurant, I first heard the unmistakable sounds of untz-untz-untzing. Did we walk into a club? Then I realized you walk through their bar to get to the restaurant. We were sat right by the window (40th floor) with the best view in the house. Menus with reasonable prices were placed in our hands and we both decided to have the duck and waffle (!) but we were so hungry, he ordered the pig ears for himself (served in a brown bag with a wax seal) and I ordered the Foie Gras Creme brulee served with brioche. Be still my cholesterol-laden heart.My guy wasn't into the pig ears, but they were okay he said. I did like the generous serving of foie (a bit sweet for me). The duck confit, duck egg, and waffle was everything I wanted it to be. Served with a mustard seed maple syrup, it was the perfect...circumstance. The confit was crisp on the outside and buttery on the inside. I already miss it.To add to the whole experience, from the time that we were seated until we left, we received extraordinary service. This should be on your to-do list.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Foie gras creme brulee with brioche toast
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Pig ears
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck confit, duck leg, waffle, mustard seed maple syrup

dg5z5Y9C1HZ-z2aDcoWNRw.text: We wandered into this place not fully understanding what the deal was. It was very good!1. This is kind of a fancier place (the name sort of threw me.. in the states, chicken and waffle places are not super fancy.)2. During a normal breakfast time you should have a  reservation, BUT if you don't want to deal with that, you can go up and have coffee in the bar and enjoy the same view. Awesome.3. It is on the 40th floor, so if you are afraid of heights, or have issues with an elevator with an amazing view, be aware.We had the duck and waffles and it was really good. Service was outstanding, and everything from the coffee to the bacon was awesome. Plus the view was amazing. Highly recommend!

UbLcZTRw0LMPa4oPxDihNg.text: The Duck and Waffle offers fantastic views of downtown London. There is a great atmosphere. Food and drink represent various aspects of European cuisine: English, Italian, Spanish, and French. Cost makes this a great place for a treat or a date.

xKlgk894Ej6ue2Lhcjv39g.text: Wanted to grab a quick bite just before noon time at the adjacent sushi samba, but they were still closed, so I decided to stop here for coffee instead. I was seated right away at the bar. Enjoyed a very good soy latte with nice views of the London skyline from the 40th floor.Definitely recommended as a place to grab a coffee with a view after visiting the close tower bridge. It's a nice walking distance, if the London weather permits such a walk, that is.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. The very photogenic Gherkin

GwPok8RG9XJ9FMOboQJ0pA.text: There are just some experiences that make you realise how lucky you are to live in a city like London. The Duck and Waffle being one. I've wanted to go to the Duck and Waffle ever since hearing about it and it's late night opening and I truly can't believe it took me so long! But then maybe because my heart was set on going for Sunrise I just haven't had the opportunity or was out at the right time before. My experience lived up to expectation. There is nothing more decedent than watching the sunrise steep across the city after a good night out. Observed from the panoramic view point, that is the top floor of the heron tower. All this whilst being basked in luxury. The venue itself has soft and comfortable booths and chairs, three walls of the restaurant are full length windows and the rich colours and quality fixtures make the ambience very cosy and inviting. The last wall is the open faced kitchen, where you can watch your food being prepared. Whilst London is supposed to be open all hours, few establishments took advantage of the 24 hour licencing laws, however the Duck and Waffle is one of the few, open for food and drink 24 hours a day. Whilst it's on the more expensive side at £18  a pop I had to try the dish that this restaurant is named after, and I have to say it was superb and worth every penny. It's sweeter than you'd imagine, but bursting with flavour. I loved the glazed duck skin and the meat whilst first appearing a little dry was absolutely amazing. The waffle complimented perfectly and I thoroughly enjoyed every bite. My companions opted for the sloppy Joe sandwich (around £10 a pop) and the seafood pie. Whilst the sloppy Joe was ill received the fish pie was enjoyed. Cocktails are absolutely beautiful, if also on the more expensive side, and they have a good wine selection. A beautiful venue, great attention to detail and an all-round great experience.

xLuu0dtmSzY4cSPObyTbFg.text: I kind of kept thinking about Mufasa telling Simba, "All that the light touches is yours" when I looked out at the view from the top of Heron tower.  I see so many takeaways from modern, contemporary American food that I feel a more kindred spirit with modern cuisine from the other side of the Atlantic than I do with the restaurant being termed 'Modern European'.Eating at Duck and Waffle is an experience in drink, eat, sight and service.  It reminds me of eating experiences at some of the most innovative restaurants in Atlanta, Washington DC, New York, Chicago, San Francisco and Los Angeles.  Its signature dish, the duck with waffles, particularly reminds me of inspiring takes on Fried Chicken and Waffles that has been a staple of Harlem in Manhattan for many a night out.  With that said, I loved the experience.  Our table had a view of all of London.  Our service, while slow, was nice and very attentive when available.  The drinks were always so tasty.  Just go for the experience -- great for clients, proposals, date night, or any other 'must impress' occasions.

8la5j_Eqs_iJ6mJQ0sGAcA.text: Been here twice now, once with a large group of colleagues and once with my boyfriend.You HAVE to have the ox cheek donuts! Oh, and the crispy pigs ears! Oh yes, and the duck and waffle :)My boyfriend had the whole roast seabass and I had duck and waffle.. I can't bring myself to order anything else for a main as it's just so gorgeous.If you are coming as a couple, you should ask for one of the corner tables to get the best possible view of the city. After dinner, head on down to the sushi samba bar for a nightcap.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Ox cheek donut
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Whole roasted Sea bass and duck & waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Bag of crispy pigs ears

s2rqUjoQsFPJ2060GfJFNQ.text: Girlfriend and I went to a Saturday brunch (after getting reservations for it about 5 weeks beforehand!) to experience this London vantage point.  The space is small, but the decor works well to make the space feel bigger and brighter.  The food was quite good- tapas-style portions, but the richness leaves you feeling full which helps avoid eating way too many calories at breakfast.  Highly recommend the bacon-wrapped dates!Despite the food being good, the service left a negative impression.  We had to ask 3 times for them to bring us the filter coffee we had ordered (the food actually arrived before it came out) and on the second time they actually brought out a teapot without any water instead of a coffee.  The plates were also brought out at different times so we had to wait to eat our meal at the same time.The draw is obviously the amazing views and good food for a quite reasonable price, however don't expect the service level to match.  A good place for a special brunch if you don't mind getting your items at a leisurely pace.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Bacon-wrapped dates

m7fHxE8Bn0GiqJExbbBJ4Q.text: Woke up at 5am to catch the sunset at 7am one morning and I thought that was the most beautiful moment in my London life so far. The view was without questions breathtaking and the food was good as well. I ordered a traditional duck and waffle with pastries. The duck was crispy and not oily at all! Very tasty and the staff was friendly as well. Overall, I would go again and hopefully next time I can take my family and potentially someone special with me

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

vCoE0xbQ6mR2qYnIO8yzmg.text: I wouldn't recommend trying anything but the signature dish here - it is truly delicious but I found the dessert options to be disappointing. Then again, you may be blessed with a fabulous view over London if you are lucky enough to get a window seat. Make a reservation in advance. This place is actually open 24/7 so you can even pop by here after a night out (if you're not too trolleyed).

fdwD6OL756kyapuxTegHLg.text: Breathtaking 360 view from the 40th floor of the Heron Tower. Went for brunch and got their popular duck and waffle. It was impeccably perfect! Delicious waffle topped with a crispy duck leg, fried duck egg, and a mustard maple syrup. A more sophisticated version of the chicken and waffle.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Crispy, juicy duck leg on waffle topped with a sunny side egg

Uu_VEX0T1zBbm_jGzrnkOg.text: Beautiful views. Went for breakfast and had the full English. Not too overpriced but didn't have all items a full English would usually have. Great service. My friend had the waffles with caramelised banana and said they were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

AoJtHvL8MnSeffBqUwq4Qw.text: I loved my time and food at D&A. First off - the location is AMAZING. The staff couldnt have been more helpful with the ordering and the fact you can see the kitchen is pretty cool. The chef's baseball caps are so desirable I nearly knocked one over the head and ran off with my cap booty.  I loved the starters - I'd kill for another bacon and manchego fig - it was THAT good. I ordered more instead of a main as I didnt want pudding. Until my friend ordered pudding - then I wanted more brownie that I could have ever beleived.My 4 star is down to the fact that despite our repeatedly asking for water refils (6 times - but who's counting?!!) they refilled me once. In a place like this I would expect an auto refil service - hence my knocking a star off. That said - this was an awesome lunch and I would return again and again and again..

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. The Duck. The Waffle. plus a maple syrup dressing. All in all - fantastic!

faR7OGxQ9G1UGL29ZqKzgg.text: course a more upmarket place to spend those insomniac hours at night. This place in the Heron Tower house Duck and Waffle and also downstairs is the Sushi Samba (38th floor) and its fab cocktail bar. Duck and Waffle is on the 40th floor right at the top! The elevator is an experience in itself that you can do for free and wonder at the glass view over London.What I ordered at Duck & Waffle:- The duck and waffle - crispy leg confit, fried duck egg and mustard maple syrup. Sounds weird tastes great. A must try if going.- Crispy pigs ears. Comes in a cute bag to pick at.- Torrejas caramel with apples and cinnamon ice cream dessert. One of the best most decadent sweet desserts I have ever had.Second time I went I went for brunch and had:- Mushroom, egg truffle with soldiers that you could dip. Quite honestly it was out of this world.- Had the Torrejas again and it was just as good. Food coma-esque.As I said the view is spectacular, the atmosphere buzzing and the food ultimately outstanding. I will be back again very soon.

cXKYp3iv963et_v0g6iMbg.text: This place is hard to get a reservation for. I'd attempted to get a dinner reservation for a Friday night 2 months before the day itself but the earliest time I managed to secure was 9pm - speaks volumes for the popularity of the restaurant. Naturally I had high hopes. It was to be my first night in London, and I thought it would be a nice start to our trip in London, with the breathtaking views from Heron Tower.It was satisfying to bypass the long lines waiting to enter the restaurant, courtesy of our reservation. We took a glass elevator that zoomed up to the 40th floor. I had fun watching the city shrink under my feet.I'd requested for a table next to the window but unfortunately, we were placed in the middle, though we were allowed to walk over to take pictures at the window if we wished. Food-wise, it was definitely good, though not mindblowing. But many of them piqued my interest, and I'd have loved to try more dishes if I could.Ox cheek doughnut (to share) - Loved the fluffiness of the doughnut, with the sweet dough giving way nicely to the savory and tender meat within. The apricot chutney on the side was definitely the highlight of the dish.Duck & Waffle - it was a tad greasy for my tastes, but the egg, duck, waffle and syrup went nicely together for an explosion of savory and sweet. I chose not to drench the dish in syrup though, choosing to drizzle a little whenever i wanted.We were full by now but reviews raving about their torrejas tempted me. The combination of caramel, warm bread and cinnamon ice cream was heavenly, but by this time, I'd had too much sugar in the meal to properly appreciate it. A good place for a date, or a treat to marvel at the beauty of the city, but I may not necessarily be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Torrejas - French toast with cinnamon ice cream
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Signature duck & waffle with a duck egg and maple syrup
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Ox cheek doughnut with apricot chutney

5qykIpst4fnLePjpve3Efg.text: I try hard not to be caught up in following the crowd when it comes to heavily hyped venues. Hence my internal restraint gene sounded when Duck & Waffle opened. Would the prices be hiked up as high as the 40th floor on which the restaurant was located? Was the 24 hour opening is cheap gimmick to attract publicity? Was the near legendary impossibility to get a table at a sensible time worth the pain and effort?In such cases, I wait until people who I respect like fellow Yelpers and some professional critics have had their say before committingIt was therefore a pleasant surprise when Hannah contacted me to say that she had secured a booking for breakfast here and whether I would like to join her. Thanks, Hannah! I got especially excited when she told me about the 'Millennium Falcon lift' as I'm a big Star Wars fan!Duck & Waffle is located in the Heron Tower and the entrance is very discreet with one person manning a booth on the ground floor checking that you have a reservation before letting you get into the lift. Well, that's the magic starts as the lift which whisks you up is glass fronted and has a view straight out, giving a quickly vertiginous view of the London landscape below, causing me to move back a little as I'm scared of heightsThey've designed the entry to the restaurant well as a corridor opens out into an amazing view of the London cityscape. It's strange to see the Gherkin below you! There's a real sense of light and space, which is carried over into the dining room, which has great views on 3 sides with the 4th side taken up by the open plan kitchenThe menu was more varied than I was expecting and we got a selection of dishes to share. Being a brunchy sort of occasion, Hannah got a mimosa and I got a freshly squeezed orange juice, which did taste a little watered down but freshThe Colombian eggs were essentially scrambled eggs on toast with a few vegetables thrown into the mix. Not the most exciting of dishes and we should maybe have accepted the waiter's offer of salt, pepper or tabasco when he delivered the dishHowever, the pan fried foie gras on toasted brioche with Nutella was super yummy though I'm not sure how one can go wrong with foie gras. It was rich, deep and nicely offset by the sweetness of the NutellaWe had to have the eponymous duck and waffle, which is a play on the southern American chicken and waffle, I suppose. However, the duck was more reminiscent of crispy aromatic duck, which is no bad thing but possessing a British palate, I found it a little to reconcile eating duck with waffle and sweet maple syrup. Nonetheless, the duck was tastyWe finished the meal by sharing poached peaches with tarragon ice cream and biscotti. The peaches were quite unevenly cooked with some remaining very crunchy and others much more mushy. The ice cream was a hit with fresh vibrant notes of tarragon clearly coming throughService was efficient rather than warm, even when we tried to engage our waiter about his favourite dish on the menuTaken in conjunction with the spectacular view, the meal was a hit. Without the view, I would say the food is OK. I know the prices do include a mark up for the location but overall, the prices are expensiveThanks for organising a fun breakfast, Hannah!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

UK3hXW6d9fHdZ-gloICvng.text: Worth it for the views, not worth it if you aren't a big fan of pork, egg and cheese (and all together in the same meal). I found the food very rich and was not for me. My companions did enjoy so an acquired taste. Definately check out the menu before you dine.

8-CW90NXl9hr4vLNL1pD-w.text: If you can score eating here during sunset, then you're solid. Another place I read about and literally hopped on a plane to check out. My expectations were met both times. Let's start with the service and the aimeizing view you get! Service was superb, but the view was EVERYTHING. You will literally be 50 floors up in the sky overlooking London. From the Tower Bridge to Big Ben, you can see it all from all diff angles. The restaurant is in a circular building so you best believe you will get the fill 360 view! Chicken and waffles is a very common dish but Duck and waffle? This dish comes in the perfect size, one nice piece of waffle cooked just right, nice crunch and not soggy at all. But everyone get s duck thigh! The juiciest part and the skin is fried to perfection. Now to top it off, they have their secret syrup they provide for you to drizzle on top. I can honestly say if you're ever in London, you really do have to make sure you check this place out. Did I mention they're 24/7?!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. @aimeizing

2PjWHCa44wfQZiGxZhIXNQ.text: Words aren't enough, it's an experience one has to see for themselves. The views themselves are enough to intrigue and although the food menu is simple it is a delectable journey that will give you a fresh perspective on London. Situated in Central London this place doesn't let down, you can feel comfortable dining here alone and make quick friends but also gives you the freedom too venture out to a lower floor for  balcony perspective. I suggest you book in advance and go with the flow... You won't regret it.

BvF2DjM6CH-lzrMoPiTH6g.text: We went to Duck&Waffle for our 6am reservation, which happened to be the only reservation we could make (2 weeks in advance) within the 2 week period we would be in London.At 5:45am, as one might expect, the 24 hour restaurant was pretty quiet, the floor was being vacuumed and the kitchen apparently had not yet opened by 5:50am.  They told us to order drinks first while we waited.  So we waited. And that's okay.  What I was unhappy with is that: I asked for my poached eggs to be well-done/hard, but 20 minutes later it came soft and runny.  I also did not get my yogurt and granola, which I had ordered with my meal (I ordered 'the full breakfast' from the menu combos).  While I ate, I reminded my server 3 times that I had ordered this yogurt, and he said he was aware.  When I finished my 'full breakfast', he said he would bring my yogurt.  I asked why it wasn't brought during my meal, and he told me it's because he assumed it was dessert.  No, yogurt was not a part of the dessert menu/section of the menu and if I had wanted yogurt for dessert, I would not have asked for it 3 times throughout my breakfast.  Our server was awkward.  Food was mediocre.  The view was the best part.  Overall, underwhelming.

rhRhI2FhhvVGMmv7yuaQkg.text: It would be great to see this place if only they didn't impose a random no shorts policy despite being well dressed. Anyway, besides not wearing a top hat I'm probably not good enough for this pretentious place. There are better things to do with one's life than waste it with stupid and irrelevant bouncers.

tEl-IiKLVW0sThmcxW1z1g.text: We originally had a booking for 6.15 but had to change it. So that's how we ended up in Duck and Waffle at half-midnight on a Monday morning. I am so glad we had to change because I don't think the day light would have done this magical place justice. It's all quite fancy, but a fun experience you definitely have to do. The doorman lets you in and you get whisked up to the 40th floor in a pink-lit lift - I got slight vertigo as you're on the outside of the building but the view was too exciting not to peek. At the top you enter the bar and are greeted by very smart and attentive waiting staff. We made our way to the table, as requested by the window. Wow. A candlelit dinner overlooking the wonderful city that is London with your favourite person is hard to beat. The late night menu has less choice but still does not disappoint. Being veggie I went for the Colombian Eggs (£11) - served on toast and avocado, my boyfriend went for their signature dish, yep you've guessed it - duck and waffle (£17). As we ate silence ensued, for us this means only one thing; we were loving every mouthful. We accompanied our dinner with a glass of the cheapest white wine on the menu (£8!!!) but it tasted delicious and with it being so hard to book at table we thought we deserved it!The views of nighttime London really are stunning, you can see tower bridge and the Gherkin for an unusual viewpoint and the glimmer of transport, homes and offices for miles and miles - though I am a big environmentalist I couldn't help but enjoy the beautiful views over a scrummy dinner. We were pretty excitable all dinner and thoroughly enjoyed our late night trip. We have already made plans to come back when we can get a taste of the full menu. It isn't a cheap one, but I was admittedly expecting every dish to be over £15 at least and this wasn't the case. I'm definitely going back as this was one of my most favourite eating experiences to date.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Smothering the duck and waffle with syrup

QELeo8T23Xl3IGpj7AH2eA.text: I've been living in London for a few years and Duck and Waffle has been on my list of "must try" and I now know why.  First of all, get a booking because unless you're going there at 4 AM (yes, this place is a 24/7 operation), it's impossible to get a table.  Located in the Liverpool Street area, the restaurant is situated on the 40th floor, boasting incredible views of the city.  The restaurant isn't big, but very well run.  The servers are attentive and get your orders out right away.  The duck and waffle dish is amazing - I just wish there was a little more waffle!  You could easily blow a lot of money here between starters and pricey drinks, but it's possible to keep the check relatively affordable, too.  I would absolutely come back!

w_oFBH-C1oVTF2T2taLtCQ.text: MyPOV: the 5-6 am menu is limited with 3 options and they were all excellent. The signature duck and waffle was a perfect duck confit matched with a perfectly golden waffle and fried egg. Impressed by the service. Only negative was the waiter had pushed us to an expensive bottle of flat water. Other than that the food was as good as the 40th floor views.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. MyPOV: surprisingly the food is as good as the view. @dcukandwaffle

5E98RBBd55TGdY1kgG1C2g.text: Duck & Waffle was a great experience. I came with 3 of my friends for lunch, and it was a meal I will remember for sure. The atmosphere itself is worth coming for, it's not everyday you get to eat at the highest restaurant in London with the accompanying view. I got the classic duck and waffle to eat, and it did not disappoint. The waffle/syrup/egg/duck combination was something I've never tried, but it really hit the spot. It also wasn't too heavy or big which was nice. Overall, definitely recommend checking this out!

m55mGLwbVV-pC8FZzXmpvg.text: Not a stay in London without visiting this place! The view itself is worth the reservation! And the food, oh my, is SO good. I'm missing that duck & waffle I had back here in the states. It tasted AMAZING! I don't think I've tried duck before, but this place made me love it. Defiantly such a pretty sight, and a great place to see the city view. Would and will come again when back in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. The view was amazing from up here. 40 floors up!
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Excellent customer service and the house dish is amazing! Loved the duck & waffle together. Would defiantly come again.

42cgZDiPbUP-_Mbmwtrc0A.text: Out of all the places we ate in London, this one was my fav. It's an absolute must! We came here for brunch and were very fortunate to be seated by the window. The view of the London skyline was spectacular, definitely contributed to the great dining experience here. Even though it's open 24 hours, be sure to make reservations in advance unless you don't mind dining at 11 p.m. or later.As for the food, we came with a group of 7 so were able to try out several dishes. I got the full Elvis waffle. PB&J and banana brûlée? It's a winner. No questions asked. Also, one of the prettiest waffles I've ever seen. My other favorite was the duck & waffle. Hence, it's the name of the restaurant so it has to be good, right? The sweetness of the maple syrup and saltiness of the duck complimented each other very well. Yeah, it's more on the expensive side but so is everything in London. Would come back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Caramelized banana
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Ox cheek Benedict
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Foie gras creme brulee

4P3f4hbVtKltDbx-MBXbQA.text: Very hard to make a reservation within a short period of time, but early morning is always easier to book. Went twice (different stores) during a week stay in London, as a duck lover, would strongly recommend this place.

b8TDV1qkZi4I4abnCll-WQ.text: Bouncer/Security guy was the worst person ever.  A group of us were in line waiting patiently to get in and when we arrived to the front of the line, the security guy said we couldn't get in.  At first when we asked why, he said it was because two of our friends were on the phone.  Stupid excuse, I thought.  So when I pressed him for a better answer for why he was turning us away after waiting almost an hour, he said it was because we were intoxicated.  How the heck were we intoxicated when we hadn't even had a single drink yet?  When pressed for a better answer, he said we just couldn't get in because I was too flamboyant.  I don't think anyone should be turned away from a restaurant for being gay...sorry I was born this way. When I asked to speak to a manager, he said management wasn't available as they were "too busy."  When I mentioned that I would be calling to file a complaint, he said it wouldn't matter so not to bother.  I'm offended by the discriminatory practices of this place.  I'm an American and my "American accent" is a dead give away, but I also hold a PhD from Harvard and am sick and tired of encountering this kind of crap at high end places in London that make assumptions about people of color.  Avoid this place.  You're better off eating at the Shard's numerous restaurants if you want a view.

FHlbY3fDYXrqvib7HV5vlQ.text: If you're in the mood for some panoramic sights of London, you won't be disappointed at Duck and Waffle. Most people need to be on the "list" to proceed to the 40th floor, but don't worry. They take reservations AND are open 24/7. There is also a sushi samba on the floor below if you want another bar experience. The bar at D&W is open to the lounge. I didn't care for the graffiti wall and I can't seem to figure out the theme. It's very posh with people decking out and others clearly tourists. The food is excellent. The duck is a confit leg on a freshly made waffle with a duck egg. Yummmmmm. We ended the meal with some sort of amazing apple French toast thing. I can't recall but pic is attached. The service is excellent!

VFnO1irfJs43bb-bv0FiVA.text: Give me a lively atmosphere, a great view, stellar service and eclectic fare and I'm in foodie heaven! We dined here Monday evening at the recommendation of local colleagues. We were immediately struck by the ambience, which features modern decor, stunning views and lively (but not annoying) music - all work together to offer up a vibe that is truly infectious.The five of us each selected a starter to share. I selected the spicy ox cheek donut - a pastry ball stuffed with shredded and seasoned ox cheek. I believe this was the table's favorite; absolutely delicious. The smoked eel was tasty, as were the yellowfin tuna and charred mackerel. The other favorite starter was the angus beef tartare served with onion, mustard and egg yolk (I did say the fare is eclectic, did I not??) Holy tartar, batman, my taste buds are dancing for joy. The flavor was incredible; OK, the table had two favorite starters.The Duck and Waffle is known for its...wait for it...duck and waffle so of course I had to try it. The dish features a duck leg quarter topped with a fried duck egg and both served atop a wonderful waffle. These were accompanies by a mustard maple syrup which had the perfect blend of sweet and savory to perfectly accompany the meal. My daughter chose the miso glazed rabbit, stating that she had never had rabbit before. I tasted it, and the flavor was incredible - no, it does not taste like chicken. She thoroughly enjoyed her meal as well.For dessert our table shared the baked Alaska -- you know, in all my years I have never tried baked Alaska?? Why not??? It was outstanding, along with the apricot and rosemary cake.All-in-all, this was a tremendous experience in all facets. We thoroughly enjoyed it, and I heartily recommend.

FGdpzqJV_2JoPGXNALHWSA.text: This is one of my favorite places to go in London. I love Duck & Waffle!The place itself deserves 5/5 - cozy, stylish and great service. But be sure to book a table, if you want to be served within a short time :) If you haven't and arrive in the evening, wait in the bar with their truffle drink and be sure to order the bbq-spiced pig ears and the spicy ox cheek donut (this one is to die for!). Always go for their Duck & Waffle for brunch. Their duck egg en cocotte is delicious too. I also love the foie gras creme brulee, but this one can be heavy!

FJ6Ei0HSaduE7nBo5OlVGQ.text: We had a reservation on a Thursday at 2pm and came with a group of 8 people. We arrived separately in two groups of 4 each. When I arrived with the second group, we were judged according to the dress code. One of my friend wore ripped jeans and I have to admit, I didn't read the dress code note but I always dress fine and 90% of us did. If my friend did not follow the dress code properly, then please deny access but do not let us enter and then judge us like we are worth less than others. Meanwhile we noticed other guests wearing sweatpants... come on! When we walked downstairs, we overheard the guys at the front door talking to each other and one of them asked the other one "where they upstairs? who let them in?" This is highly unprofessional and do not think only because we didn't talk English to each other that we don't understand it.In my opinion, exclusivity doesn't have to mean to be misanthropic. Exclusivity means having good food quality and a great ambience. The food was ok but we got to admit we only came for the view. I would recommend the view but do not expect a lot of the service (don't even want to get started to tell you about the service) and the food.

QB6WB02p4iymWiUyRtalaA.text: View is amazing!  Atmosphere swanky. Food (duck and waffle) good but pricey as expected. Service mediocre.  I had to ask whether my wine was on its way after my meal had arrived.  Waiter forgot.  In general, the waiter assigned to me did not provide service as expected for price of meal.

uqYoBDN60wEx1hkweqgyQQ.text: I was really impressed with this place...they took a sophisticated spin on a downhome tradition. First of all the location is amazing! It's perched atop of the 40th floor so u have amazing views of the city. Be sure to follow the dress code...we almost didn't make it inside! They get mad props for service;-) once the brought the food out I was a believer! Crispy duck on the outside and tender on the inside...on top of a Belgian waffle at that! My only complaint was that the waffle didn't seem fresh but once the Dijon syrup went on i didn't notice a thing. I would totally go back here every night if I had the opportunity but duck and waffle is definitely something u should save for a special occasion.

HdSvsVprebssYLT2anzowA.text: Was glad i tried this place, particularly choosing the duck burger which really was different in a good way. The duck and waffle looked good, didnt try it, but honestly just looked like duck confit with waffles. Their alcoholic drinks, at least the one i had cant rememwbr but it was greenish and refreshing, was quite good.Would return

H82An0eBsSsWXEROn8wcvg.text: In the Financial district of London. 40th floor of the building with a great view. Reservations required. Must have the Duck & Waffle signature dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. The bar you pass by towards the restaurant.

9RH5TM1teqZaz-rbpnDUUg.text: Came here with a party of 7 mid day on a weekday at 3pm. The place was full. You take an elevator ride up to the 40th floor. The place is nice with a trendy rustic vibe. The food was good: we had the donut, mackerel, lentil and beets salad (this was my fav), duck waffle and rabbit. Everything was really good. I'm taking off one star for the snobby hostess who made us stand there for 10 minutes while she looked at her screen trying to figure out where our party is sitting, even after we told her they're already inside. The food and experience was pleasant enough, but I wouldn't call this exactly a London must see.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle- half a waffle??? Very small portion
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Mackerel

mDloixDSJ16ZAZCjKNqZlA.text: My original plan was for me and my boyfriend to eat here and be able to watch the sunrise one morning while in London. I should have known you would need a reservation for something like that, but no worries, because I came back around lunch time and was able to wait and get a table. The wait wasn't as bad as we thought it would be, but we could have just gotten lucky.Although, we weren't able to get a window seat, the view was still amazing. We were able to sneak off to this little area in the corner to take a few pictures, before our waiter came out to get our order. While we were waiting for the table we had a chance to look at the menu, so we knew right off the bat what we wanted to try.We ordered the Seared Octupus, Duck and Waffle, and Angus Beef Tartare and just shared everything. The seared octupus was very tasty at first, but the seasonings/sauces were a little over powering, so we weren't able to finish it. The Duck and Waffle was very tender and I loved the flavor of the mustard syrup they gave you to pour over it. I would HIGHLY recommend getting the angus beef tartare, as it was seriously the best tartare I have ever had in my entire life. The mustard sauce and pickled onions were to die for and the crunch of the crouton went well with the melt-in-your-mouth angus.Our server was so sweet and friendly and was always checking on us and cracking jokes. Not one complaint.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Angus Beef Tartare
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and Waffle// Seared Octopus

F0RU0Uq13RgKyHMFsXzLLA.text: Duck and Waffle was everything that I thought it would be. It's a restaurant on the 40th floor in London and boy were those views insane. Starting with the glass elevator before you get to the top. Crazy. Then to actually be sitting right next to the floor-to-ceiling windows for dinner was a mad ting. We ordered SO MUCH. Rosemary& garlic bread, cornbread with jalapeño and yogurt sauce. Amazing. The sauce was less yogurt and more of a creamy, zesty taste. Roasted Brussels sprouts. They were deliciously covered in a tangy brown sauce and slightly crispy. I ordered the duck and waffle. Half a Belgian waffle, duck leg, fried egg and syrup. This dish was amazing. I mean seriously, the waffle was cooked to the perfect golden color. The duck leg was crispy and taste like the better was fresh/clean. The egg was the perfect complement. While the maple syrup was just the right amount of sweetness. Tried my hardest to get every element in one bite. My sister ordered the artichoke ravioli which was deliciously flavored! The service at Duck and Waffle was impeccable. They refilled our wine and water glasses before they were low. The table and dish presentation was kept up the entire meal. After eating, of course we couldn't leave. We had to snap pictures of ourselves on my sister new camera on the 40th floor. Duh.So we did. A kind fellow that worked there took a few great pictures of us, saying that his job is part bartender and part photographer. We really enjoyed the night and this would be a lovely place to come to celebrate any occasion, with your SO or friends. It's beautiful from top to bottom.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and Waffle, Artichoke Ravioli

sVPIFBGIPtlE-CNbaN50kw.text: Perfect view and really nice bar. Brunch was nice but classic. Definitely pay for the view. We waited 20 add minutes to get to our table... and the place to eat was not that clean. Abut deceived.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

VK7mK_tDV8dH0jcLcmEaCA.text: Pros: Duck and Waffle dish was unique, as the dish balances the sweet and savory. The views of the restaurant were amazing.Cons: Service wasn't great. I arrived at 10:30pm to the restaurant on a Wed night. Not having a reservation, I expected a wait of around 30 minutes to 45 minutes. However I waited 1 hour and 25 minutes to be seated, which was 20 minutes over the time they said it would take for them to seat us, and by that time, the dinner menu had changed to the late night menu which wasn't what we had visited for. What was confusing was that most of the tables were empty but prepared yet they kept telling us that the seats were not ready and were being prepared. It also took a while to get the waiter's attention while we were waiting at the bar area to be seated in the dining area which didn't help with the already long wait.

DlYOWvCTQaJQa1pK_0K5gg.text: Come here for a great view of the city, but don't come solely for the food. If you've never been here or you're visiting from out of town, this is a great place to come for weekend brunch, but the food was a little bit hit or miss for me. Some dishes were unique and delicious, but for the price and the hassle to get a reservation, I'm not really chomping at the bit to come here again. Come with 2-4 people so that you can share a few small plates. We were a party of 3, and I was able to make a reservation 2 months ahead of time online for a Monday brunch. Note that the brunch menu is only served on weekends and on bank holidays.BBQ Spiced Crispy Pig Ears (£6) - Like the name of the dish implies, these are deep fried little slivers of pig ear and tastes and looks better than the mental image that you conjure. They are covered with delicious BBQ spices that are a tinge of sweet and spicy. Definitely unique and it was interesting to try and a good amount to share between 3-4 people.House Bread (£6) - This isn't really worth £6 in my opinion. Yes, it's super fresh and piping hot but I think it looks more impressive than it actually is. There's some spices and butter on top, so the top part of the bread is flavorful, but the bottom part is a little bland. The bland part went well with the foie gras creme brûlée, so at least that was salvageable. I would pass on the house bread.Duck and Waffle (£17) - Obviously this is their signature dish, with a duck confit leg, an egg, and a waffle. It was good, but not sure it was worth £17; I also had a duck and waffle dish in Miami that I liked a tinge better than this one. Good, and worth getting one for the table to share, but I wouldn't get multiple for the table - there are a lot of other shareable dishes to be had.Foie Gras Creme Brûlée (£13) - This was one of my favorite dishes of the meal. Very decadent, creamy, and a perfect torched, caramelised top. If you like foie, you will love this. Comes with a small brioche bread that pairs well.Spicy Ox Cheek Donut (£12) - Another unique dish and worth getting for the table to share. It's a fresh, fluffy donut with a sugar and spice topping and a savory ox cheek braised meat inside. Definitely something you can't get elsewhere.Seasonal Salad (£8, small, £14, large) - Pass on the salad. If you feel like being healthy, go to Pret or Pod instead. The salad was mostly root vegetables that had been soaked for too long in some kind of vinegary mixture. It was salty and acidic and pretty indelible. I had just a few bites and everyone else forced it down and later admitted it was not good. Skip the salad here - it's not only expensive but not good.All in all, the food was a little hit or miss. The best were the foie gras creme brûlée and the donut. The meal was a bit overpriced but I guess you have to pay for the view and the experience. Worth going once but don't kill yourself trying to get a reservation or waiting hours to eat here. I would come back to the bar for a drink and the view but don't think I'll be back for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Foie gras creme brulee (13)
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. House Bread (6)
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

4FpsMHxQylpgigQtsqJSSw.text: This delicious 24-hour restaurant with the most amazing view in London generally requires reservations, however there was a couple who walked in with my boyfriend and I who were able to snag a table without. That being said, their table was in the center of the room, which sort of defeats the purpose of eating here. Luckily, my boyfriend made a reservation for us about a month in advance and even then they had no dinner availability so we ended up having a pretty amazing 9:00 A.M. breakfast.When we first arrived I was a bit intimidated by the glass elevator which was going to take us up to our 40th floor dining experience. While I would not consider myself unusually afraid of heights, I really do not like or trust elevators, but despite being nervous on the way up I also found myself enjoying the view that continued to improve with each floor.Once we arrived at Duck & Waffle I was immediately impressed with the ambiance of the place. The first room is a bar area that would be perfect for a girls morning brunch or after work happy hour. The half moon bar counter overlooks numerous Spanish and pub style tables. Some have a decent view out of the window and others are more central to the room, but overall I really liked the casual atmosphere. The second room in which we were seated was the more formal dining room. We honestly had the BEST seat in the house. It was a four person table placed in the back corner of the room which meant that we were surrounded by ceiling to floor glass walls with 360 degree views from the Thames River and Tower Bridge all the way to the Shoreditch area. I ordered the Smoked Salmon Royale which includes hen's eggs, horseradish and chives. I generally don't like horseradish, but I forgot to ask for it to be left off the meal and I honestly didn't taste it at all. Either horseradish is different in England than in the United States or it simply wasn't that strong. Either way I really enjoyed my breakfast. I will say that the eggs were a bit runny compared to what I am used to and I was unprepared for the salmon to be undercooked, but I found that is the norm in England and I grew accustomed to the textures quickly. My boyfriend of coursed ordered the Duck & Waffle which is basically the same as the more common Chicken & Waffle plate. He thought it tasted very similar, but preferred the duck as he said the meat had a more gamey flavor. As a lover of the oh so cute duck and being a pescatarian, I found his description to be unappetizing, but I am willing to bet that many of you disagree with me! I also ordered a glass of apple juice. I was a little disappointed that for the price there were no refills, but it was definitely fresh squeezed and delicious!I highly recommend that you come here whether you are visiting or local, but be sure to make reservations so you have priority for a window table!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Best Table in The House!
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & Waffle and Smoked Salmon Royale

wzOj7u2zKZ8SxCvsMS3vag.text: when I visited London, this was definitely my favorite restaurant by far. first, the view is stunning regardless of how foggy London can get. the elevator ride up to the restaurant is made out of glass, which this made the view even more stunning.we ordered the duck & waffle (of course), the caramelised banana waffle, and lots of coffee. to begin with, the coffee is super strong with the perfect type of roast. i would recommend sharing something sweet and something savory with a friend so you can get a taste of both sides of duck & waffle. the duck was flavorful and juicy. the waffles were fluffy and super sweet. I loved the syrup that came with the dish as well! I had such a great time here and would definitely come again

IXrBY-I1Ei94OkYQ1nNjOw.text: Never mistake exclusivity for what is really arrogance & xenophobia.While in London on business, late events left my party of three in search of dinner and drinks. We agreed to meet at Duck & Waffle. My male friend who arrived first waited in the "security" line to say the rest of his party was arriving soon and he would like to wait for us upstairs where he could put our name on the list and get a drink. He was told no. When he questioned the guard and policy, the guard replied with a slur and told my friend to get lost. I learned of this exchange via text, and my friend was so upset that he chose not to wait for my other friend and I to arrive. He didn't want to discuss the matter any further. He decided to walk back to our flat alone. We protested and said we would all three go elsewhere, but our friend insisted we go on without him. Security allowed the two of us in, we were escorted to a table and before sitting down, I asked to speak to a manager. My three stars for Duck & Waffle are a result not only of a security guard's inflated ego that made him feel empowered to insult another person but because management took zero accountability for such actions. I was told that the restaurant has no authority over the security staff, which by that logic means restaurant management and ownership actually answer to the security guards. Who knew! It will be interesting to see how security staff choose to create upcoming menus, set prices and book special events. Admittedly I have no hard evidence of the exchange that occurred between my friend and the security guard -- only my friend's word and the firm belief he has no reason to make up such a thing or lie to me. My friend is a Mexican by birth who moved to Canada as a youth and now serves in the Canadian military as a medic; my other friend present that night is a Korean-American doctor; I am a white American woman; the guard was a black man I presume to have been English. In addition, other Yelpers have commented that they have experienced similar behavior from security staff. Full disclosure - I wish I had left after talking with management and my concerns being dismissed, but I did not. And yes, the food was lovely. We took an order of duck and waffles to go for our friend. However I wish we hadn't spent a dime - and I hope management realizes there would have been several more dimes spent if our party of three had been able to enjoy dinner together. As it stands, I will not go back, and I will encourage others not to patronize Duck & Waffle until management effectively address what has emerged as a pattern of discrimination.

VLV8FwyAZG6qplImF3ZSww.text: Duck and waffle situated near the top of the imposing heron tower has a fantastic view across the city. Really recommend going up on a sunny day. Even the 2 private lifts up offer a great viewI would never be able to afford a full dinner menu at this place but can afford to splash out on a lovely breakfastBf and I have tried to book on a weekend at a reasonable hour however it gets very booked up very quickly and quite far in advanceWe work in the city so decided to book a few days in advance for an early breakfast (it's open 24:7) at 8amWe got a seat by the window with a beautiful view on a blue skied summer morningIt was gorgeous and a great start to the morningWe both ordered a latte which was tasty and then had a look at the breakfast menuMy bf ordered the famous duck n waffle which looked amazing and he really enjoyed it. I tried the duck and it was goodI got a sweet waffle with rhubarb and ice cream and it was sooo goodOverall quite an expensive breakfast but it's worth it for the view and the food also service goodWill definitely go again for a special breakfast as a few good looking waffles that are new on the menu! Definitely recommend even tho pricey

bBRwk_Sa1t-6NUqrYf1Z8g.text: If going for the view of London, totally go for it.Duck and Waffle, I mean the dish, is good, but not as good as I expected.

oK_uAeoSdmYxsdakLwwDVA.text: Book a month out.  Really fun and trendy.  Can always walk in after midnight or 1 am.  Open 24/7

9j8aiOID3KSdfHHn024tjg.text: One of the best views in London!!I haven't been able to eat here but always go for drinks.Staff is really kind and it's an AMAZING view over London.

nm1-nO2G3hlCnEHfmEdt2g.text: First, definitely make a reservation in advance! I was surprised to see a bouncer when I got there but luckily I did have a reservation. The view is absolutely beautiful. Food is delicious as well, except we did not enjoy the foie gras very much. I'd recommend the duck and waffle, of course, the bacon-wrapped dates, and the eggs with black truffle.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Gorgeous view.
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. View!
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & waffle with egg on top and syrup on the side.

nVKVtN_UJAQkQQjor7bXSA.text: Duck & Waffle is beautiful. This is an undeniable fact. Set 40 stories above London with a panoramic view, this restaurant definitely has the "wow" factor. I wish I could say the same about the food. I came away mildly disappointed with it. I came with two other people, and we order the namesake Duck and Waffle, the Spicy Ox Doughnut, a Lobster Creme Brulee, and one of their fancy breads to boot.The Duck and Waffle was quite nice. The Duck was crispy and tender; however, I wish more was done with the Waffle. It was your standard, boring waffle. Paying 17 pounds for it, there was still a lot to be desired. The Spicy Ox Doughnut, in my opinion, was the worst dish. While the meat inside was delicious, it didn't blend well with the doughnut itself, and the sauce that it came with almost overpowered everything with its sweetness. My two companions disliked the dish so much, they stopped eating their's entirely after a few bites.The Lobster Creme Brulee was okay. It was sweet and salty, as one would expect it to be. I didn't find it to be that great, but also not bad.The bread was possibly the best part of the meal! It was delicious and hot, had a great texture and flavor to it. Also quite a lot of it for only 7 pounds.Overall, their is still a great appeal to Duck & Waffle; however, for as much as we paid, I came away a little underwhelmed by the food. I feel as if they were almost trying to be too clever with some of these dishes.

R1KewG3ydWCjFlOe1Q_waw.text: I came here while on vacation with my best friend we we're nervous because we thought we wouldn't get in with our sneakers on but they we're cool about great service & and great food I loved it. The elevator ride was the best part going up 40 floors in a glass elevator was nice!!!

gQTh4JIraFdFAR1Pj3tW-w.text: The food was delicious. Choose the classic one. But the porridge is not that good. Do book it around two months ahead. A wonderful place for seeing sunrise

7P48yQUZxRjugs2kO6X3bQ.text: This is such an amazing place; it is a must if you are in London. Of course their prices are not cheap, but the quality on their food and service is top notch. I celebrated my birthday here and they gave me a complementary birthday brownie for free, and the waitress even sang for me, which was a little bit awkward, but very nice of them.  We ordered champagne, seared octopus: raw fennel, green sauce, lemon, chili. Foie gras crème brûlée:pork crackling brioche. And of course their signature dish Duck and Waffle. Out of the food we tasted the octopus was the best. The foie gras was also very interesting, the combination sounds weird, but the flavours blend beautifully together. Regarding their signature dish the duck was divine, the waffle is waffle nothing outstanding, but toghether it makes a good dish.The view from the restaurant is also to die for, and the elevator up and down is like an attraction itself. Remember to dress nicely.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

b3tx16F5U0egihEWqVen5g.text: Incredible!!! Amazing views from top of Heron Tower, beautiful decor. And the food... Oh the food. Can only review brunch, but whay a brunch! That duck & waffle!!!! How can such simple, seemingly random, elements of food go so well together?! But it's not just their signature dish thats wonderful - eggs cocotte are also great. Sunday dessert exquisite! Bloody Marys rather spicy but loved the kick. Only thing is the price... Not cheap, not cheap at all...

FkBA-A3HHRW0sK0hxW3dgQ.text: This review is based on eating at the bar.  The pisser is that that they charge you for any additive on a drink.  If you order a drink with soda or  any additive to a,simple,vodka wire any additive it's an additional,charge.  Really. ,,tell me before.   $ 3 add for fruit juice.   Really

PAnBeeIn2HmY8TkNwHVNzQ.text: Incredible view. Amazing food. Outstanding service. My favourite brunch restaurant in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Three delicious meals - the cherry waffles, the full breakfast and, the duck & waffles
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Ordered an iced coffee off menu and they still made it fancy!

Vp8PXxwCKJa5g7rU0aSmzQ.text: Always disappoint me when they get the basics wrong...  I went with a group of six guest; our drinks got messed up and we ended up not being offered to leave our jackets and briefcases in the cloakroom.  As always the view was spectacular and the food good.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Great view, missing some details...

29oCGiNAO2ILatf_lTtMQg.text: At first, I couldn't imagine what the duck and waffle combination might taste like. Now, I realise that it's all in the maple syrup sauce. Don't get me wrong -- the duck confit and waffle were both astounding as well. Perfectly cooked and crisp. However, it was the sauce that did the magic. It blended so well with the richness of the duck yet gave it an almost fruity touch that made the dish go down just perfectly. The venue is very posh with a great view of the city. Definitely a perfect place for any type of events. However, I did feel like the music was too loud at times. Service was good. Highly recommend it if you can get a reservation -- or just walk in past midnight!

GP1ZmLU_UJ2NRRIrI4cFHg.text: Get up early. Yes. Eaaarly. Early enough to watch the sunrise and you will have the most beautiful views while eating breakfast! If you're lucky and it's a clear day you'll see the sky transformed with key London landmarks to admire while you dine. Obviously the duck and waffle is fantastic - and this is coming from someone who really doesn't appreciate a waffle. A breakfast isn't a good breakfast without a good coffee and lucky there's is strong and pretty decent. The pancakes and french toast are also absolutely delicious, loaded with fresh berries and not too sweet. It can be a little pricey but it's well worth it!

qxBBN5VLyoeZpWhZ7BkblA.text: Amazing view!  Food was alright, nothing fancy for the price but service is not up to par for the location.  They need some major work on their service skill with the staffs.  We came at 11:15pm for seven people, the hostess asked if we were there for dinner and it was a plate per person (wtf?!)  So we waited  for our table, had to ask her again for a table 15 mins later. Got a table and the place was not busy, so why make us wait for long?  Ordered food and drinks, half of the drinks came so we asked about the other drinks, they gave us double of what we ordered and told us they'd comp the extra drinks but ended up charging us for them.  So we told the gentleman we got charged double and had him remove the extra drinks.  He came back with the new bill and tossed it on the table.  Not sure what the regular menu looked like but the late menu was not impressive.  Two appertizers, 6 entrees and a few desserts.  If you want to impress someone, pay for overpriced, crappy food then come here.If you want a decent food with a decent service, stay away from the place like a plague.  The service staffs did not deserve the 12.5% gratuity that they added to our bill and we usually leave at least 20% for a decent service.Such a disappointment for a nice place.  My recommendation is to dress up like a millionaire and maybe they will treat you better.

fwZkxo9FVk72GAwkj2qZ8A.text: good views and good food. this is more important. I went here for a birthday dinner and between the five we ordered as much as we could and shared it all.The duck & waffle dish is a hard dish to share as it is quite a small portion. It was tasty and strange, but something that you should order.I was a big fan of the ham hock too and their range of cocktails keep you in a merry mood.

dubcSEokT2lgWB4ThJp7Bg.text: Fabulous view of London 40 floors up and guaranteed if you book when a table is available next to the window! But patrons beware, as this window seat is not a place to linger for hours, since reservations are a bit closely spaced to accommodate another group as soon as the previous table is done with their meal. At first I thought the duck & waffle platter was gimmicky, but when it arrived and it was time to enjoy, it's actually a nice mix of the savory and the sweet. The view is still the best part of the entire experience, even though the 6 of us enjoyed our somewhat unique breakfast/brunch, and the mimosa's were delightful.

zdPWm4EfctH1MmuUcIjwFA.text: Their dinner might be way above my budget, but it's carb heaven: try their ox cheek doughnut or the duck & waffle (you just have to) for an incredible mix of sweet and savoury, perfectly executed in their mushrooms on toast dessert, too.
