A4ayhz5rF-VXQTYrHb84rQ.text: 3am on a Tuesday and we took an Uber to get here only to be told from the bouncer that my husband's shorts were not acceptable. My shorts are okay are since they are "tailored". Is this a joke?

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Not acceptable shorts

vQo9TCWb9BhoJOBfErKh2g.text: Everything was superb. My children (ages 9 & 13) also loved it. Staff were exceptional, views amazing and meal was unforgettable. We'll be back!

Jsy1hq8rV-IMV2hyUN8zgQ.text: My boyfriend booked this breakfast 3 weeks in advance so we could watch the sunrise from the 40th floor. The views were incredible!Pro Tip: don't just try to rock up without reservations and give a bad review because you're not seated. It makes you sound pretentious. Onto the food - I'm an American and therefore a longstanding fan of Fried Chicken and Waffles (especially from Cafeteria in NYC - Yum!). I was a bit skeptical of the duck, but was completely pleasantly surprised! The skin was crispy, the meat was tender and their mustard maple syrup sounded terrible, but is just syrup with mustard seed in it (very good). We also shared the side of bacon, which came out in hearty, delicious slices. It was a bit confusing because it seems as if everyone is your server, rather than one designated person. However, because everyone was so friendly, it really didn't matter in the end.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. View from our table

ME9G1iL5IV55-Q2PW1ZXFA.text: When my boyfriend ordered Duck Congee, I was like, weird choice bro. He didn't know what congee was; I knew but had never had it. It seemed very left field. But oh my god, it was sublime. The creaminess of the rice, the moist crispiness of the duck confit, the flavour hit of the stock, the crunch of the hazelnuts, the zap of the sriracha. Seriously, this is one of the best meals I've tasted in a long time. It also looked great, reminiscent of a ramen bowl (at least before my boyfriend mixed it all up). I had major food envy, but I did also enjoy my own dish, which was ox cheek benedict, a twist on the classic, with a waffle replacing the muffin and ox instead of ham, though still with the egg and hollandaise sauce. It was tasty and I ate every morsel. We also enjoyed our drinks. They had a good selection of spirits. My main issue was that the cocktail menu was entirely vegetable-inspired. I love an inventive cocktail - in fact, I'd been dying to try the blue cheese and chocolate martini I'd heard D&W did - but given my aversion to veg, there was no way I was having something infused with caramelized red onion or with a roasted red pepper hanging out in the glass. Ick. I had a dirty martini, and it was just fine, if less eccentric. Plus, we had a corner table with a great view on both sides. We were lucky with the weather, which was supposed to be overcast but actually was fairly blue skies punctuated with large fluffy clouds. So why not five stars? The main reason is waiting around. We (and presumably most people there) booked a couple of months in advance, we arrived on time, but we ended up spending about 25 minutes waiting in the holding area bar to be seated. I wouldn't have minded this too much if it had been communicated that there was a wait, but I was assuming we'd be seated any minute so didn't order a drink or relax. Then when we were at our table, service was quite slow. The food itself arrived fast enough, but when we spent a while waiting for our order to be taken, our plates to be cleared, the bill brought to us, etc. We weren't in a huge rush (and I would certainly have hated to have whizzed through it), but it did feel sometimes like we were being neglected. The menu was also a bit confusing - there were several sections and it was unclear to us whether we could have ordered from any of them as a suitable 'main course' (they were all in the same price bracket), or whether some were more starters, sides, or tapas-y alternatives. However, overall it was great. Duck & Waffle delivered what we are so often looking for: delicious, unexpected new experiences.

GeMVOXl1hj1a0bR1adEPbg.text: Great ambiance, great location, great views! The food is good though not outstanding (except for the bread; both the garlic and rosemary as well as the artichoke and parmesan - fantastic). We didn't know who our server was. Many different staff members came to check on us through various points of the evening which made us feel taken care of, but a bit confused on who to ask for various things. Service was great all around. Since this place is 24/7 I'm thinking I'll show up in the middle of the night without a reservation just to try it.

isqBKDbfyZ87OHXgKGbyQw.text: The view is amazing - make sure you book a table before sunset so you can enjoy it during daytime, sunset and night!The cocktails are quite good, though pretty pricey.The food is also excellent, though the egg on our duck and waffle was quite overcooked so we asked for a new one which they replaced (after about 15 minutes...) and comped from the bill, which was nice.We ordered:- Beef tartare - good, but not the best I've ever had. I would skip it next time.- Puy lentils - the standout small plate - definitely recommend these! Hearty and savory.- Glazed lamb breast - The pieces of lamb were a bit dry and tough, but the overall dish was served on lettuce with vegetables that were really tasty. - Seasonal vegetables - the surprise winner. Beets, goat cheese, radicchio, carrots, seeds - tons of fresh, deliciously seasoned vegetables paired with a yummy goat cheese.- Duck & Waffle - like I said, the egg was overcooked, but when we got a runny yolk, it was outstanding. I see why this dish and restaurant are so popular.- Miso glazed rabbit - REALLY good. Don't be frightened by the rabbit - the miso glaze makes it taste like chicken or any other plain white meat. What's cool about this place is its location, view and the fact that it's open 24 hours.

dtQnqK9zcflJo-TeWJtZGw.text: This place was the highlight of my trip to London. It sits atop the Heron Tower and provides impeccable views. My GF and I both had the duck and waffle and a bloody mary for breakfast (7:45 am reservation).The food was freaking fantastic. I'm from the south US and chicken and waffles are a staple around here. This blew my mind. Absolutely perfect meal. It was 15 pounds and about 14 pounds for the bloody mary which was fine.You must make a reservation between day/evening hours but it's 24/7 and I'm not sure how accessible it is off-peak. But making the reservation and going to this place is a must for any person traveling to London. It was truly amazing and I have been telling everyone back home about it!

DcQBTgwC0ovEagtj_bElew.text: Aside from the view, I found Duck & Waffle to be underwhelming.  It might have been that the restaurant has been overhyped by some friends and colleagues, but I've had better, especially for the prices.  I did come in knowing there'd be a premium for the amazing views of London.  We had the roasted octopus, duck and waffle and the sea bass.  Everything was fine, but nothing to write home about.  Would have at least given the place 3 stars but after being met with attitude from our waiter, I can't justify giving it another star.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Awesome view
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

TpXn2ZtstacL7gdiOGMhfA.text: Excellent view. We had duck&waffle and was as good as we expected. And the beetroot was a surprise. Highly recommend.

RiDIqq3E_TJSgii7ev8d6Q.text: The view is nice but the waiters were terrible. For that kind of supposedly high-end restaurant/bar, one would expect quality service.Moreover, we had the two non-alcoholic cocktails, and although they looked good, they were barely drinkable.

XLAosBZ-osoQJQc4UxnqLw.text: If you ever go to London, YOU'VE GOT to go to Duck & Waffle!Located in one of the highest buildings of this beautiful city, you will enter the door to Duck & Waffle on the ground-floor and be greeted by two handsome young men. Make sure you get a reservation in advance (around 3-4 months for weekend-spots at least if you would want to sit near the window) so you can pass those two with a smile.After that the elevator takes you to the 40th floor within seconds - that only is one hell of an adventure since everything is made out of glass and you will have to catch your breath because of the speed.If you reach the final floor, you enter a beautiful restaurant that is bright and decorated with big marvelous chandeliers! The friendly staff guides you to your table and you will have an amazing view over the whole city - from London Tower Bridge up until St. Pauls Cathedral! Not that this wouldn't be enough - but if you really want to make special memories, either match your visit with sunrise or sunset to have an extra spectacular view. - I promise getting up so early will definitely pay off in that case! ;-) Sitting there and enjoying the most outstanding view, the food will just top up your pleasure! You can either indulge in one of the very famous homemade "Duck & Waffle" (not just for breakfast but also served throughout the whole day) paired with delicious coffee or go for something more classic like a typical Full English with a Bloody Mary by the side. Yum!Thinking of that I would like to beam myself back to that weekend.. We really had a blast at Duck & Waffle - there was not one moment we didn't feel welcome and the staff really made sure we had everything we need. With regard to that I think it's ok that you will have to spend a little more money that usual on a breakfast. Having said that I also have in mind that food is more pricy in London compared to cities like Berlin. But investing a little something will redeem you with amazing memories if you choose to come see this place.I most definite wish I could go there more often and I can't wait for the next time I come to London to come by again! I'M IN LOVE!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

meFQ6iu6gHg4oZWko8NHcA.text: Duck & Waffle is located on the 40th floor. It is open 24 hours. Did I get your attention yet?I came around 2 AM for a late dinner on a weekday. There was no wait but it was definitely filled with people in the bar and dining area. The two areas are separate so there are different vibes. The bar area is loud with music and people speaking amongst themselves over the music. It is very lively! Great spot to grab drinks with friends. The dining area has a great view of the city. My boyfriend and I ordered:--Duck Waffle: Better than chicken and waffles. Duck is fried and cooked perfectly. I usually don't like duck but I loved this! It didn't have that fatty duck taste to me so I was able to eat this. Waffle was crunchy and nicely toasted on the outside and soft and warm in the inside. Take a piece of duck, waffle and the sunny side up egg. Drizzle some warm maple syrup and you have the perfect bite. --Roasted Octopus: We met someone in the elevator and she suggested we order this. We were not disappointed. The octopus was super soft and tender. Loved the chorizo and roasted potatoes it came with. --Foie Gras Creme Brûlée: This dish is amazing. Foie gras + creme brûlée is already a pretty good concept. You get a lot of foie gras compared to portion sizes in the U.S. So creamy. Order it!--Apple Toffee Pancakes: We ordered this for dessert and it was my second favorite thing on the menu. It actually comes with waffles, which is even better because you have that crunch from the waffle. I love the warm apples and honeycomb in this dish. Definitely a good pair with the cinnamon ice cream and warm waffle. Tips:--Make a reservation because this place can get fully booked--Ask for a table with a view

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Foie Gras Creme Brulee
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Roasted Octopus
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck Waffle

HLnu_LLMQblgb_9Ejexc_A.text: Well.. originally I was meant to try and book a dinner. To find out that for the next month or so it was fully booked. then inquired about breakfast. And had to wait for 3 weeks to have breakfast at 7 AM. Well. It was definitely worth it. After seeing multiple hypes across social platforms and from friends, I knew there was something that was drawing everyone to have that experience of 'duck and waffle' at Duck & Waffle. On the top floor of one of London's tallest buildings, within the busiest hub of the city, we followed it through the same entrance as Sushisamba. Followed by nice blue white rustic china tiles, multicolored kitsch chandeliers scattered across the loft and brass embellishments. Escorted to our table next to the sky high ceiling overlooking the view of the city 'waking up', we decided to kickstart our morning with a few peculiar classics. We ordered the ox cheek benedict waffel, the signature duck & waffle, and decided to share the banana brulee as a desert. We also ordered fresh mint tea and fresh squeezed orange juice to accompany our dishes. The positive experience was the friendly, yet quirky professional service, the food coming fairly soon and waiters making sure that we were satisfied with our service. The food was delicious. The savory dishes went beyond my expectations. The duck & waffle consists of waffles accompanied by a crispy duck leg and an egg on top, to be seasoned with maple syrup that includes mustard seeds. The ox cheek Benedict includes cloudy poached eggs with tender meat and spicy chili sauce.  We were both extremely satisfied with our orders. I vaguely regret ordering the 'standard' sounding banana brulee. As from looking at pictures, the other two options including full elvis sounded much more elaborate. The sweet pancake was good. though nothing special. The biggest disappointment was the fresh mint tea that was not properly heated nor did not oxidize in the end as it is meant to. The 'freshly' squeezed orange juice was not that fresh. The other minor note that this venue should take into avvount is that all the dishes were served a bit too cold, as the venue is so sky high, the dishes cool down faster. Overall this experience was amazing. I could not have had a more romantic breakfast with fabulous service. The dishes are not even that pricey, perhaps vaguely above average spends for young professional newbies in London. The drinks on the other hand were overprices considering the quality of what they offer. Tip? Just order water. Will I be going again? Perhaps for another sweet waffle with stunning sky high views. It's open 24/7. I'd be pretty curious to know who dines at 3:30 AM..

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Before sunrise
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. The classics
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Just a breakfast..

oAI63xzgaubqTXEtmaAJtQ.text: Amazing Food with amazing Views!My cousin from London spoke highly of this place, one of her faves as she says.  I was really excited to try it, and as "tourist" I love that it had a view! Located in the Heron Tower.  Ok so the view is amazing, but the food was as well.  We ordered spicy ox cheeks doughnuts, foie gras creme brûlée (thats right) fillet of angus beef carpaccio and special house bread to start.  OMG a party of goodness in my mouth.  Everything we started off with was divine, made me excited for the main event.  For our main we all got the Duck with waffles (: the restaurant is not named after it for nothing.  The duck was cooked well the waffle was nice.  I would order it again for sure! The service was good, I did order a wine that never came but they were on the ball refilling our waters and clearing the table.  I was enjoying the food that the wine didn't matter.  Yes its pricey, not a everyday place to go to but worth it!  If Im back in London I will  come back.

Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

1fKqRt-iUmqfWpUIw5G9WA.text: Duck & Waffle is one of the first restaurants which made it on my London's bucket list. I had meant to visit for months but never went ahead to book a table. With my parents visit coinciding with my mum's birthday, I knew it was about time I finally stepped foot in Heron Tower's lifts for dinner in the sky!After a swift journey from the floor to the clouds (actually a lot less scary than I thought it would be), we were greated by the most amazing of views. D&W definitely doesn't oversell on this point; it's simply breath-taking.The rest of the experience though? It might be because, having read so many good things about the restaurant, I had really high expectations, but in the end, I wasn't exactly blown away by it. We had a good time at Duck & Waffle. Good but not great. I can't really pinpoint what it was, but there was something missing for me to be truly impressed. I was glad I finally got to visit and try all those iconic dishes, but I'm not sure I'll get out of my way to visit again. Or maybe for breakfast (just imagine those views at sunrise!).-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------What: One of London's most acclaimed restaurants, with the most breath-taking of views, serving up its Modern-European-with-a-twist signature dishes 24/7.How much: Count £40-50/person with a drink and dessertWhy: The views are the #1 reason to head to Duck & Waffle and you have to be aware of the fact that you'll definitely be paying for it too. A lot of attention given to details, especially when it comes to presentation. Anything that sounds like a very unlikely dish (Foie gras crème brûlée, BBQ pigs ears, Duck & Waffle...) would actually be on my must-order list.cakeandwhisky.wordpress.…

eSUXmtTpfkyhJhGEOn-wXw.text: We did not make reservations, just threw caution to the wind and it worked out for us. This place is amazing to say the least! Located 40 stories high over looking al of london. Great food, drink, ambiance, really bloody excellent! Make sure to reserve a table far in advance and look forward to dining here. I loved it!

W-O_l6XNZDaAn1JzCV-ogQ.text: We got major attitude from the door guys, and then, upon arrival upstairs (we only wanted to get a drink, maybe a little something sweet to end our night and enjoy the view), were completely ignored.  We watched other groups who had come in after us get served.  We watched servers take photos of, and with, groups of people.  It's definitely a photo worthy spot, especially as we watched a storm move through London - that was cool; but I'd really rather you actually, you know, serve customers, rather than take selfies with your new drunk friends.It's actually just as well - every single drink on the menu read more like a salad than a cocktail.  We sat around for 20 minutes, and then left.

RzxpIhmxMariLCU9d-v52Q.text: I came to the Duck & Waffle, convinced that it would not live up to its reputation, and I would be disappointed. I was wrong, wrong, wrong. I absolutely loved this place!On arrival, we were greeted by a cheerful chap in the lobby, who checked the booking, then directed us the elevator. Great ride up the 40 floors the restaurant in the glass lift, with great views towards the west of the city. There was a really nice bar area before you got to the restaurant itself, with an excellent view of the Gherkin building close by. Again the reservation was checked, before being directed to the table. We were led to a great table by the window, looking out to the Olympic Stadium to the East, and the Emirates Stadium to the North. I already loved the atmosphere here. It was much smaller and intimate than I thought it would be.I was not sure whether to go with the full English, the Haddock or the signature Duck & Waffle. I decided to go with the English, thinking that by not having the Duck & Waffle, I'd have a good excuse to come back. When it came the breakfast looked great. I had already offered my black pudding, as I do not like it. When I saw the black pudding though, I thought I would give it a taste, as it looked like no black pudding, I have ever had. It was delicious, and reminded me very much of haggis. The eggs were over medium, and perfect. The bacon was crisp and non-greasy. I enjoyed everything about it. The service was very attentive whilst we ate, with the water being continuously topped up.This place is already on my must do again list!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Looks yummy

TOUhy8sCCpAjL8x9bWwayg.text: I love this place! I don't particularly enjoy the food but the views and decor are amazing! It is worth going for a drink and appy. I find that the food is ok mostly because each course is 80% bread and that's not what I am there for. Try the Foie Gras Creme Brûlée!

n2XTTOrQFjqtExeCihkGbw.text: The main attract is the spectacular views, and while the food is pretty good, you will spend most of the time looking out the windows!It's not cheap; and the cuisine isn't *quite* up to what you'd expect for similar money, without the added bonus of the location.Yes, duck and waffle is on the menu; and yes I'd recommend trying it.One note of caution. People I've been here with for lunch have more than once had unfortunate reactions later, that meant their afternoons were spent in the loo! Maybe they just got unlucky & and it was coincidence.

wu0gjgi76rrEEFqsRSLXTg.text: Nothing horrible about eating dinner on the 40th floor with a gorgeous view! We had a fabulous experience here during our trip to London in November. We also met a group of locals who surprised us with a glass of champagne. After that kind gesture we joined them for more drinks and dessert after. Everyone was extremely friendly and we can't wait to go back soon!

oA9NuYe6I9cM9Lc_sEsPDw.text: Food was delicious and the views were stellar!Service is on point. Went here for a birthday brunch and had the classic duck and waffle. The duck was tender, and the syrup for the waffle tasted amazing (not your usual syrup). It is a little on the pricey end but you're not just paying for the food. On a side note - the portion size was a little smaller than I expected so had to order another dish which we shared to feel satisfactorily full. Would I go again? For a special occasion - yes.On another occasion I came here just for drinks - their cocktails are fabulous!

TuE8q34Q2ldK9kViwvrp0A.text: Brunch with spectacular London views! This is one of the most special places for breakfast/brunch in London. Super fast lift and beautiful interiors. When comes to food, the famous duck & waffle dish is good with excellent combined duck & waffle that melt in mouth. The portions though are a bit small and everything is overpriced. Combined with the fact that you have to book at least 1,5 month earlier to secure a place here, it is a bit waste of time & energy for an average brunch menu.

vGba9lyrQpgeZy50gAt8Qw.text: Celebrated my son's birthday this evening with the family. Chose this Restaurant  based on yelp reviews. As usual Yelpers hit home runs. Started with bacon wrapped dates, rosemary garlic bread, and whole bunch of other apps I can't even pronounce!All delicious.I had the duck and waffle for my main. Great.Our entire dining experience was superb, pricey but worth it.

5IvVq1t7cVeSnGh_kMykQg.text: Worst customer service I have ever had.Go to the McDonald nearby, better food and better service.0/10 recommend  this place, worst bouncers I have ever seen and food quality depends on the night.Avoid if you have a chance.

853Bsek9x-V1Ypsh3O9GZA.text: Reserve in advance! This place is very popular and fun for the ambiance and amazing view. We only came for a quick bite of brunch. The namesake dish duck and waffle is a must. The duck confit is tender, waffle is fluffy and crispy and the mustard seed syrup was perfect.

0e2M80MWXhxVf4C8BudFXw.text: After a long Thursday night pub crawl, my friends and I realized that we hadn't eaten dinner yet and were hungry. So we decide to hop into an Uber for some delicious duck and waffles. We arrived around 11:20 PM and encountered one of the rudest, most stuck-up bouncers I have ever met. There is literally a red velvet rope in front of the entrance and the guy will turn his nose up at you if you don't have a reservation. Apparently they don't take walk-ins until midnight. Seemed pretty silly to us considering how many people were leaving the restaurant and how close to midnight it was. We were pretty annoyed but head off to a nearby bar to grab more drinks while waiting (what we really wanted to find was a diner but we were unsuccessful and still very hungry).We get back again right around midnight and the rude bouncer is replaced with a nicer bouncer! He immediately lets us in and we get in the elevator up. Amazing view and trendy decor in the lounge area. There's a 15 minute wait for a table so we sit at the tables by the bar, order some drinks, Crispy Polenta, and BBQ-Spiced Crispy Pig Ears. Before we get our food and drinks, our table is ready! We head into the dining room and the loud music and dim lighting is replaced by a quiet dining area with more light, amazing views of London, and tons of people eating at midnight. It blows my mind that so many people want to eat meat at this time of day.We're seated, all order the Duck & Waffle, and enjoy our appetizers. Those polenta balls, yum yum. The pig ears were a little overseasoned, but had a nice crunch. The Duck & Waffle was delicious. A delicate half waffle with duck confit, an egg, and delicious syrup. I don't like chicken and waffles, but duck and waffles is excellent. The waffle absorbs a bunch of the grease and the syrup balances out the duck flavor. Yum yum. The food is overpriced, but you're paying for the view. Service is also excellent (rude bouncer aside). Would come back, but earlier in the day and only with a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. The view
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & Waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. BBQ-Spiced Crispy Pig Ears

mfJ39p-j-gbcDexdDo_41A.text: Overpriced and pretentious. Food was average. Drinks weren't anything special, but at least our waitress was great!

9wlQhz_fHIYBi8PBNoqjpA.text: We ordered the doughnut and duck & waffle. I wouldn't say the food were amazing but they were special and worthy to be tried. The night view was pretty good. Nevertheless, I did not understand why the manager would be too mean and kind of forcing people to finish soon.

i3V33q43Hjyah4HNpUCpbw.text: The view was amazing. The service was fine, most staff were quite friendly and welcoming. I do dislike having someone constantly sweeping when I'm eating, I find it odd and disruptive. But that's just me. Ok ok The food.... this is the part you want to read about. It was just ok and a bit lack luster. We made reservations in advance with 1.5 hr for lunch. I was expecting it to be over crowded as we arrived early and people were waiting. Oddly that was not the case, the restaurant was pretty empty. Ordered pigs ears--an acquired taste for some, but deliciously crunchy and well seasoned. It was served in a paper bag. Not really aesthetically interesting or pleasing, but still tasty. I don't get it. Put it on a plate please. The beef cheek donut? A disappointment. It tasted ok, a bit sweet. The sauce it came with smelled so yummy but was also overly sweet. The beef was tender but it tasted like regular shredded beef and the donut just wasn't very impressive. Donut was lack luster and flat. Not as good as I had hoped. Duck and Waffles. The signature waffle dish was a real disappointment. It was a waffle wanna be that just didn't show up. It just didn't have any distinction to it. It was not a good waffle. It was a bit dense and had no flavor to it. Not crispy on the outside or fluffy. Imagine a fortune cookie flavored waffle that's what it tasted like. The accompanying maple syrup with mustard seeds was also disappointing, the maple syrup had no maple syrup flavor just overly sweet. If the mustard seed flavoring has been infused it may have been better. Add a dash of salt or something it just tasted like pure sugar.The duck, first bite was really good. It has some five spice powder flavoring but it was a bit over fried for my taste, and a bit heavy. Halfway through the duck leg I was done. It just no longer held my taste buds, it wasn't a must keep eating this duck. It was ok good first bite and the more I ate the less interesting it became. Something was missing from the duck. Come for the view. Don't bother with their signature dish, try something else? They had a delicious tea recommendation for the waffle.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Beef cheek donut.
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Pig ears in a bag
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle

zchsS4rP8ashrP81uh3LNQ.text: Great dinner and fun evening out. Amazing view out over London. Hope to go back soon but have to book in advance.

_ZjnNMVokXAlLOerIZnLiA.text: I usually don't leave reviews for places I haven't fully experienced- BUT I feel the need. We were excited to try this place, made sure we were well dressed, got the Uber over, and got in the rather lengthy line. Doormen surveyed the line multiple times, and let VERY few people in. After waiting for a while, one of them came out and said "no one can come in tonight- we have a private event!"Some people questioned why he even let us wait, and he yelled "just go!" And shooed people away. Horrible way to treat people who want to patronize your business!

X8Zc0WmzCoeprSOrtwytTw.text: This is a great way to eat. High above the city, open 25 hours and a really really cool menu. I have been here on dates and for business lunches. The view is so incredible and the staff are fun and helpful. Amamamamamamamazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Close up of how excited I am to be here

QVeJXsX_J18mqRS_5bWGGw.text: This place is absolutely not the place you want to go if you're looking for a good time. You will be let down 100%! Do not waste your time, honestly. Poor service and they hate Americans.

qSDRiCDYltbyQoEXZyoqHw.text: Duck & Waffle is a must go for anyone dropping by London, or even for a local in search of an amazing view of the London skyline while eating some delectable bites.First off, the view. In the bar area which serves as the precursor to the seated area, you have an amazing view of the skyline, including the famous Gherkin or "pickle" and the sight is framed by the numerous chandeliers that hang in front of the clear glass wall. In the dining area, I suggest requesting a seat by the edge -- this will give you a beautiful view of the city.The interior design is another gorgeous aspect of the restaurant, especially at the bar area. (have I mentioned the chandeliers yet?) Large collections of glass bottles are grouped together in giant circles on the ceilings and the bar area itself is a delight to look at. The food itself was also very good. I recommend their signature dish, the duck and waffle. The drinks themselves were also very good. I particularly liked the Pine Needle Lemonade, which is a gin drink with hints of elderflower; it was a minty, refreshing combo. The Breakfast Fizz was also an interesting concoction. This one is a Grey Goose mixture tasting of grape juice fused with a hint of burnt toast. The latter taste is definitely one of the quirkier ones I've tried in an alcoholic drink.Overall, the restaurant is a trendy, although upscale place that I definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast Fizz (left) and Pine Needle Lemonade (right)
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Ox cheek donut
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Pork and apple corndog

IrxXHhFIh27Wwo8_Jx4Shg.text: While the view is simply spectacular, I found the food a mixed bag.  I ordered the oxtail doughnut and the pea ravioli.  Honestly, I had no idea what to expect with the oxtail doughnut so perhaps theirs is fabulous for those who enjoy that, but to meet it was an odd combination.  The coating of bread was a bit dense and dry with a meat that was tender but under seasoned sitting in a jam that was not sweet enough for me (but appreciate that it was probably natural).  So I short I wish I wouldn't have ordered the oxtail doughnut.  I enjoyed the pea ravioli. It was quite the unusual flavor.  Main complaint was not being given a spoon to finish off the broth.

VUnUih9k4rEXq2t3DqraYg.text: We booked a table at 22:30. Staff was really friendly. The food was okay but don't expect too much. But overall it was worth it because of the astonishing view! I would recommend this place.

g23oAGjEk9_7Ob64E8k6wQ.text: Ok screw this place and their dress code.  I came here to get a sticky toffee pudding and the jerkoff at the door analyzed my outfit and made a comment.  Tourists should avoid.  What kind of place call itself duck and waffle and has a strict dress code? They didn't have a dress code at the Michelin restaurant we ate at last night.

j0Zz-wc5DwUhPzcky8TbCA.text: Went for the duck and waffle breakfast.  Simply amazing.  BTW...  We we're the first ones there.  Great times and excellent views of London

B63ZTD2ucI3M_2lIv0ZgOA.text: Customer Service - Snotty and Discriminating.Our flight landed Heathrow Airport at around 9PM and got to our hotel close to 10:30PM. We heard about Duck and Waffle being 24/7 and headed straight there after dropping our luggage in the hotel. I wore jeans and chucks. Point taken, they have a dress code. The bouncer, however, was obnoxious in pointing that out that no jeans and sneakers were allowed after 4PM. When we tried to ask a question, he was disrespectfully ignoring us. We gave this restaurant a benefit of the doubt. We dressed up and the security guy now tells us that they're completely full. When we told him we were willing to wait, the security guy tells us it'll take a couple of hours before we can get in and implied it was pointless to stay. We do understand it was a long weekend but this could have been prevented when the bouncer the previous day answered us respectfully. By the way, we saw some guests leave the restaurant in their sneakers.After writing an honest bad review, the director of their parent company responded. He explained that they are in the process of reviewing their policies. To quote him:"One of which is clarifying the dress code, (currently Designer Trainers like Prada, Dolce Gabana, etc are acceptable), with the ownership and amending as they will allow, addressing attitude and ensuring the Team understands that our guest needs to be treated with hospitality 100% of the time."To make up, we were given a reservation. The management and staff were very gracious giving us VIP treatment from the time we got in until we headed our way out. The director paid for our dinner as well. Two things we've noticed: the door staff were a lot less intimidating, also, we saw a lot of people in their jeans as well as non-designer slippers at 8PM which gives me the impression that the dress code is quite arbitrary. You'd be lucky if the bouncer likes you. :)Food - Hit and MissThe best thing we've had would be the Bacon-Wrapped Dates. My wife and I both agree on that.The roasted octopus. It was good but not great.The ox-tail doughnut. Well, I appreciate the attempt on creativity. However, it's trying too hard. Really.The duck and waffle. I like their twist of the Southern Chicken and Waffle. I worked with clients in the Southern part of the US so I love Southern food. My wife, however, was underwhelmed. Between the two of us, she's the duck fanatic whether it's Asian or European style cooking. She did not like it at all.Overall experienceWe thank the management for paying for our meal and giving us VIP treatment. But overall, it was not worth the trouble. If you do want a good view of London, buy a ticket from the London Eye and take the 30-minute ride. If you want good food, find it elsewhere. Some place where they could give a good customer service. But if you do insist, make sure you make a reservation even if most of the reviews you see in Yelp say they got in without one. Second, make sure you go with the dress code. If you insist on wearing sneakers, make sure the brand is loud enough to see - Prada, Dolce and Gabana, etc. By the way, my wife saw some people head out of the restaurant in their Converse. Basically, just pray the door staff likes you.

eY0hI8IU9Js9qoPyT278Fw.text: Breathtaking view, not a flip flop in sight. Try the earth cocktail- it's like licking a rock covered in slimy algae or smelling the bottom of a dirty fish tank! The only thing that could've improved it would have been if it was served in a miniature composter, with the addition of a live snail. The service was great! Selfie heaven! Don't forget your selfie stick!

TA_ZVR7qelqu6ivEt8xScw.text: I had high expectations for Duck & Waffle and luckily it did not disappoint. Went for a friend's birthday and it was an awesome experience from start to finish! From the super friendly, entertaining staff (who were not at all snooty - as you might expect in a more well to do place like this), to the insane views of London, to the random, but yummy cocktail choices - mine had pumpkin in it!, to the atmosphere, to the food, I can't knock any of it. I got the Duck and Waffle - obvious choice, I know ;) - but it was worth it.TIPS:1) If it's winter and, like me, you feel the cold easily, DO NOT choose the seat right by the window. You, like me, will freeze.2) If you want to keep partying, but have nowhere to go since most clubs close at 3am in London, this place is great for watching the sunrise with a loved one - or anyone really -, has great DJs and at that time, you can generally just make a reservation online minutes before you rock up there and get in with no problem.ENJOY!

nCvnVDZ5l_z-BLhdDkePvQ.text: The non-Asian version of Sushisamba.In short, a good place to bring out-of-towners. This place feels slightly less upscale (pretentious?) than Sushisamba. The common ownership is obvious since the decor and layout is almost exactly the same in the restaurant. I prefer the lounge area at Sushisamba, as there is more room without a giant bar in the middle.Food was generally forgettable. The few starters we tried were the ox-cheek donuts, grilled octopus, flatbread and the pig ears. The pig ears served in a brown bag were nice to have while we were having drinks in the lounge as we waited for our table. The signature dish, however, (duck confit + duck egg + waffle) was pretty great. I love chicken and waffles, so of course I loved duck and waffles. As my friend once asked, "Why would you ever choose chicken when you can choose duck?" Correct.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. signature dish

XZNAk0vBUtUxDdu53Vp-PQ.text: This review is strictly for customer service. We attempted to go to Duck and Waffle but couldn't even make it in the door. We had a morning flight out of Heathrow and wanted to hit up Duck and Waffle since they start serving breakfast at 6 am. We tried calling for reservations the night before, but after trying to navigate the complex phone directory, then put on hold, we gave up never speaking to anyone. We decided to try in the morning thinking surely at 6 am they would have a table for 2 available. When we arrived (approximately 6:30 am), there was a bouncer at the entrance stating no one without a reservation was allowed in the building. So we couldn't even talk to a hostess about a table.

dph6rXsH5rydKc8A_ZPfzg.text: Duck and Waffle was one of those places I had researched and oggled over their food for quite some time. When my parents had decided to come and visit me from Australia, I knew this would be a fun place to take them.I emailed the restaurant and asked about their menu and when was the best time to come in and try the bacon wrapped dates. They were extremely helpful, and assisted me in making a reservation for my mothers 50th birthday lunch. I had asked if we could have a seat with a nice view.Well upon arrival I was instantly in awe. This place is amazing. The views are incredible, the bar you walk through on arrival is unbelievable. I honestly couldn't believe how amazing it all was. We were guided to our table which was directly facing the windows. The waitress even wished my mother a happy birthday. The menu houses some items which were a bit of a shock to my parents, as they haven't experienced the sweet and savory style dishes that Duck and Waffle offer. We ordered sharing platters, and as they were bought out, each platter gained an 'ooooo' , 'ahhhh' from the three of us. The highlight of my meal was the pigs ears and of course the bacon wrapped dates. My parents thoroughly enjoyed the duck and waffle. After all our delicious meals were eaten and we'd passed on the dessert, the waitress bought out the cutest little plate with roasted sugared almonds, marshmallow, and some rose water cream with some chocolates, with a candle. Which was a nice surprise.The whole experience was simply amazing, and I cannot wait to have another visitor to take back here. The food is very reasonably priced for the location and the entire experience.

VR0Q1VKUQKt4M5fF-cv3fw.text: If I could give zero star I would. What a poser restaurant with absolutely poser service. Went in the morning for breakfast only to be denied access because I had no reservation, which is understandable but then I tried to make one and that was denied as well. Came back in the evening for a drink but was denied again by the bouncer who apparently held an discriminatory opinion against my sneakers ( I am sure if they were designer I'd have no issue at all). Is it because we are students and look young that we are automatically labelled as undeserving to a classy restaurant that is supposed to prove that class precisely by showing welcome to everyone? Definitely not a place I'd ever revisit even if I could. Oh I am sorry I wasn't able to write a splendid review on your fabulous food since I was never granted the regal access to try it. Good luck you poser service team looking to pose out.

HxFtl7m_v7zeZwHZlVsiyQ.text: Get an early breakfast here to see the sunrise! The elevator rides up and down are exhilarating. The duck & waffle dish is tasty and worth ordering, but the food is overall very pricey. You get your money's worth with the view though - it is certainly a dining experience. Must be done once.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. the sunrise from our window table! spectacular
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. the eponymous duck & waffle (& egg). sweet, savory goodness, but the portion was a bit small.

5KZRQIgLeuGvcrTneAP6tA.text: Listen up people, because I have to share the most amazing dish with you. Now I know a lot of people go crazy for the name sake, Duck & Waffle, but there's a naughty little number of the menu that you HAVE to order: Bacon wrapped Dates.STAY WITH MEI almost made the school boy error of overlooking the BWDs. I thought "errr that sounds kind of gross" but I was persuaded to try them and thank god I did because I know think "Jesus wept these things are like crack". (Not that I know what crack is like but I imagine it's somewhat as addictive as these babies)Salty, sweet, soft, crispy, oh my god my mouth can't compute all the happiness which is going down when it's eating these. *composes self* So in short, if you go to Duck and Waffle, order the Bacon wrapped dates as they are very good

ytdX0uljKO73vdzozdVoWg.text: This is a 24-hour restaurant that serves good food. Need I say more?! It is a sister restaurant of Sushi Samba in Heron Tower. It often gets the spilt over guests from Sushi Samba, but I have to say it is a really good restaurant of its own right. Since it is on top of the Heron Tower, you can have a great 360 degree view of the city. It has a nice cocktail bar as well. The best time to go there, in my opinion, is after party at around 2-3 in the morning. Don't think you can get in without a problem in the wee hours of the morning. You will be surprised at the number of night owls showing up at this joint. The bouncers always make you wait if you don't have a reservation. Don't be deterred. It is well worth the trouble. A nicely cooked duck leg with an egg on top sitting on a waffle at 3am is just divine. Oh, you have to pour the maple syrup with mustard seeds all over everything. I am already planning on doing this during summer months. You can enjoy great food while watch the sun rise above London. That must be a glorious sight.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

cklsOgK9sakgBIAWk-rbyQ.text: Really cool place. Amazing rooftop. Too bad the rooftop points at shoreditch and not the city center.

5D6wGO3yjCsTjYoQT-XXYQ.text: BAR ONLY:Whenever I'm in London I lead city tours, and I always ask my clients via questionnaire if they're afraid of heights.  If they aren't (and the entry lines aren't crazy), I take them here.  Also, when I first-time-in-London friends come to visit, I take them here too.  No one's ever underwhelmed by the experience!Most of the 5 stars is thanks to the incredible glass elevator ascent with London's skyline rapidly unraveling before your eyes.  You only have two choices for food & drink- SushiSamba and Duck & Waffle- and I much prefer the latter for plenty reasons.  Both restaurants have bars/lounge areas, but D&W's bar is far more intimate and tastefully designed.  There's also clearer views towards the Thames (the money shot) though it lacks Sushisamba's outdoor terrace (with less desirable rear facing views).  The wine list is great and the drink prices, surprisingly, aren't as sky-high as the bar's location.One of my all-time favorite London attractions.

C2qMUJAiXUgrU367s5vopA.text: Interesting restaurant on the 40th floor of the Heron Building. It was a wet day when we went but the view was just as good. The food was excellent and we had the signature Duck & Waffle which was well done and tasty. It was the breakfast menu. Service was attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Burps!!

RudHP19WdCZ6ymk60h3tzw.text: It's hard to get a reservation at this place! We asked our hotel concierge to book it for us, and they came back with either 11am for brunch or 11pm for dinner. We wouldn't be able to make it to brunch, so we decided on the dinner (well, late night meal, I guess).This place is on top of the Heron Tower, at the really thin part, so all the restaurants up there get amazing views of all sides of the tower. The first thing you see after you entered the restaurant, is a cool, hip bar, with tons of ingredients and alcohol for making cocktails -- might be a good place to stop by for a drink. On the other side of the bar is the kitchen and the restaurant.We did eat a little bit a couple hours prior, but were already hungry by the time we were seated. We got the pig ears, the beet salad, and the duck & waffle to share, as well as a couple well-crafted cocktails.The pig ears were crispy and well spiced -- probably better as a snack than an appetizer -- but we liked them nonetheless, even the mister who normally doesn't eat these weird animal bits. Their signature dish, the duck & waffle, was really well done -- the duck was moist, tender, with amazingly crispy skin, and the fried duck egg on top of the waffle was delicious as well. It is not a big plate, so if you are sharing you might have to fight over the food.The beet salad...well, meh. I don't know what we were thinking as we are from California...Onto the cocktails. Their cocktails are not cheap, but they have a huge list of very interesting savory cocktails, and they were crafted expertly. For those connoisseurs who like salted caramel, bone marrow essence, or blue cheese in their drinks, the D&W signature drinks will satisfy.I am glad I managed to eat at one of the "happening" places in London. The claim that British food is bland is thoroughly debunked. While it is true that they borrowed quite heavily from their former colony *cough NYC cough*, it is a good thing especially when infused with a British attitude!

dnZNxHK1SO6092UK4nGnDw.text: After all the hype about Duck & Waffle I was thoroughly disappointed by the quality of service from somewhere like the Heron Tower. I was told by several friends that this place was great as it serves food during the early hours of the morning. A friend of mine and I headed over around 12am from Smithfield's Piano Bar just around the corner in the  Liverpool Street Area to join a queue of people standing outside shivering in the wind and cold.We spent about 15 minutes in the queue and then joined an excited crowd into the lift that shot us up to Duck & Waffle. We were allowed into the bar area with no problems and headed to the lady at the desk at the entrance of the restaurant. The lady explained that without a reservation we would have to check back every 20 minutes and that we could have some bar snacks whilst we waited. I asked if they could take our name and number so that we were on a waiting list. She replied that there was no waiting list and you have to keep checking back every so often. In our defeat, we decided to check out Sushi Samba downstairs. The Kitchen in this restaurant, we were told, was closed and when trying to go back upstairs we were denied entry by a bouncer standing in front of a cordon rail. I was fuming at this point at how pretentious it was and luckily the bouncer could see the pointlessness of not letting us back up was. He released the cordon rail to allow us back upstairs to the bar area of Duck & Waffle. There was still nowhere to sit down, but after standing around like 2 young lemons,  some free high chairs became available by the window. The bar snacks were very measly and of course were really overpriced. The ones we did want to order, pig cheeks, which were something like £3 each and what in fact turned out to be 75% of the menu, was no longer available past 11pm. I tried again in my perseverance to see if there was a table free. The lady behind the desk said no, come back in 20 minutes.My friend and I ordered some bread that came with cheese which was something like £6 and some olives. Service charge was of course added. To add to my already present fury, the waiter brought us our bill as soon as we had ordered! I didn't think this was very welcoming at all. We ate our less than average bar snacks, paid our bill and I tried one last time to see if we could get a seat in the restaurant. The lady gave an unsympathetic no I'm sorry we don't do a waiting list, it's just the way it is. She didn't even bother to check inside the restaurant. We had spent money on some rubbish bar snacks to still be turned away. I understand staying at the bar does not guarantee a place in the restaurant but we had hung about for 45 minutes. If it's to do with dress code, we were in heels and a dress so I can't imagine that was the problem... I would expect more from such a highly reputed establishment. It doesn't take a lot to go the extra mile for your customers. If there is such an issue with reserving and a lack of seating in the bar area, they should let people know whilst they are in the queue downstairs. My friend and I basically queued outside to no seating in the bar area or in the restaurant. All in all, it was a bit of a waste of time really. We ended up getting a hotdog and sandwich opposite Liverpool Street Station we were still famished. No issues getting hold of those unsurprisingly....

5WPWoWbMGwqRvLoRxw0I5A.text: Duck & Waffle served delicious food and drinks in addition to having a FANTASTIC view of London just north of the Thames! I came with a party of 4 on a Wednesday night. You certainly need to make a reservation in advance, or else you won't be able to get past the bouncer and then experience the DW bar and restaurant.Our last-minute reservation was for 10:45PM, and we quickly ascended the elevator to the 40th floor. The doors open up to a corridor that then leads to a trendy bar area with smooth vibes and a lounge-y feel. Past the bar is the seated area for the actual restaurant, which was absolutely packed even at 10:45PM.We were seated at a booth facing the ceiling-to-floor windows. Drinks ensued (cocktails are £13), and I ordered the Duck and Stormy. It's presentation reminded me of the Prohibition -- the ginger beer bottle with encased in a brown bag with a waxed seal (sticker). I was more than satisfied with this drink to start the night. Another friend ordered their spicy bellini cocktail, which was also great! We decided to split various dishes. We started out with their guanciale and goat cheese bread, which was served piping hot. Then, we ordered the spicy ox cheek doughnut, which was HUGE, not spicy at all, and surprisingly doughy (in a good way). We then split two duck & waffle dishes, which were definitely the highlight of the night. The crispy skin and slight salty duck breast perfectly complemented the sweet waffle-and-maple syrup combo. We finished off with the smoked mozzarella salad, which was super smoky and topped with lots of fresh watercress. The underlying homemade granola was crunchy and sweet.We finished dinner with dessert -- two torrejas and another raspberry sorbet/marshmallow dish. The torrejas were AMAZING. A bit overwhelmingly sweet, but the cool, cinnamon ice cream and the roasted apple slices with brioche french toast topped with a hot, spiced cider sauce worked perfectly together. Altogether a great experience, and I would come again.Tl;dr -- highlights were the duck & waffles and the Torrejas. Great view!

h_7BNmsPfPtax0IJYPzJ3g.text: One of the best views in London, the elevator up is also something else.Food has always been good and service too.

4sdOUkAq35lzQp4boMbOZQ.text: Best breakfast in town, bar none. Make sure you book ahead as far in advance as you can. Try to get a table by the windows but the views are pretty great wherever you sit. Fab food.

H2WsnX7vvhy1WkcKF99oTw.text: The Duck and Waffle has been on my tick list for a while now and having recently been to SushiSamba my expectations were indeed as high as the 40th floor, where the restaurant is located!I can confirm with no hesitation whatsoever that expectations were met, indeed surpassed. Not much to say about the views, just stunning (even on an overcast day).The food is as adventurous as I've seen in a while and those who are looking for a new experience will be thrilled with the menu and the taste/quality of food.I'm guessing the menu changes monthly, so if you are going in September I can highly recommend the crispy pig ears, bacon wrapped dates and pollockmeatballs.The dilemma came in choosing a main course; steak, fish or the signature duck and waffle? As this was my first visit, it had to be the duck and waffle. Suffice to say, innovative, substantial and just damn tasty! My party of 5 were celebrating a birthday, so following the self-indulgence of ordering a delicious dessert (the Torrejas), we were then treated to a 'birthday cake' from the house, which was very much appreciated and a very professional touch.A special mention for our waiter Andre who was attentive and helpful. What a thoroughly nice chap!So what's left to say, nothing much other than given the location, experience and food the Duck and Waffle is excellent value for money, I can't wait to go back again and I wish I could give it a 6 star rating.Well done guys, you've absolutely nailed it!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Heron Tower
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Up at the top
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & Waffle

mp89yXvF8A_fMuqnJEUHOA.text: First off the setting is outstanding. Resting 40 floors in the sky is this culinary wonderland that has a 360 degree view of London. Second, the food is really good. Aside from the amazing views, and great food, is the fact that it is open 24 hours a day. That is crazy considering you have to take an express lift to the 40th floor. How hard must that be after putting down a few or many in the course of an evening? The hostess told us that they recommend guests book a reservation for 3am because the lines can get long.Now back to the food. I was with a big group so I got to try many things. We started off with bread. There are 6 options and we went with 2; guanciale with welsh goat's cheese and n'duja with gruyere. The guanciale with welsh goat's cheese was outstanding. The bread was soft with great chew and the guanciale was crispy and its saltiness balanced out the flavor of the goat cheese, perfect combination.We followed that up with a bunch of starters. The crispy pig ears were my favorite because they were fried perfectly and also tasted like BBQ Lays potato chips, or BBQ Lays crispy pig ears. The spicy ox cheek doughnut was good, a little weird with the apricot jam because it was a strong contrast between sweet and savory. The roasted octopus was very tasty. Kind of brought me to Spain with the mixture of chorizo and it was hearty since it was served with potatoes. The foie gras crème brulee was a solid dish. I have had this at other restaurants where it comes off too sweet, but this one had the right balance which created an almost umami flavor. I don't know if it needed the lobster on top, but who says no to lobster. The scotch bhadji was an adventure and looked like a work of art. My friend said it pretty much mixed two of his favorite things, a scotch egg and onion bhadji. We did add vegetables to the meal, you know to round it out. We ordered the smoked mozzarella salad and it was a nice balance and refresher to the meal right before we got to the duck & waffle. It reminded us of something we would be able to order in California.Now after all of that and truly being very full we got our orders of the duck and waffle. Let me tell you, I wish I had this in the states. I love duck and to have the following all in one plate is just awesome. There is a perfectly fried duck leg confit, topped with a fried duck egg, over a fresh waffle, and maple syrup...bliss.Make sure to make reservations for anytime you want to go because it is a popular joint.  And don't hesitate to get there before your reservation to enjoy a drink at the bar and take in the amazing views.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Heron Tower
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & Waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. smoked mozzarella salad

5PHxV2Qm20pCe5m8-EHuOQ.text: Great experience！I gotup so early to enjoy the breakfast and it didn't let me down. The  view  was definitely breath-taking and  the  food delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

Os4J-b0rOKKPCQu_RkCfaQ.text: Loved duck & waffle! It's open 24 hours but keep in mind that there is a limited menu for food from 4-5 pm when the restaurant is changing from brunch to dinner service. They do a limited bar menu from 3:30-4 when brunch ends. The drink are fab but the real reason to go is for the view. The bar sits in the 40th floor of the heron building. The ride up from the lobby is in a glass elevator. Cool views of the city. The service is great! No snobbery, just friendly servers.

Dp8_zaBfSIaSSkBqPWkm_g.text: Great view of London, especially at dawn and dusk, but don't waste your time with the food. And certainly don't bother yourself with standing too long in line.Fortunately, there was no line when we arrived, just a few minutes past midnight. The host initially made a pretentious show of exclusivity by asking if we had reservations, but after we said unabashedly replied no, he quickly ushered us our table.The famous Duck & Waffle (£17) was a huge disappointment. The duck confit was meaty but fried to the point of being dried out, and the waffle, despite its good color, was a limp and mealy mess. Maybe it's because I'm an American and can get a respectable waffle at just about any pancake and waffle house in the States -- and without the attitude and ostentation, I should add -- but this waffle was just pathetic. Not even a healthy pour of the mustard maple syrup could save it. The Spicy Potatoes (£11) weren't all that spicy, but they were at least edible. And for such a fancy bar, the beer selection pretty much sucked. I paid £7 for an Asahi and instantly regretted it. Based upon the reviews, you would think that this place would be a knockout, but in my opinion, it was a duck and a miss.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. View of The Gherkin
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & Waffle

yQfuTozymynySuh1tqVYfA.text: This place used to be amazing. Now it is completely Fucking shit. The service is absolutely abysmal and they practically rape you and your visitors walking into the restaurant I. felt uncomfortable when the door man touched my genitals. Will never be back!

3IkzZqIHBU3U3ZILyOzdjw.text: How do you mess with two jetlagged American tourists? Give them tiny jam jars of BBQ sauce when they ask for marmalade. "I thought..." "Can you taste this??" "It's BBQ sauce, right???"That being said, this was far and away the best breakfast experience I've ever had. We had the duck and waffle, the beef cheek Benedict and some BBQ toast. Everything (except maybe the toast) was amazing. The confit duck had a gloriously crisp skin and tender but not the slightest bit overcooked meat, and the bright orange yolks on the poached eggs in the Benedict managed to surpass the housemade Sriracha. As good as the food is, the million dollar view is even more stunning. Come any time you can. You won't be disappointed.

19jpVTTL4HBdMN3lMKO_FA.text: It was really nice when u arrived the restaurant,  its on 40th floor, if its nice weather, u.Can see the beautiful views,  and that as my high point in my whole experience.  after that if all went down hill. 1St we sat at the bar/waiting area....For half an hour,  and i read the meun twice and ready to order ....No one come by, that all just chatting at the bar. I have to asked the host when he come tell me that he will check if we can be seat or not in 15more min,  that if i have to.Go order at the bar. The drinks is make after 15mins, and when we on the way to our table, they told us that we have to order at least one ain course each at 3pm. ..... Sure i will do that but would rather know before hand. They seated 3of us in the middle of the room....Which u dont get to see much of the view. Then they told us that we only get the table for an hour. We order duck and waffle....It was just ok.....Fired duck leg on top of a waffle that they pre make, and put a dick egg on top. The duck was quite nice...But nth special. We also ordered whole seabass for 2 (£32)....and.It was not yummy....We ate half and didnt want anymore. so....that.Tells u that i wont want to.go.back..To that restaurant .....All 3of us agreed that the food and Services was bad.

Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle 20, duck was cooked well...But nth special

_64FBxfheeHxQzjKCe0taQ.text: Manager at the restaurant was condescending and rude. My boyfriend did not like his food and wanted to exchange his order for something he would enjoy but instead, was shamed by the manager in a mean and disrespectful way. I give this restaurant two stars because the chicken, cod, and appetizers was good, but the lack of kindness and compassion given by the manager ruined the meal.

kBTQPbSj3msDUqEBoJg9kw.text: This place was excellent! We were about 30 minutes late though and the only drawback was that they time you here which is disappointing because at other restaurants they never timed any guests hence the 4 stars. But the food quality was so much better here than Hutong in London with the added views. I had an avocado cocktail and my husband had a whiskey drink of some sort with a walnut liquor. Delicious! We considered buying the Duck and Waffle dish but decided instead to go with crispy polenta, beef tartar, and ravioli. All were so fresh, with beautiful presentation and served in about 15 minutes, not long! Our servers made sure we were taken care of and always courteous. I would highly recommend coming here for the atmosphere and the fun decor and of course the food and drinks! If we are ever back in London we will come back again!

YvdL7oRtz9d9A04ECutWEA.text: Loved their beef tartare. The view, the menu...all amazing. I'm not a huge duck and waffle fan, but it was pretty good. The waffle was light with a crispy exterior. The mustard maple syrup was wonderful. The duck was well done and crispy. I would recommend the greentea pairing as it complimented the heaviness of the food.

akjvNM1pmyHaNOSM5wrhvA.text: The view was a 5 star, but the food was a 3.5. If you are a foodie and used to high end cuisine with a price tag this was good but not the best breakfast I've had in this class. One disappointment was the cocktails. After reading reviews and raves this was one of the things we were excited to try and it was underwhelming. The latte was fabulous and agree with other reviews that a coffee at bar may be the best option. Of course, if you can score a time with the raved about bartender I'd still try the cocktail at bar. Service was impeccable. Take advantage of reservations and try to catch sunrise/sunset. It is worth booking a few weeks in advance because the view is breathtaking.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Cocktails to round out breakfast splurge
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Lovely service
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Colombian eggs appear simple but flavor in every bite popped this up from boring to fab!

BJdU3J8u7G4FX-14lOZxKQ.text: Amazing quality breakfast. Let us in without a reservation but it seems that it would be most often required. Ordered the namesake duck and waffle which were excellent. Only part my partner and I found to be stressful was the high speed elevator right to the top since we both have a mild fear of heights.

UoEwNsnhGfUenPkuJEHv7w.text: Had dinner with my family while visiting London. If you can get a reservation, I highly recommend Duck and Waffle. We ordered a few small plates, the duck and waffle main, and the whole roasted chicken, and it was more than enough for 4 people. My son took half a chicken home. The signature duck and waffle small plate was interesting, but not amazing. Everything else was top notch. We had the salted house bread, which was like a very salty puri and very hot. Excellent. The artichoke ravioli, the Brussels sprouts and the goat kofte were all interesting and delicious. Service was fast. Almost too fast, like they were moving us along, but still professional. And finally, The view was incredible, if you could see past the twenty somethings continually posing for selfies in front of the floor to ceiling windows.   If you can't make reservations for dinner, go to the bar. View is amazing there as well.  Top marks.

SOgLRA7M6RNgK_t2lFYOpg.text: Food is just delicious. It's duck and waffle for brunch is really yummy! Perfect!Views are breathtaking and service is amicable and attentive.Really recommend place!  To note that it is not cheap. I find it more as a treat for an special occasion and don't forget to book! It is always super busy.

s3MTZFDgITsy_midM75sWg.text: It's a smart looking room with a wonderful menu executed perfectly. I was lucky to get a reservation and visited for brunch. The food was great and duck & waffle signature dish was THE BEST! Along with the view, this place does a great job. I can't wait to return!

lYGkNsXRfE7UoWXzaQVPlA.text: The view, a bit of a wait, the viewFirst, can't stop talking about this view! Enough said. You think you are coming for Duck & Waffle, but really you will stay hours for the view.Second, small complaint about the wait. A friend had to book a week or so in advance. Third, they told us about the sunshine breakfast option, will definitely be trying that next time!

krr7tlnqtlz_fDBSMn18Bw.text: Open 24 hours.The duck & waffle dish is delicious. The ox cheek donut had way too much paprika. I love donuts, but I barely picked at this one.Great place to eat at during any time of the day.  You can watch the sunrise, sunset, or just enjoy the lunch with a view.  Expensive, but so is everything else in London.

PS-dA2cZa2zO1gH3eB_4xQ.text: THe view is good. The restaurant is on the 40th floor with a great view of The Egg. However the food was good but not great. We had the duck and waffle, of course. The wait staff was also ok but not greatly hospitable. The open kitchen made the atmosphere noisy. I won't go there for a dinner with my wife - it's ok for a business dinner. On the whole - it's an average place with an above average view.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

YvYzj6DAgpy41MHD6gctyw.text: Overrated!  Gentrified, pretentious and overpriced version of Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles (Los Angeles)Pros:  personable waiters/staff and nice ambience and decor.  A great view of London from the 40th floor Cons: overpriced, overcooked, over seasoned Maybe I ordered the wrong things on the menu... but would assume that their specialty ( duck and waffle) would be spot on...???

p6a9-8jOZJzoe-RV7dLoiw.text: Admittedly I was intrigued by and came here for the views and the booze, not the food.I have this 'thing' where I like to grab a drink at the highest point I possibly can when visiting a city.  I like to see the world from up high.  There is no better place in London than Duck & Waffle.I made a reservation way far in advance since I knew I was traveling, but at 1130 we were among just a few tables in the restaurant.  They sat us up against the window with an East/Southeast view from the table.  Note: if you're going to do this place right, you need a window seat.  You can eat in the middle of a restaurant anywhere else.Since we ate breakfast roughly 2 hours before arriving we were not really hungry, so we put in a drink order and for some shareables.  SO had the Hay! while I had a glass of the rose.  Rose all day for me since it was unseasonably warm in London.  Both great.When it came to food we wanted to sample without stuffing out faces, so we decided on 4 items.  First, the pig ears are a show stealer.  They were super crispy and plentiful.  The seasoning had quite a bit of flavor and a nice kick.  Our second item was the crispy polenta.  Huge hit!  And actually, this was probably my favorite thing that we tried.  Although small (two polenta balls) the flavor was perfect and the crisp was just right.  One drawback for me is that the sauce was a parmesan mayo, and because I hate mayo, I wiped most of it off.  We had the beat so we went with the beet root which was not only beautiful but tasted beautiful as well.  So fresh!  Our last item was the rosemary garlic bread.  This was a close second to my favorite because I could eat delicious bread every day.  It was piping hot (so be careful!) and had plenty of crisp crust and rosemary garlic flavor.  A must for every meal!As far as the dress code, it lists "smart" on the website.  I was unsure of the extent of the term and I would say that nice jeans, a button down or equivalent, are perfect.  I did not see anyone in jackets (granted, it WAS warm) and felt that there were several people dressed less smart than I.  Nightlife?  Maybe a different story.I will not lie and say this place is inexpensive as we ran the equivalent of a $75USD tab for what was really just some quick snacks.  However, everyone deserves some nice things, and the views make the experience completely worth it.  Next time I am in town I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

qhcXydC6jL_Hrkk9WN64zA.text: Amazing views and terrific food at a reasonable price!  Very cool bar in addition to the restaurant and I would say there isn't really a bad seat in the house.

v1k6exaP0Y_gyo8JGudHCg.text: fancy place for fancy peeps, unless you just go for especial occasion. Watch out for all crazy people taking pics.  Yup, it has a really nice view of the city, so if you can go during the evening...and make sure u've  made a reservation. The place maybe open 24/7 but seems like it's always busy.  oh yeah, ducks good .

BaY2KUPF-pSdiae1QVknAQ.text: Poor service with drinks arriving after the food. Food was decent quality but small share plate sized portions. Saving grace is the view. 1 star for the panorama of London.  Great starting spot for first time visitor.

fAboEfeHi1CBowXQGdCtoQ.text: The service was not good - it's a fancy and expensive place but they don't treat their customers as they should. It has a beautiful view of London but the waiters made it not agreeable.

QaB7GFt9Fx3z2yDTQ1MmBw.text: Food amazing! Drinks amazing! View amazing! Not the cheapest place in the world but for a special occasion really hits the spot!

l27WDDIT4-nYe8OdgonSzA.text: I went here on a friend's recommendation during a business trip-- between the sights on the way up, the atmospheric bar shared with Sushi Samba below, and the modern British/euro-food, this was one of my favorite parts of the trip. And while it's not inexpensive, the prices were lower than I expected for what you get.Highlights:-The Filthy Martini, a dirty version of a dirty martini. Olive juice, mustard, filtered through oyster shells....and then served with a raw oyster inside. -Dorset crab: fresh crab, fresh wasabi, and a few other garnishes. Delicious.The signature Duck & Waffle dish is okay. Great duck, totally adequate waffle.

q-XAokOXUNXWyvfNV05pNA.text: Make a reservation.  Even though this place is open 24 hours, it gets packed and rightfully so.  The bar is decorated impeccably and the view from the dining room is stellar.  Order one of everything on the menu, as the flavors vary with every dish and all are well thought out.  Good wine list and courteous service without being too "up selly".

2BbuF3Ro_hgP4lbRzbpfgA.text: Really enjoyed my meal here. Great service and top end food. A bit pricey but worth it for the food and panoramic views of the city.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

7VZxO86xaPYGmsVmgR9tlA.text: Duck and Waffle was an awesome part of our trip to London.  The food is AMAZING and so are the views.  (if you love it, I recommend checking out the same chef in Miami at Sugarcane).  The restaurant is open 24/7, which is an amazing thing given the fact that London shuts down around 8.  it was a fun late night thing to do.  The cocktails are great.The only thing I'd say is that the service was ok.  Definitely worth a try. I'll be back!

yfNdCxq5hPisUlNg8bUiRQ.text: It's a tie between "holy amazing skyline views" and "holy amazing food." Obviously the duck and waffle is a must. It might be the greatest meal I've had in the whole city. The drink list was interesting--they infuse their cocktails with vegetables. Delicious albeit green! If you don't eat duck, all the small plates are still worth the trip. Swanky-ish atmosphere. Make reservations ahead of time.

haC3hm_7WrMwQRLGbqDAww.text: Thought it would be much more expensive, but kind of affordable for a nice restaurant in that type of building!Amazing night view and atmosphere, love the interior and open kitchen!The ox cheek doughnut is huge and enough for three people, love the filling and the sauce, but the bread itself is a little dry and hard to chew, not bouncy or moist at all.The fois gras crime brûlée is nice, the bread to go with it as better than the doughnut and the waffle in the main course duck&waffle. Duck&waffle is okay, duck leg is not very juicy, actually a little chewy, but I like the flavour of it so it's okay. The waffle is very ordinary and has nothing special, not crispy or moist enough. The sunny egg on top of that could be seasoned more, it tastes a little blend.Tried the dessert Torrejas, it's very sweet but I like it to be sweet, cinnamon ice cream is really creamy and intense. The French toast in it is good too!The cocktail Truffle is a little disappointing, a bit too strong and less sweet&savoury.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Open kitchen
