1Sgb0wHtwPtVj5bUzD6rlw.text: My partner and I went here on a whim as we'd heard about this restaurant via friends and on TV and wanted to see what the hype was about and to dine somewhere with a view.  The view was no disapointment, we had a spectacular view right next to the window, 270degree view of London.  The food was pretty good too, we had the pig ear scratching, rabbit starter and foie gras brulee.  My partner loved his rabbit and it was pretty great, my brulee was a little too sweet and the foie gras flavours didn't really blend well with the sweetness.  The duck and waffles we had for mains though more than made up for it.  The waffles were perfect, as was the fried egg and the duck was cooked to perfection, crispy skin and juicy meat.  Next time we'll probably skip the starters and dessert and just go for the duck and waffles, a steal at about £17 each.

YASdCN3tho5Sj_4HFi0NZQ.text: So I've been wanting to try this place for a while, but being incapable of planning my life two months in advance at the moment, hadn't gotten around to having sufficient forethought to book. So while browsing availability online and coming across a 10.00am slot just a week ahead, I pounced! And then Yee Gan was kind enough to provide the perfect company.Having already promised I'd order something more interesting than granola :) and being in a mood for an indulgent and leisurely brunch, we ordered a selection of dishes to share, including the Colombian eggs with avocado and smoked salmon, the foie gras with nutella, and of course, the eponymous duck & waffle.We were asked whether we wanted salt, pepper, or tabasco added to the Colombian eggs, and opted to have them as they came, but really we should have gone for the seasoning as they needed some kind of kick to add interest. The foie gras was my favourite (good choice Yee Gan!) and was really rich and yummy. And the duck and waffle with fried egg and the mustard (couldn't really taste it) maple syrup was also very good.We finished off with poached peaches (some perhaps a teeny bit under poached) with tarragon crème fraîche sorbet (a delicious palate cleanser). I was a bit non-plussed by the accompanying white chocolate & pistachio biscotti - perhaps they were just too thin and crunchy to have sufficient taste. I prefer my biscotti thick and crumbly and good for dunking in coffee. I thought the service seemed a little bit perfunctory and lacking in engagement. Our waiter wouldn't get off the fence and share his favourite dish - come on, no-one loves everything equally! And our waitress, while very smiley and sweet, had no idea what made the Colombian eggs Colombian (it seems to be the addition of tomatoes and scallion to scrambled egg). And while they couldn't take our drinks and initial order quick enough when we sat down, after that, they didn't seem too interested in following up.At the end of the meal I randomly found myself pondering what I made of the ceiling tiles - while I liked the quirky bright yellow wave, I couldn't help wondering whether the marks where intentionally distressed, or just grubby. But unless diners regularly throw their food up in the air, I'll assume the former - although who knows what happens at 3.00am in the morning! I would definitely return and there are still plenty of other things on the menu I'd like to try. Plus the view is great and the speedy lift ride makes for a fun entrance and exit!

sVOp7lNsDsDzK399qzyG7Q.text: You've probably heard enough of this place, about how stunning the view is and about it's glorious duck & waffle but for all the hype, it's actually pretty good! I usually hate these gimmicky, reservation-only places where you visit once just to say you've been because the food's never worth coming back for. I've been here 3 times now!They do a good job. It's nothing super polished but always a satisfyingly unexpected mix of tastes/textures. I love the pigs ears!!! Crunchy and idk what they put in that bbq seasoning but it tastes so good! The oxtail doughnut was also nomz, it looks like a massive scotch egg but inside's stewed oxtail and the doughnut's been rolled in brown sugar. Seems so weird but tasty tasty with the apple jam! And the DUCK & WAFFLE. Yes. It's good. The waffle + duck + fried egg + maple syrupy goodness should go into your mouth at the same time, crispy bits from the duck and egg mixing with the spongy waffle and firmness of the duck meat, dripping in syurp. NOMZ. Forget the overpriced drinks, the desserts are forgettable but this. is. good.

GY2Bpw9_Dns2zUL1v-s93w.text: Tried out the speciality of duck, egg and waffle, which was absolutely delicious and for dessert I had their spin on 'tea and biscuits' which for me had too many flavours going on at once and ultimately ruined the taste;  besides from that, being surrounded by the breathtaking views inside the Heron tower was a great dining experience overall.

MQTnZWGpFfeeYeHGDRfMPA.text: I present to the yelp world, my 100th review!And it had to be for something I found to be absolutely spectacular. Duck and Waffle, ladies and gents, is absolutely spectacular, and one of the best places I've been to since moving to this fair city a year ago.Right, so... the view.  Everyone has talked about the view, but I can't not talk about the view because ohmygosh, is it amazing.  After emerging from the tube station, I thought "well, this is a fairly corporate business-y area... where on earth is this restaurant going to be?"  Luckily, google maps led me right to it, and I found the famed lift going to the 40th floor with ease.  Imagine the view from St. Paul's.  Now make it higher.  Now take away the copious amounts of stairs you have to climb at St. Paul's to get a view that isn't quite as high.  Yeap.  The view is amazing.  And panoramic.  And there isn't a bad seat in the house.Equally, there isn't a bad morsel in the house.  Grant and Tom, bad influences extraordinaire, and I ordered copious amounts of food as we wanted to sample everything.  Grant's given the list, but here it is again: crispy pig ears, foie gras all day breakfast, ox cheek doughnut, bacon wrapped dates, and the namesake... duck and waffle.  There wasn't a bad thing on the table.  Not one.  The bacon wrapped dates, I might add, are stuffed with chorizo.  And my goodness they're delicious.  Maybe my favorite thing aside from the duck and waffle itself.  I was super impressed with the crispy pig ears, which were actually crispy and not gross and gelatinous like I'd had at a yelp extreme eating event.  I kept going back to the little paper bag for more!  Said paper bag, by the way, wax sealed a la ye olde days with red wax and a duck and waffle stamp.The duck and waffle is not to be missed!  Quarter waffle on bottom, generously sized duck thigh/leg on top, gorgeously fried duck egg on top of that, pour mustard maple syrup all over and get to grubbin'.  Oh, the mustard maple syrup.  And oh, that crispy duck.  There are no words.  It must be tried.  Simply must.Duck and Waffle is extremely popular, but for those with the transport options, is open 24/7 so there are often odd timed reservations available.  Book ahead, and enjoy.  I plan to return.  I plan to return a lot.

BE6YHaOj1P4FGdE_gqrrjA.text: I agree with most of the comments here. A meal here is simply great fun, with the zippy glass elevator ride up to the 40th floor and tremendous views. These are probably even more interesting than those at the Shard as you are looking down directly on the Gherkin and other landmarks of interests.The restaurant itself was busy and buzzy at 9pm on a Saturday. The staff were efficient and friendly, explaining the menu without being too pushy. Others have told me that they felt hurried through their meal (perhaps in preparation for the next sitting?) but we had no such problems. It's small plate food for sharing but there was a long-ish wait before the duck and waffles arrived. They also warn you that the roast chicken takes 40 minutes, which I actually felt was encouragingly indicative of things being cooked to order.Anyway, highly enjoyable in all respects. Would definitely recommend for a fun night out. Certainly preferable to Sushisamba downstairs, which comes across much worse for atmosphere in spite of the outside bar.

Lw77YTRoFcE8F3sbpuc6ZA.text: All I can say is Heaven on earth. We went here for our 1st anniversary and it was truly something to remember. We saw the sunset while dining and saw how London transform for day to night. It was such a magical night - a really good romantic hotspot.

GYDyK6X2QB1fnuE8CrMvIg.text: Incredible food with pretty much the best view you could imagine in London. Prices are not exorbitant, either. We had the steak tartare, yellowfin tuna, guanciale & goat cheese bread, and Duck & Waffle and everything was exceptional. The drinks were also very creative and well done.

paz9DpoumXy182T8yt-UbQ.text: A little pricy, but you are paying bills for some seriously stunning views from up there.... Food is supposed to be nice, but personally haven't tried it yet.

qQLeYGe527rlesOE0k3X4w.text: Amazing view - one of the best in London! Mouthwatering food. Definitely worth a visit !

njixmsyQEObuEhtxE_AOdw.text: Meh.I don't really rate this place. Yes, at one floor above Sushi Samba the view is even better. Yes, you can sit down in relative comfort. Yes, the pigs ears are really tasty. However, yes the prices are absolutely ludicrous for what you're getting. And yes, the place is beginning to look a little tired. The food _does_ taste good, and the service is relatively efficient.

qRNXqpbDjzzTIyZ9K9GRqA.text: I had my reservations given some comments about a poor service style, but on my visit the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The friendly and efficient service really was the highlight of the visit. My friend and I went for breakfast - would recommend going in a pair if you want a window table. I had the signature duck and waffle dish, which was tasty and surprisingly filling. The duck skin was wonderfully crisp. The granola, fruit, and yoghurt my friend had was delicious and reasonably priced.For stunning views and a unique dining experience, Duck & Waffle is the place to go.

PLR00SrRo99s8pKyoEgIpA.text: I was super excited to try this place out. I had been researching this place from home in the United States and had told my boyfriend all about it. We arrived in London today, Sept. 4th 2016 and couldnt wait to take a nap and hit this new joint. We arrived at around 3 in the afternoon, dressed in sweaters and jeans ( mind you its the end of summer). However we were quickly turned away bc we were told they had a dress code. At 3 pm in the afternoon, at restaurant that is open 24/7, we didnt expect our dress to be in issue at this particular time of day.... However, we quickly learned that unlike other tourist areas that accept tourist dress, this place didnt and sandles/flip flops are NOT allowed. Disappointed, we left bc honestly if you dont want our money someone else does.... We decided how about heading to the Breakfast Club and making a visit to see the Mayor.... Those of you whom are local know what we are speaking of..those whom are not..give it a try... What started as a disappointing day ended up being a blast!!

byOgrP-a7Ni-uIKFMUuN2A.text: Fantastic food and great views.  The views may hvae been worth 5 stars on it's on and that doesn't need to much explanation.  However, they have put it in effort with some creative and yet basic food choices.  The thinly cut raw tuna was particularly good but the eponymous duclk and waffle was excellent.

SvRuTZRX95-gTeqmCBgL6Q.text: Great fun. Delicious food. Recommend eating tapas style and sharing lots of plates so you can try everything. We had cocktails downstairs at sushi samba which was good so you can see both!

pmDgmWg4ieLXl_OziuH3ww.text: I wavered between giving 3 or 4 stars, since the food and drinks were only okay, but the view is spectacular.  There is a reason why reservations need to be booked weeks in advance, and there's a reason why there's usually a queue waiting to get into the tower itself on a busy evening.  To feel special, make a reservation and watch yourself being whisked past the line into the rocket elevator.Duck and waffle came with an egg on top.  Just your regular waffle and egg, but the duck was amazingly crispy in its fried gloriousness.  The ox cheek doughnut was disappointing and tasted much better with the side it came with.

naoTI_W3u9FXkVG03ZEx8A.text: I thought this would be a place where you pay for the view and the food would be mediocre...couldn't be more wrong. Dan Doherty orchestrates the kitchen wonderfully and personally touched every piece of food that came out. I couldn't stop watching the kitchen for over two hours and saw him send back dishes that weren't up to his standards multiple times. Entire meal was outstanding through and through. The bacon wrapped dates (!!!), ox cheek donuts, truffle chicken and pollack meatballs are a must...can't wait to come back.

_cZTvmeYxAzyjB29vbFxYg.text: Went as a special breakfast treat to see the place that talked about so much and the views. Views excellent. But my boyfriend got AWFUL diarrhoea and vomiting from the duck and waffle dish, so bad that he had symptoms in the restaurants toilets themselves! We went straight home, cancelling our plans of a day out. Contacted the restaurant via telephone and email to tell them and they were not apologetic and didnt offer any compensation. Will not be back. Poor customer service.

bWmrtzHyjTnKyjvyLMTnjw.text: Expensive and waited for my order menu for half and to arrive. Only good thing is the view.

1Qsq52DhITUnu9JIkrBRwA.text: Great value for money. Love the crispy duck leg. Open at all hours of the night

zmdzhmKp4nGdXCb7DAIWRg.text: Don't miss the spicy ox cheek doughnut. Absolutely fantastic!!

6AVMJsJTZDXfO0ZMI_A_QA.text: Although the portion sizing was a bit small, the food was delicious. Would return for the food and the gorgeous view.

lPysfAsyIPE1HO2gSX98Ig.text: Really good food almost ruined by incredibly bad service, particularly when it came to wine. I live in the New York metro area and I'm a bit of a foodie, so I have a tendency to be really tough on pricey or fancy or "hot, new" places. All in all I enjoyed Duck & Waffle because the majority of the dishes were quite good (the only one I'd skip from the ones we had would be the pollock meatballs - flavorless). However, we had four different waiters, none of which were very attentive and a supposed sommelier who hadn't tried every wine on the extremely overpriced list. I've never experienced a sommelier in the US or France who could not list the characteristics of every bottle on their wine list.As good as the food is, if this restaurant were in my neck of the woods, I'm not sure how eager I'd be to patronize it again. The service needs a lot of work.

yQSrPQ_qkDelIcwNbi3mAQ.text: Great views, great food (esp the duck & waffle & egg) and oysters so fresh you can practically hear the sea when they arrive at the table. Really nice to share lots of dishes amongst friends. My only one niggle would be the price of the drinks, but then I guess a view like that doesn't come cheap

P-I8AP90RiIlpmioYYDMtQ.text: Everything we ordered was disappointing. They had run out of the specials. Also run out of 3 more items on the menu. The caramelised onion bread was undercooked, and the anchovies on top just did not go well. The beetroot and honeycomb was too sweet. The asparagus was dull. The ox cheek doughnut was the most acceptable dish but still nothing to shout about. The pollock meatballs lacked any seasoning.The signature dish of duck and waffle was not impressive. The baked alaska for dessert was perhaps better than the rest. All in all, this restaurant was disastrous.

5UIvZ9qXTcAn8GKy6-5CQQ.text: It might be 24 hours, but dont bother coming here on a friday or saturday after 12 in the winter- they make you wait outside in the freezing cold for a table. No effort is made to make you more comfortable, like offering for you to wait inside the empty lobby( for fire risk?) or in the restaurant itself.

hxmB5wGDVEmeYue6-oUPww.text: You guessed it - excellent duck and waffle dish. The foie gras creme brulee with lobster was also delicious. Great views and generally good service as well. The roof top bar down in Sushi Samba is a nice place to retire after dinner.

ZRbg7JkX5KHlyGy41kCiTQ.text: Amazing night view( little bit dizzy though), great food(duck & waffle a must try), and good service!!! Definitely worth going!!!!!

RTTXaZuxLOigHqBnVg3uQg.text: I love this place!!! My new hang out for client meetings, the view from Herron Tower is exceptional and it really displays just how much London has developed in the past 5 yrs. Like any restaurant set in these surroundings it comes at a cost, however I was pleasantly surprised that my bill was only £160 for 4 people with a sharing Menu and no alcoholic drinks. We ate loads of different dishes and I felt it was a well valued meal. The Tuna dish was first class as were all the others apart from the coal charred aubergine..... slightly gooey and tasteless (wasn't a winner on our table). The whole experience was excellent and the staff were very professional. Only bear-bug is finding the right floor as its not evident when you get in the lift and a lot of customers end up in Sushi Samba. The elevator is like a rocket, so if you're afraid of heights its so quick that you don't have enough time to panic!!I'll be back!

LSTueHRHtFVtIh_5JTtA3g.text: Fantastic food and the view is really nice. I enjoyed their brunch. The menu is quite nice: creative and delicious. The duck and waffle is a must, however it claims to be a dish "for the table" when in reality it's more like a main dish for 1 person. Delicious all around and the eggs are cooked perfectly.

mJ_jYQWjBO9e0CA13gyJQQ.text: My date and I had an amazing time at the Duck and Waffle. We went mostly for the view (which did not disappoint), but were caught of guard by the high quality of the food and excellent service. It was clear that waiting staff were of a high calibre but at no point did they come over as snobby, or make us feel uncomfortable as in some similar places. I had the signature duck and waffle dish which was a great combination (although the duck was slightly overcooked), my friend had the angus burger which was nicely rare and very tasty. Again I cannot emphasise enough the how incredible the view is, highly recommended.

0jrQS1DhX_H5TC6hiuWrtQ.text: Terrible service, Rude and unprofessional staff. Glad I got sit in the bar for 20 minutes before I could get the kid with glasses attention to get to place an order. I thought maybe the food would be worth it. Ha ha you got me. You figure with a name of Duck and Waffle you would know how to make waffles. No flavor in the waffle whatsoever. Shall I send you a box of bisquick from the US? Learn how to make the staple in your name. You got the making it look pretty part down but taste not so much. No flavor it I would have wanted to eat cardboard I could have done that somewhere else.

uVeawqKG4gJEOzWsWGhvHA.text: Made a reservation and our buddy wasn't properly directed to the hostess but we were seated quickly thank goodness.  We enjoyed some drinks by the swanky bar beforehand, after receiving our food I pretty much immediately gave my compliments to the chefs as I walked back to the table. We shared rabbit, bass, lentils and rosemary garlic bread with two friends. I actually wish it wasn't family style because it sometimes gets awkward when you want to pick up a bone and eat it dry but everyone around you is being a shy eater. Presentation was stunning, our server and the red wine was fantastic. I am really looking forward to revisiting d&w and enjoying the posh ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Food porn!
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. So fab!

j8410LruaQ1ExAmMgc8m_g.text: I had mixed expectations coming here because while I heard great things from some friends, others told me it was mediocre.I arrived at 10:00am for my reservation so I could only order from the breakfast menu. I ordered the duck & waffle as well as the oxtail benedicts. Both were delicious.Duck & Waffle (5/5): The duck was crispy, the waffle had great texture, and the sauce was very unique. It had something that tasted like horseradish but it went well with the maple syrup.Oxcheek Benedicts (5/5): Sauce, meat, and eggs went well together.The only complaint I have was the service. The waiter was not very attentive and never came to check up on us or refill water after we ordered our food.

CpiHMZQ0pv2ysIHx6-ggJQ.text: Let's start off with the reservation process. I am beyond impressed with their team. We had originally, made reservation for 2, and had to change to 3 and last minute changed to 4. Everything was so easy and smoothly to make reservations with these guys, so efficient! 5 stars there!On the day of our reservation, when we arrived, we weren't super pleased with the service from guys greeting us downstairs to hostess bringing u to our table. A little snobbiness in their way... The weirdest part was when we had a server who introduced himself to us and then left for the entire duration of our visit and reappeared right before dessert. And where we were not too pleased with service is when this server took our order for a bottle of rosé and we never got it because he was MIA... So we had food and no drinks for a while.. And the other guys were not helpful in finding our server.Anyhow, for food we got 4 small plates to share and 2 orders of duck and waffle. Food was delicious, it was so well done (5stars here too). We really enjoyed the foie gras brûlée and octopus. The duck was crispy and worked really well with the waffle. To top it off, you are dining on 40th floors of this building and get a beautiful view of the city of London!!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Baked Alaska
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Asparagus
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Octopus

QCMr3cXDTXndMIxJ7dBg7Q.text: Even though nearly had a panic attack in the elevator going up so fast so high the restaurant itself is nice. The lounge area where you an wait for your table was nice and sort of intimate. The décor was different which I really liked. I went around Christmas so the décor was festive but not cheesy.I had a nice long chat with the manager who showed me their private room for special occasions. He was a very polite man and made sure my friends and I were taken care of which was greatly appreciated.I had the chorizo which nice. Not too salty and the portions are great, nothing over the top. I will def go back.Others at my table had the same as well as duck and waffle and had no complaints.Oh the view during the day is spectacular.

bBl7YPNJ0K1-h0nN6f2Bjw.text: This was the most disgusting, vile, pathetic encounter I've ever had with a restaurant. Full disrespect I will preach no one to go to this sinister restaurant. Came here for a birthday dinner with my visiting younger sister and they didn't show hospitality and made us stand outside in the cold while spitting in my face- the saliva actually touched my face. When inside the service was terrible and the food was cold and damp. NEVER go here to celebrate anything more than an Instagram picture.

muimfvSn4tkExilLOoCmAA.text: I'm not from the area and only had one night in London so I decided to try this place out. Walking in you see the beautiful view of the city being at the 40th floor. Atmosphere and service was great, and the food from what we had was amazing.Seared Octopus (appetizer) Duck & Waffle (main dish 1)Soft Cheesy Polenta (main dish 2)Maple Baked Figs (dessert)Overall excellent experience, and I would most definitely go again my next time in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Maple baked figs
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle

mYurJyvuzApNrRhI6wSzDQ.text: Had an excellent breakfast at 6:30 am on Boxing Days. Extremely efficient and friendly.  Had the Duck and waffle without the egg.  Really good, and a great food concept.  And the view is fantastic.

RMNpAZlrqs-2bmiNRZzNuw.text: Duck and Waffle was the biggest disappointment in an otherwise perfect trip to London. We made our brunch reservation as soon as the date was available online (about 3 months in advance of the date).  When we arrived at the restaurant, it was empty. The hostess ignored us for 15 minutes before informing us that they had canceled our reservation. There was no warning email or opportunity to confirm the reservation. The hostess contained that they "tried to call" even though it was noted on the reservation that the phone number I provided was not a U.K. number. The hostess was incredibly rude and insulting. My advice to Duck and Waffle- Treat your customers with decency and kindness. Advice for potential customers- skip this one. There are plenty of other restaurants in London with fantastic views that offer wonderful means and service.

JILqcMQuWW-gUoTsKog69w.text: The view of London really makes this restaurant special.All of the food, although perhaps not the best in London, is tasty and creative.  The Ox Doughnut is a must for anyone who loves heavy, meaty food.  My girlfriend, on the other hand, absolutely loved the steak tartare.Of course, you have to get the Duck and Waffle!  The duck was well cooked, with crispy skin on the outside and juicy on the inside.  The syrup had an interesting spice in it which balanced out its sweetness, and the egg was perfectly runny.  My only critique is that the waffle could have been a bit fluffier on the inside and crispier on the outside.  If you get a bite with the duck, waffle, syrup, and egg though, I must say it is magical.For the price, skip the cocktails.Overall, a must visit, at least once, while in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Dat duck and waffle

fS17GR3UYywM68-QMdtqCQ.text: I was in London for a weekend trip, and following the recommendations of another Yelper who listed it as her "best meal I ever had", I had to come here! And this place does not disappoint. The view is outstanding and almost as good as the London Eye. Of course, the hero of this place is the food, and my oh my was the food delicious. Reservations are needed, and I recommend calling them because their online system is inconsistent. Oh, and also there is a dress code - smart casual, no sneakers or ripped jeans please. Food: 5/5We had the following:their signature dish, duck and waffle, it is a chic take on the Southern class, chicken and waffle. This was my favorite dish because it combined sweet with savory. A fried duck leg is placed on top of a waffle, which is topped off with a runny egg. The maple syrup is served on the side. Delish! ox cheek benedict, this was the favorite of the men in our group. It was a rich and savory dish, combining that sweet tender soft cheek meat with the creaminess of hollandaise. Do not forget to spread some sriracha on there, because that is the critical piece that elevates this dish to the next level. spicy ox cheek donut, this was an interesting blend of mostly savory with hints of sweetness and tangyness. Service: 5/5Super attentive and friendly staff. One of them even jokingly told me he spiked my juice with vodka. Atmosphere: 5/5Very nice and chic, from the glass elevantor going up, to the incredible cocktail bar. It feels lik the IT place in town, of course, this view also helps. Oh right, they are also open 24 hours a day. Value: 4/5Yes, it is on the expensive side but for about the price of a London Eye ticket you get delicious food and a view, which isn't a bad deal at all. Main dishes were just under 20GBP, so with drinks and some shared dishes, it would be around 30GBP.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. View
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle

AhJ7OTjmWdRzvv_1_zJVvA.text: Even though this place open 24/7 make sure you make reservation! I want to say there's no such thing as walk in! Been here twice and I've seen them turn away people without reservation or maybe because I'm going at prime time?! (Around 9am?) And you def have to go to this location not the other ones! The view is amazing! And the food is even better!

0QApP6w24beyMAaha9qB6g.text: This is my favorite place to grab a drink in London.  Their drink menu is always changing - but I have never had a bad drink.  Even with this last visit - where the drinks were things that could be foraged in an urban environment (so trash themed) they were still very tasty.  The drinks are small and a little pricey- but the view is fantastic.  You can not beat a great drink and a panoramic view from 40 stories up.   The bar is open 24 hours- so a great place to bring your drink lagged friends while they adjust to the new time zone.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

7AxEPZX7PZTbphK4U_ShJA.text: Where do I begin?!? The view...spectacular....the food...out of this world...everything about the experience was great. Came in Easter Sunday without a reservation at 10:30pm and easily got a table by the window for drinks and bar food. This spot exceeded our expectations and is def worth the trip!! Can't wait to come back to this one!

H-N3hiE9MQSsaDIrK8ScFg.text: Right when you enter the private elevator and head to the 40th floor of the Heron Tower, you know you are in for a treat.  The city views from the bar and restaurant are exceptional.  It is a must for first timers to order the duck and waffle! The crispy skinned duck with the maple syrup and waffle paired quite well.  The wine selection was spot on for the menu items and the service was fairly good for London standards.  For dessert we went with the baked Alaska. While it wasn't served flaming, it was still decedent.  We topped of dinner with a cappuccino made to order. The prices are on the higher end, but the overall experience makes it well worth it. We will certainly be back! Tip: make reservations way in advance and be prepared because service can get slow.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Dinner is served!
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Classic duck and waffle with seasonal vegetables.

Ajuk_l7JdLxJKe1tvc92HA.text: I can't quite understand what would get someone to open a 24-hour restaurant, but Duck & Waffle has become a popular spot for birthday breakfasts, especially when you work in the City. I came here for a 6 AM reservation on one such occasion, and while I didn't make the reservation myself, I suspect that we were only able to get something that early because it is reportedly very busy for normal breakfast time (i.e. work breakfasts and such). At the time we were dining, there were only a few other occupied tables, and the staff were mopping the floors and doing other admin tasks around the restaurant. This was before Daylight Savings Time, and though it was cloudy, the general intent was also to see the sun rise, which happened shortly after 6 AM. The view is impeccable and among the best in London.As for the food, I had the Duck & Waffle because it was my first time at the restaurant and it had to be done. It's pretty much as it sounds, and certainly a very unique dish, but what I also thought was interesting was that they had mustard seeds in the syrup, though they didn't add a harsh bite. What really called to me was the duck egg en concotte, which my friend ordered and the smell of truffle really got me. I will definitely get that next time. They also have some standard things like eggs benedict, eggs with toast, etc. Since they serve food all day, I know people come for other meals in the day as well, but I'm not sure if any of the other dishes are quite as notable. The view is great but can be enjoyed from the Sushi Samba bar, for which it's generally possible to get in without a reservation.

Iw4_Vd1Q3VSU0f4qUEr-OA.text: The ride up is amazing as you see the lights of the city get smaller and smaller as you get higher and higher. We went at night after the theater and  were seated by the window which was lucky and the view was great but they really need to clean the windows. We were hesitant to to try the Duck and Waffle dish but it was delicious. So was the caramelized banana and waffle for dessert.  It's a fun touristy thing to do.

IbbbqoMHMUKXLLEUX4uUww.text: Amazing view of the city !!! They also have s lot of fun drinks options.  The food is not my favorite since all the choices are very fattening and heavy. I stuck to the goat cheese and mushroom bread and left quite hungry They do make a lot of original dishes such as s foie creme brûlée but I didn't dare try it. I shall be back

LwUQkAEmMrFpF89DWzG14A.text: View is 9/10, wine is 8/10, food is 7/0. Had a laugh, place is open 24 hours and makes for a good spot after work. Can be a bit pricy IMHO. Good date spot but to book a seat at a time a normal person would go (and not past midnight)...well you'll have to book in advance. Anyway, go there with whoever and you'll enjoy yourself :)

OJAKrLV4_rMS1nEyx5y1jA.text: Food is awesome. Had the octopus, eel, Brussels sprouts, etc which were all excellent!  Only downside was the pretentious staff at the entrance and in the bar. Get over yourselves!Worth a visit

cLgXP3AsRl7yBQ_-3oY6eg.text: To celebrate our last night in London our friend made reservations (two months in advance) for this posh and trendy restaurant overlooking the London Skyline.Taking a glass escalator to the top of one of London's tallest skyscrapers may be a bit of a hardship for anyone afraid of heights but phobia aside the culinary experience makes a trip to the 40th story worthwhile. For drinks, the Roasted Cosmo and Red Bell Pepper Bellini's were favorites, but the real star of the night was the duck and waffle (think chicken and waffle except with crispy roast duck, flavorful but not overly sweet sesame maple syrup, and a fried duck egg to bring it all home). The glazed lamb breast, roasted octopus (my personal favorite with its meaty chunks of octopus paired with potatoes), the artichoke and parmesan bread, and Pollock meatballs with lobster sauce were delicious. However, would hold off on the yellowfin tuna as portion size was meagre. Desert was hot chocolate and a shared plate of fancy French toast. Buzzing with well-heeled London professionals, be prepared to pay as the meal plus drinks are not cheap. Service is polite and brisk, accommodating as they moved our seat closer to the window, but not outstanding. If you are just interested in the bar, hours are late and reservations are not required but recommended to be guaranteed a seat/table.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Roasted Cosmo
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Glazed lamb breast

JW-7OKT_UU1lh9Aabp4WuA.text: This review is only in regards to the entrance host/reception. Unfortunately I was not able to dine at the restaurant so I can not comment about restaurant service or food.In London for 3 weeks for business, I've been pretty much making my way down all the recommended restaurants on some of the top restaurant lists. So after reading some positive reviews about this restaurant, I decided I would check it out. My colleague and I had just gotten back from Germany the day before, so we did not have any reservations, but we decided to try our luck. We decided to visit before lunch today (Thursday, Feb 18). Since I've checked on Google the time that the restaurant can get busy for lunch, we decided we should arrive before the noon rush (According to Google, their peak lunch hours were noon-2pm). So my colleague and I arrived around 11:30 (give or take) and at first we walked past it. Then we circled back and saw the entrance. There was no line or any other customer there. I saw only one person at the counter and I approached the male host on the first (aka ground) floor entrance. I believe he was busy looking over resumes or what look like them on his counter. We did the friendly greetings and I asked him if there were seating for 2 at Duck & Waffle? Without checking a reservation list, computer, or anything, he quickly said, "No, sorry, we are completely booked." Ok - well, I understand: it could be one of those fully booked Thursday. He told me that I can just come back later and try again. So I asked him what would be a good time to come back? In 30 minutes? An hour? Is there an estimated time I can try again? He just kinda looked at me without an answer and instead said, "Here, why don't you call to make a reservation" (or something along those lines) as he proceeded to grab a business card on the counter. As he was about to the grab a card (there were two business card holders on the counter - one for sushi and another for duck), he then suddenly asked me, "What restaurant was it you want?" I told him "Duck & Waffle" again and he grabbed the "Duck & Waffle" card and handed to me.I thanked him and left, however when I went out, something just doesn't quite add up in my mind. From not looking at the list, no estimated time frame to check back and especially the last question really boggled my mind?! I felt like something was just off.It was a short encounter but it just felt like the whole thing was a half-@ss attempt to deny access. He answered quickly and confidently when I asked him about a table in the beginning, yet less than a minute later, he forgot which restaurant I wanted to get a table at? Were both restaurant fully booked for Thursday lunch? Even so, he forgot which one so quickly? Not only that, usually a host can give a rough estimate of when to try back or they will straight up tell you, no way in hell you will get in without a reservation way ahead of time (think French Laundry, Jiro, Noma etc.) So I decided to check up on the reviews in regards to the receptionist/front desk/host related comments and it seems quite a few people have some negative things to say about it. If I wasn't dress up up to the nines - fair enough, let me know. If you need a reservation months ahead of time - fair enough, just tell me. So after feeling like the host was just half-@ssing it - I decided to share my opinion of the encounter with the host. Again, this review is not about the food and food service, since I did not have the chance to try it.

PNZyc_1euFcrc2fcSz9wWg.text: We're given a fistful of menus - bunch, all day, cocktail and wine. I'd already decided to have the Duck & Waffle (£17), which is under the 'For the table' section of the menu along with a 400g Yorkshire Rib Eye (£35) and Whole Roasted Honey Glazed Ham Hock (£26) amongst others, although it's not really big enough to share and once you've tasted it, you won't want to! The combination of crispy skin, confit leg, waffle, runny egg yolk and a dip in to the pot of mustard maple syrup was incredible! As good a mouthful of food as you'll ever have.Antonia had the Duck Egg en Cocotte (£10), which came in it's own little pan covered in wild mushrooms, truffle and melted gruyère with a stack of soldiers willing to sacrifice themselves for the cause. Not exceptional but a solid dish none the less and surprisingly filling given it's size.We also had a portion of BBQ Spiced Crispy Pig Ears (£5), which, unexpectedly came in a super cool brown paper bag with a duck seal. Once you rip it open you see a pile of thin, crispy pig ears that look like a game of pick-up-sticks. They're really crispy as you'd expect and the BBQ seasoning is pretty decent. They're kind of what I hoped the pork scratchings at Barbecoa would be like.Considering you'll spend about the same amount as a ticket to go on the London Eye or up The Shard but have some delicious food and better views, Duck & Waffle is great value. The service was excellent throughout our vist and they recently announced that it would be open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. I've no idea how much trade they do in the small hours but next time I'm in the area at stupid o'clock I may well popup for a drink, snack and another look at those views.

YLkSuYdMoBhT2daqJwF-Wg.text: The view is amazing! Unfortunately, we had a bad experience with the food. They accidentally wayyyyy overcooked my waffle. I thought it might have just been out of character, but then the person at the table next to us had to send back his food because there was a hair in it. Still, I really do recommend this place for visitors to London. You can get cocktails at the bar without a reservation and I imagine the food will be good enough despite those two incidents.

0WfOHrLB3Q6HbJ4HKlPKYA.text: This restaurant is a wonderful experience! The view alone makes it worth the price, but the food is delicious too. Make sure to make a reservation so you can sit by the window. It's not required, but it's good to be prepared  because they get busy! You also have to see a host and check in before they will even let you get on the elevator to go to the 40th floor. My husband and I split the duck and waffle and the gnocchi dish. They were both phenomenal. As other reviewers have mentioned, I was skeptical about the duck and waffle combination, but it is a perfect duo. The duck is flavorful and crispy, and the waffle is thick. We went here while on our honeymoon, and the next time we are in London, we will definitely be back!

x0rcrxMP-RadYy2QmSPKVg.text: Due to my EPIC failure I had to award a five star. I have never been until now but on what I have read on yelp, I knew I must try the actual duck and waffle dish they are famous for. I ordered the bacon wrapped dates that were stuffed with chorizo which added to the soft textured dates and the crunch of the bacon. The sweet and salty combination just works and was a hit that went down a treat. The second dish was the n'duja & gruyère pizzeta which was a thin baked tomato and cheese pizza that had hot spots of chillie that woke your mouth up. The pizza was nice and crunchy and was a real good share on the table. The next plate was the 400g USDA ribeye with bone marrow butter that had hints of garlic a and added herbs that really push the flavours and makes you understand the phrase 'melts in your mouth like butter'. The ribeye was cooked to fantastic perfection and made to the chefs preference of medium which I was convinced was medium rare, either way it was a luscious cut of meat and the size was good enough to share baring in mind we have ordered a few dishes. By the time I was devouring the ribeye I quickly realised how much I was enjoying the food as my body hit the wall, the food wall. This was the point my body was drunk from the protein hit of the ribeye, the sweet and crunchy taste of the bacon wrapped dates. I was now beginning to regret I put I a lot of energy into the thin crust pizza earlier, but before I was aloud to wallow in my own shameful self pity the waiters then brought out the hara bhara lamb cutlets which was accompanied by a smooth rich smoked aubergine. I was dizzy, sweating holding the edge of the tables thinking what the hell have I done. Then I utter the words I despise, 'do you have a takeaway box'. I was defeated by the ribeye and lamb cutlet combo, I had reluctantly thrown in the towel to surrender to this magnificent food tasting dinning experience. Then it happened, the waiter brought their glorious trademark signature dish, yes the duck and waffle which came with the beautiful mustard seed syrup. And that's when it happened, my eyes were activated  they did truly became bigger than my belly and something happened that only really happens in rare occasions when I'm truly experiencing an over whelming eating sensation my second stomach was ready to eat, somehow my body found room to ingest more rich and glorious food, I pick the fork up and it was back on!Their was no way I was leaving here without trying this signature dish which I began by dividing it into two equal parts which was shared with my wife, then I poured over the mustard seed syrup and began devouring. I quickly realised why this was special. It was the balance of full on flavours and texture. The rich saltiness of the duck that was also really crispy on the outside and succulently soft which brilliantly went well with the spongy crunch of the partially sweet baked waffle. The real sweetness came from the mustard seed syrup which was a rich hit of mourishly golden goodness. The only real disappointment is that I had a big full rack of ribs, fries and onion rings a few hours earlier at TGIfridays. I will not be making this fatal floor again I will be going back to the duck and waffle prepared and continue this eternal eating battle where this time 'I WILL NOT PUT THE FORK DOWN UNTIL I HAVE WON'PS. I will be eating my takeaway box in loving memory of this amazing night out.

Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. 400g USDA ribeye and bone marrow butter with watercress & radish salad.
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Hara bhara lamb cutlets with smoked aubergine

yavGsnDdtT8vLOs7vhbL9A.text: This place is amazing! Definitely order the duck and waffle... Duh! If you can't get a reservation go there for a late night snack. The late night menu is limited but still well worth it. We got there a little after midnight and didnt have to wait for a table. The place had such good energy that the drinks kept on flowing that night. Also don't forget to get a quick glimpse of the gherkin building upon entering the establishment. One of my favorite buildings

p6KiiN0ehlwQlITfUo3IXQ.text: Amazing food with spectacular views.I'd give it 5 stars, but you need to make reservations MONTHS in advance because it's just so popular.My friend and I went for brunch, and decided to split the Duck and Waffle, and a fruit salad. Trust me, sharing the duck and waffle dish was a mistake, as we were both sad it was so small. Get one for just yourself.So it's expensive, and hard to get a reservation for, but still worth a visit as the food was excellent.It's also useful to know that if you're just hoping to go up and see the view, you can go up to the bar and have a drink (no reservation needed). Just tell the people at the door you're going to the bar for a quick drink and they'll let you up. :)

tSNY3XRNCiYOmm6qLlBIEg.text: Yes the reviews are correct - this is a wonderful eating experience over-looking London City. As I was a newbie here I went for the traditional Duck & Waffle and was not one bit disappointed - absolutely delicious! The duck, waffle and egg with the sweet mustardy syrup hit the spot bang on the head! Definitely a combination of flavours that had me going "Oooh yes yes yes!" Fortunately I went with ppl who'd eaten there before and got to try the Ox cheek doughnut - (yum!) and the breads with the different cheese toppings - (heavenly yum!)Definitely come here! (But you should book in advance if you're coming for a weekend dinner - also I've heard the sunrise early morning breakfasts are a must-do)

QlchPtbaS2gebnZqvchDKw.text: From stepping into the glass elevator and being whisked up to the 40th floor, I knew I was in for a treat. The views going up the elevator were amazing, although a little vertigo inducing!We were seated immediately and the servers had no problem seating us at a window seat. We ordered a bottle of wine and the rosemary, garlic bread to start with. The bread was fresh and the garlic was roasted, breaking into a spreadable garlicy paste when cut into with a knife.Next we ordered the bacon wrapped dates. This was my favourite meal of the night! The meatyness of the dates meshed well with the bacon, and the salad garnish and honey mustard sauce really complimented the meaty flavours with their crisp clean taste. The scallops and the venison carpaccio from the raw section were ok. There was more apple then scallops (it looked like they cut one single scallop into 5 small pieces) and the venison, again was quite small. I did like the salt blocks they brought them out on.Next course was the artichoke stew and the mutton sloppy joe. The artichoke stew was cooked very nicely, the corn and beans worked well. The mutton on the sloppy joe was delicious, however I wish there were pickles, or coleslaw, or something to add a little crunch to the sandwich. It was just the meat and the bread and the texture was a bit mushy.The duck and waffle were very nice! I normally am not a fan of duck, however the duck was very tender and not too game-y. The waffle was also cooked well. After another bottle of wine we ordered the cheese selection and the assorted sweets. Both were nice, but the cracker to cheese ratio was off.. need to add more crackers!The service was amazing. Everyone was very attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu. The views were gorgeous as well.

ATJZNlFFXyzXE0JB7lUvBw.text: Amazing. Pricey if you include alcohol but the food is great. Beautiful views I had the duck and waffle and can't wait to go back again. I took my friend for her birthday. Fantastic booths and great service.

axysc-Tmznpz85SwV9gQpg.text: The views are amazing , the food is OK but what ruins this place for me is the service. I particularly asked for a table by the window when I made the reservation and they didn't give us one despite there being quite a few available. The staff doesn't try at all to impress. I've been three times since I work in the area but am not coming back

14sLPAgxm3YyGqlPzGks3w.text: Crab on toast, roasted pig cheeks in a paper bag, mackerel tartare with toast, spicy ox cheek doughnut, duck and waffle, roasted peach melba, Saint lager (x2), mutton slider, duck egg en cocotte (wild mushrooms, truffle), sazerac, virgin cocktail. All of this came to 100 pounds for the two of us with tip included.Considering the normal rip-off prices for mediocre food when you dine at the top of skyscrapers, this is actually pretty good. Some of the food dishes were five-star worthy (ox doughnut, duck egg, duck and waffle) even at street-level and nothing other than the winelist was over 15 pounds. Service was great as well, with some pzzazz provided by the cocktail staff doing things like the Sazerac (try it!) and taking photos of plebs like us.We went at 6pm on a Friday with a booking made 3 weeks earlier. The glass elevator up to the 40th floor and the view from staircase wrapping up around the bar were definite highlights (as was the ear-popping elevator drop back down). We got a great table for two up against the glass with a 600ft drop right down to Liverpool St station and watched toy buses winding around Shoreditch in the distance. Those with tables for 3, 4 or more end up stuck in the middle away from the windows but with a lovely ceiling to admire.The plates are pretty small, so don't expect to fill up to bursting point, but do expect some creative plates even if they don't all taste Michelin level. If you just want the view, you can actually come from breakfast, lunch or even midnight snacks. Duck and Waffle really IS 24 hours! You'll probably still need a reservation as it's crazy popular right now (Autumn 2012) but you can just drop by for a cocktail at the bar without a booking. As for us... we're now planning an East-viewing table for 7am in December. I want the sun to rise over Essex and land on my penthouse breakfast!

KdIG4H5sImYvl24v8jRpqA.text: Food is amazing as well as view. Very hard to get a booking unless well planned 2-3 months ahead.Have been a few times. However a good way to try walk in is either go there super late (midnight) or super early (before dawn hahaha).Was my roomie's birthday and we went crazy and go there at 6:30 and see the sunrise. Breakfast very fulfilling. Wasn't hungry after a whole day of work :)

nL-AeQ17U-bXx4yWqhWw_A.text: Come for the view, stay for a taste of the signature duck and waffle. It's definitely an interesting take on waffles, though admittedly not the most memorable. As mentioned, the real star of the restaurant is the breathtaking view of pretty much all of London, which will keep your eyes busy while your mouth tends to the interesting menu the restaurant has come up with.

ft8y0mI2qCUdCfJXDDw8rw.text: Been to duck and waffle quite a while ago. Indeed great view but the food in my memory was just above average -- maybe that's why I couldn't really recall what I ate there!

sWRj34vgdc_7Wmt5sTg25g.text: The views are incredible, the service is everything you would expect for the price, calm and attentive. The decor is classy and the food is excellent (albeit expensive). I have been back a few times, usually just for the Duck and Waffle which always hits the spot. If you haven't had it yet you don't know what you are missing.

JvS050YJ0IL_fCc7GTCqhw.text: Verdict: A guilty as well as expensive pleasure YAY!Pros:- THE AMAZING VIEW. Best 360 view of London period. Even more amazing at sunset! And I must admit, as an exception to the rule thus highly unlike me, I accept overpaying for it.- To die for: The duck & waffle, and I usually avoid/dislike mixing the taste of sweet and meat but the mustard maple syrup and runny yolk is INGENIOUS!- To die for again and again:The foie gras creme brulee. What guilty pleasure!- Rosemary & Garlic bread.- The cocktails!!!Cons:- Booking is a must and a month or two in advance for the regular/normal/popular meal hours! And as a tourist it will effect and might make planning your itinerary more difficult.- Staff can be and at times have felt less accommodating and somewhat stand-offish.

YH3DSkK858zMRZn19QwogA.text: Absolutely superb food with a breathtaking view. On a clear beautiful day you can see for miles and this was especially good this weekend with the beautiful weather watching sunrise over breakfast was so incredible. Definitely going back!

Rkxrzdn07FqZjruJ2kGd3A.text: Worth it for the spectacular view alone! I love that this place is open and serves food 24 hours a day. Great spot for a late night meal if you're jet lagged. Come dressed up because most of the people here will be. The food is pretty tasty too.

t3Aa2KYKzFL17kcMJ7Rs7g.text: I came here to meet up with my college gf for breakfast at 8am. There are lots of working professionals who came here for breakfast. The elevator ride was a little scary because you see exactly how high you're going. When you get up there, the view is amazing! I would recommend making a reservation if you could only because a lot of people do eat here. We ordered the assorted pastries, duck and waffle with hash browns to share. Everything was delicious. I thought service was a bit slow but that's because I'm from NYC. Other than that I highly recommend this place and I think it would be lovely if I had a date to go and enjoy the view with

7P_QdkfbLpg5QPgq3sXtsw.text: I love their food and view. Only because of the view I recommend this restaurant to my friends instead of the London Eye. You'll get the view, and a meal for pretty much the same price tag. The first time I went here I didn't have a reservation. Although it was a busy Saturday night, they had exactly one table left with an outstanding view of the city. We could see the Gherkin, the Shard and the London Bridge from our table, just beautiful. The staff was very welcoming. The second time around some of the staff was rather inattentive, which bothered me a bit. The food and the view make up for this though. I really recommend the Duck & Waffle, of course. Other dishes we had were the foie gras and the smoked salmon. Their desserts are divine too, if you already had the duck & waffle, don't go for a waffle dessert; it's too much I think. The cocktails are pretty pricey, as they are more expensive than most of the food items on the menu (£15, whereas most items are only around or less than £10, only the D&W is £17). But, I guess you're paying for the view too. If you're celebrating something they'll give you some bonbons on the house.4/5

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Stairs to Sushi Samba
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Moon and city view
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Amazing view at night

5w5zpSRV_HH8Tc5LyHCOdA.text: Conclusion: go somewhere elseTheir signature dish (duck & waffle) was meh...duck was crispy on the outside, but from being fried, which somehow made the duck less moist inside. Waffle was dense and not light.ProsGreat view of the cityConsInattentive service... Needed water but no one bothered to fill our glassesLimited menu options... Pretty much get the duck, the fish or chickenPlace is dated...chair seats were cracked and ceiling had dust

feldlhIX-CLU14c14340Gw.text: Most of the stuff I will say here has already been said, but I'd like to reconfirm. First, the setting. Shooting up the elevator above all of the lights of the city is a pretty cool feeling. Then the bar seemed like a nice spot with a view view straight out to the gherkin. They could put more seats in the bar- the tenders stand around a large table on the middle with all of there ingredients and make drinks there. After about ten minutes we were ushered to our seats for dinner. We somehow scored the corner table looking northwest- a very nice view indeed. Perfect setting for dinner. The dining room was modern and rustic at the same time with an open kitchen. Next the drinks. Cocktails were £14 each so instead we ordered a glass of Malbec (£10 for 125 ml) and an asahi (£7 for a bottle). Both were standard, but at those prices, it wasn't a place to booze up. Next the food: Ox cheek donut- seems to be the signature entree, a large! Cinnamon coated pastry with apricot sauce and spicy meat on the inside. This was big enough for two split. Really good entree. Glad we did not let the waiter up sell us to get bread as the bread looked disappointing. Duck and waffle- the namescape dish, the duck confit was perfect- crispy portions with skin. Went well with the waffle it sat atop and the syrup enhanced the flavor once you poured it on. It also came with an egg, which seemed overkill. Would rather have more syrup. Jerusalem artichoke ravioli- the surprise star of the night- rich cinnamon and buttery flavor with (I guess) truffle (can't say I can ever tell truffle...), but nevertheless this was the dish I wished I had more of. All the dishes were heavy, rich, flavorful, and filling. They all had sweet tinges to them, meaning we didn't need dessert. Overall a great experience. Would recommend it to most anyone once, but the value is more in the food than the drinks.

0aErGmw9k2Lthbi7I_5nRQ.text: Extremely rude bouncer and staff, do not recommend if you want to be treated like a human being

WG8gGHmo76kJFOYhtNjyDw.text: Had a nice experience enjoying the view and relaxing during my day date with the hubby. The food may not have been the most delicious thing I've ever had, but I went in understanding it's more about the experience than the meal. So, I was not disappointed in that regard. The service, however, really surprised me in a good way. We weren't rushed and my water was refilled often. He seemed to keep an eye on us without being too obnoxious. The perfect combination from my American perspective. I plan to take guests here if I can get a reservation and I'd recommend it for a special event as long as you go in knowing it's not going to be world class food despite the price tag.

Qa7_cGByiCbqVE8TO5NGTg.text: Absolutely fantastic. Had the brussel sprouts which were perfectly roasted and the citrus sauce they came with was the perfect compliment. Second we had the maple cornbread which was great as well. Freshly baked and very flavorful. We finished with the Duck and Waffle. Amazing dish, perfectly crispy duck, a rich duck egg, and a light waffle underneath. Overall a fantastic experience and great food. A must for any time of day in London!

xfrZ3-e30kJx6p4eIrNZKA.text: We went here for drinks around 7:30pm on a workday and were suprised that we didn't have to wait in line to get in. We were waved straight into the glas elevator to get shot up 40 floors. With a little luck we got a table by the window to enjoy the breathtaking view over London. A Gin & Tonic, a Shiraz and some (admittedly amazing) baked bread with artichoke ran us 45 pounds. To be fair, the wine was pretty good and the G&T was made with Monkey 47. Nevertheless, you pay for the view and that was worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

qU6ElOhtbG5Ep28-NaFiLQ.text: Duck and waffle seems to be more about the experience of dining 40 stories high than the high caliber dishes. However, the view did not disappoint. Although the restaurant faces away from the Thames, the view is still panoramic and beaut. I would suggest dining at sunset or night, but day time is still pretty nice when it's sunny.As for the food/drinks, I went with Bloody Mary, which was spiced to perfection, and the Colombian eggs which were decent, but could have been more seasoned. Great for lunch meetings, brunch dates, or small groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Columbian eggs

gNI3uaKkJRFe-Tq43VoqfA.text: Great view, lovely place for a date. The duck and waffle was nice, as were the fried pigs ears, however I would not rush back to dine there but it was a nice experience

BultImgLUFKiY6YIPB6xPw.text: What can be better than an amazing view AND fabulous food? Seriously, nothing. I had the namesake dish and it is not to be missed. The duck was perfectly crispy, the waffle was fluffy and delicious, the egg was nicely runny, the syrup pulled it all together... I've basically been dreaming about it ever since. The cocktails are on point and the service is great. I just wish it wasn't so difficult to get a reservation here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & Waffle!
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Artichoke and parmesan bread
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Looking down on the Gherkin!

PU6JkJlk6248ZJFrY5QfHQ.text: Wow what a view!  Let's face it this is what you are paying for!  The service was awesome as well!  The food I would rate as 3-3.5 stars.  Not the best but not horrible.  Just above average.  The portions are small but that might just me being use to the huge portions in the US.  When they say it can feed 3-4...it's more like 2.   The view though just amazing.   The staff and experience 5 stars.
