Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

4p7Q_GBTlUAafLW_VAJ_tA.text: My friends have been raving about this Duck & Waffle for a long time. I thought that it would not meet expectations, but it did! I went for dinner. You have to get the Duck & Waffle. I split it with my friend so we could order some appetizers for variety as well. The violet artichoke & Parmesan was incredible. I highly recommend it! The bread was very fluffy and delicious. We had a raw tuna special appetizer that was also delicious. We also ordered two polentas, which were good. The view was incredible! (I cannot believe we got a window seat!) The service was extremely attentive and friendly. I wrote that it was my friend's birthday dinner. They brought us a small biscuit and wrote happy birthday in chocolate on a tray. She was thrilled! It was a lovely evening. I thought it would be more expensive than it was, it was around 38p each.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Artichoke & Parmesan
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

3xw7fWj-DSHfUeav-tWUEw.text: I've been terrible about writing review lately, but this one I had to write to shout out to David, who made what could have been a terrible review good.Arrived 10 minutes late for our reservation, but the waitress didn't come back for our order until 30 minutes later.  She then forgot I ordered wine.As we ordered a bunch of small things, and my friend was having the 1/2 lobster, we told them to bring items as they were done.  We received the lobster within minutes of ordering.  Then came the pig cheeks with polenta.  A few minutes later the foie gras.  Ten minutes after that, the bread.We were done eating, and I was about to tell the waitress to hold the duck and waffles, and just as I'm about to do so - she comes by and says, shall I change the plates for the duck and waffles?  I'm not sure what she wanted us to do - have me eat the duck and waffles while my dining companion sat there with an empty plate?I guess food comes when it's done - but if the duck and waffles is going to come 30 minutes later than all the rest of the food - you should tell us that when we order.I tried to have a few bites, and truthfully, if it had come during the middle of the meal, I would have enjoyed it, and eaten less of the other stuff.  But as I was already full, I took a bite of the duck, and that was it.Enter David- who came to chekc up on us 10 minutes after the duck and waffles arrived.  He asked if everything was alright since it idn't look like I enjoyed it.  I explained that it came after we thought the waitress had forgotten about it, and was able to cancel the order.  We had finished our meal, and as delicious as it was, I was full.  I wasn't looking to get anything for it, but he graciously said he would remove the duck and waffles from the bill - as it looked like I hadn't eaten touched it.  And he removed the service charge as well.  Now that's service - if it wasn't for David last night, this review would have been - good food - but service so bad it's not worth it.  Instead, now I can really talk about the food.Duck and Waffles - Really good.  The duck was crispy, the waffles perfectly made.  Not sure what the egg did for the dish, and tasted pretty similar to a regular egg, so I would skip that.Foie gras - amazing, probably the best dish of the night, loved the brulee portion of it.  Added a nice dimension.Pig cheeks - polenta was amazing while it was warm.  But definitely heavy, and having it wiht the foie gras, you can understand why I was full, having finished both of those before the duck and waffled came.1/2 lobster - a lobster is a lobster.The elevators weren't working so we took the scenic tour up - taking stairs, then elevator, then stairs, then walking through some open office space, to 39, and then had to find our way through Sushi Samba to Duck and Waffle on 40

9gxuN8jZ68r4TOezOZVVVw.text: Hands down, one of the best meals I've had in London. From the booking process all the way through leaving the building, the service was impeccable. When I made my reservation I mentioned that my parents were coming in from America and the dinner was sort of a belated birthday meal for myself and my mother, and requested a table with a view. Obviously they can't promise good weather, but the guy said he'd see what he could do with regard to a window view. When we arrived, there was a small queue for the lift (to the side of the main entrance) but we mentioned having a reservation at Duck and Waffle and were immediately told to go in. It sounded like the doorman almost doubles as a bouncer, picking and choosing who goes in - if you don't have a reservation, that is!We were whisked - yes, whisked on a super fast lift - up to the top, the 40th floor. Unfortunately we only arrived just in time for the booking, otherwise we would have stopped for a cocktail. The cocktail bar looked amazing - a bar set up in the centre of the room like a buffet with bar staff making gorgeous looking drinks out of super fresh ingredients. Anyway, we walked through the cocktail bar to the restaurant for our meal. Oh, and the guy who I asked for a table with a view? Boy, did he deliver! We had a table in the corner, which is perfect when you're surrounded by glass walls. As for the food: delicious. No, really. I'll break down what we got:- freshly baked house bread served warm with butter and olive oil. Good, but definitely the worst part of the meal. It didn't have anything special to it, but that's ok: the food got so much better from there.- raw yellowfin tuna served on a salt block with a bit of watermelon, balsamic, and basil. so so so good, and the salt block added a touch of saltiness to the watermelon, which is always a good thing. - pearl barley and mushroom ragout served with goat curd and a 63 degree hen egg. That egg, by the way, is the only reason I pushed for us to order this - I'd never had one, but heard how good it was. And, yes, it was delicious. So was the pearl barley and the goat curd. I actually don't really like mushrooms (ever since a terrible case of food poisoning last year) but surprisingly enjoyed this one. - seared scottish scallops served with mussels and mashed potato in seaweed and saffron broth. Absolutely delicious. It only had 2 each of the mussels and scallops, and I didn't get to try the scallops, but the rest was really really good. There was a sweetness in the mash, but a saltiness in the broth and it worked really well together.- fois gras creme brulee with lobster. I didn't try this one, so I can't speak to it. My father was the only one of us who ate it and, while he loved it, he said he wouldn't order it again if he was the only one eating it because it was so rich (well, yeah. it's fois gras!). I did pick the lobster off the dish, which was yummy, and he did mention it was fois gras with the texture of a creme brulee dessert, so take from that what you will. - the duck and waffle. yes, of course we got this! we got two, in fact! and i can't even tell you. seriously, mouth orgasm. the melding of flavours - savoury duck leg, soft and subtly sweet waffle, perfectly fried duck egg, strangely addicting mustard maple syrup - it all worked so well together. The only thing I'd say is that there was too little egg, I think - I "ran out" of egg halfway through. Then again, two eggs would probably be a bit much. If you go here and do not order this, I think you're sorely missing out. We then decided that, as delicious as the meal was, we had to get dessert. Right. Torrejas and petit fours it is. It was my first time having torrejas - basically, a dessert  version of french toast (or eggy bread for some of you) which they served with slices of (baked?) apple in a caramel-type sauce and a scoop of cinnamon ice cream - and I absolutely loved it. The fact that I love french toast obviously helps here. The petit fours were alright, not to my taste (except for one, a coconut marshmallow thing) - but as there were only 6 of them and 3 of us, my parents were happy to finish those. I thought serving them in a dish on a bed of candied nuts was a really great touch....Until they brought out a dish with 3 more petit fours sitting on top a smear of what may have been marshmallow fluff with "Happy Birthday" written in chocolate syrup. Yum.The whole meal - including 2 coffees, a tea, 2 bottles of water and a bottle of wine - came to just under 200 GBP. It's not cheap, but it was worth it. It's rare you get a restaurant that has delicious food when it's in such a prime location. The view was remarkable, the food was wonderful, and the staff were great. What more could you ask for in a restaurant?

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. View from the corner table

k7zbJSY7tf7oBPkNMDxk3Q.text: Everyone says this place is amazing. Hence the trying it out for brunch this afternoon. Sadly, my £14 mimosa was warm, as the the OH's beer (sent back). Food - the spicy ox cheek doughnut was genius and gorgeous! ...But should have been hotter. Then we ordered the namesake duck & waffle and I did a wrongun with the English Breakfast. Ok but nothing entirely special. The breakfast came with the toughest bread posing as toast I've ever encountered. What was special was the super fast lift to the 40th floor that no one warned me about! (ears actually popped!). Great experience buuuuut won't be back in a hurry

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. screen shot from the lift vid

MAvYWqlnyzUYiSSKmm_ODg.text: One of the best restaurant in London, food was great and view is absolutely fantastic.  This place is a must especially if you are visiting London for the first time.  I do recommend making a reservation because without it you'll be waiting 3 hours or more.  Also dress code is strictly enforced, no tennis shoes what so ever even though they might be nice tennis shoes, so come properly dressed.

g4DnnxntkjpxnJhP9t2kuQ.text: Very difficult to find a table if you don't book well in advance. However, if you don't get the table you can have a good cappuccino and juice and mixed croissants at the bar! Not bad for a quick breakfast with such a view!

Pzd-k4Wpgbi2vagOBj-zqg.text: Often, when I have a bad experience with a business or restaurant I find it hard to write too much about it. I feel that sometimes the emotional frustration can overwhelm my ability to articulate what I did not like.So, on the opposite end of the scale, I am struggling to articulate my complete feelings for Duck & Waffle. Other than to say I absolutely love this place.The service.The drinks.The duck.The waffle.The view.The lot.All absolutely world-class. If Ferris Bueller came here (perhaps as part of some sort of Abe Froman subterfuge) I would be certain that he would say "If you have the means, I highly recommend coming here."

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

3EDVb2Twc6wlFDU5lvV5CQ.text: Good cocktails, amazing view, and imaginative takes on duck and waffle plates.  Bread options were good too.  Reservations are tough so look ahead as much as possible!

KUDzdxs6ebWAyQnpny0oxQ.text: Loved it here! The duck and waffle were perfect but you cannot beat the view of London! The drinks were also delicious and unique.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

8snp5ABFh1Iw-io-QhDJLw.text: Went up at 11pm for a cocktail with views. The line for the lift moved quickly, make sure you bring ID and don't wear shorts/trainers! The cocktails were expensive, as expected, but they were well made and tasty. The views were amazing and the bar was very swanky... definitely worth the trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

Qg19V0pid69PzQCRLvmQmA.text: Love the environment and the place I went to London and I had dinner here love the food good service great view

vmQoL9PxSQB57lfxAn6opg.text: The view is great great and plus great. Take your loved ones here for birthday or Mother's Day or any type of special occasion. But my honest advice: order one duck and waffle, and something else. It was a creative nice dish but not worth to order two. Should try other good food there. The pork ear is too crispy but the peri peri sauce is better than Nando's (maybe not better, but definitely sweeter. )

G-d4ddLVBvhC32o5wA-0jw.text: Not much needs to be said about the highest restaurant in the UK: it's absolutely brilliant. Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?It doesn't get any better than this really. Assuming you get a bit lucky and can snag a peak reservation, the atmosphere at Duck & Waffle is sensational. High above the city with panoramic views, the atmosphere itself is worth it, and the top notch service, refined yet flexible, make it such that you can enjoy those beautiful views without worrying about any inconveniences with respect to your meal. Star Granted. Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?Beauty and quality come at a cost, and this is London after all, but I was honestly flabbergasted that my flagship Duck & Waffle dish came to only £15.00. Granted the dish isn't very big, with half a waffle and only a single piece of duck, but even after I'd tacked on a side of sausage and some coffee I was only just over £20.00 before tax and tip. Given the quality and presentation of it all this was well worth the expense. Star Granted. Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?I maybe have duck every other month in some form or fashion, but I really do enjoy it, and the duck here at Duck & Waffle was excellent. While you've a bit of a chore on your hands surgically removing the meat from the bone, skin, etc. the process could be rather easily done with just a fork and knife and the flavor was tremendous. The waffle was excellent, and the mustard seed maple syrup was the real gem here, with a sweetness and tangy factor that reminded me a bit of carolina barbecue atop a waffle of all things. Also of note was the fantastic side of sausage that I got, which was some of the best breakfast sausage I've had. Dual Stars Granted. Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?It's impossible to say no here - Duck & Waffle is a must-do in London whether you're visiting or live here. Star Granted.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & Waffle: 15.00

zQA2CJICIqNtLHfa5dDZvw.text: My sister and I arrived at 12:00am from another trendy London spot (The Gibson, much friendlier, go there) and a night at the theater for her birthday. The bouncer took one look at us and said "no trainers" while proceeding to let multiple men in sweatpants and trainers in and women on high heels.Dress codes are historically sexist (and racist), don't go here.And a side note: if you are going to have a strict dress code (for women) it has to be way more pronounced on the website.

c43EdEMxBSfFi5mq1oCuWQ.text: Worth it for the view and ambience alone! The food is excellent and creative. Great cocktails and wine list. Helpful sommelier. Excellent service. Courses are slightly rushed, however. And there is an expiration time on your table, which made us wish we didn't order multiple courses.

dJcNwrG7ImF20_ZCljZH9w.text: My wife and I stopped here for a late night bite and drink. Let's start with the positive. The views are spectacular from the 40th floor location of the restaurant. If you want to impress a date. It's a good place for that. The food looks good. We had a fresh bread starter that was delicious and the drink menu is fun and inventive. The negative... a bit pricey but understandable with the quality of food and drink they serve. It's more so the atmosphere was a bit superficial and I think it misses the mark. A bit Euro-Trashy for my taste. Techno music and rude host/Hostess. I think this place tries to go in too many directions. Then again I may not be the demographic they are aiming for.

TumQ8UMLxCjRTEpeznyHxw.text: Great atmosphere and great service.  Food was all spot on except the steak which was very tough.  Signature duck and waffle dish was excellent...better than expected.  I recommend this place and I will definitely dine here again.

TdKOZPeAbz2ZR6bxnBW-rg.text: I read a few of the one star reviews on here and they are spot on. I just returned from dinner here with my husband and we were both upset by the time we got seated. The entire experience getting up there ruined an already mediocre meal. We came into London yesterday with the reservation already made for dinner. The hostess was nice enough to call my husband twice to confirm the reservation which was nice. The first call was missed since we we're traveling from Amsterdam that morning. Fast forward to the reservation time on the ground level where we were "greeted" by two security/bouncer guys.  The Chinese group in front of us checked in before us and they asked the girl who well looked in her mid-20s to show ID or a passport. Keep in mind she was there with her parents. The dad had to look on his phone for a copy of her driver license while they looked for her passport.  I thought that was pretty odd but I ignored it. When it was our turn we gave them the name and reservation time.  Everything went downhill from there. The security dude asks if I read the confirmation email as if it was a pop quiz. We say yes since it was just a confirmation email.  Turns out that there is a dress code of "casual elegance" whatever that means. Why was this not brought up during the reservation confirmation if it was that important?  Anyway, we were out all day catching the New year's day parade so we had on trainers and regular clothes to stay warm and walk around comfortably. We are also tourists, not locals so it is not like we have our entire closet with us. The security dude talked to us like he's doing us a solid by letting it go this time, but next time don't do it again. Don't worry, there won't be a next time... We step up to the next security dude where he asks to check my bag when I am clearing not carrying any bag. My husband was carrying a small backpack with water, umbrella, etc to get us through the day. He tells us to throw out the brand new bottle of Evian water we just bought because drinks are not allowed. Wtf!  Are they going to lose money competing with a bottle of water?  It's already inside the bag so it's not like we plan to take it out to drink during the meal. We ended up tossing the bottle before we were allowed to go up the elevator. Once we got up to the restaurant, we had to walk past the bar to check in. We were told we're 15 minutes early, which we were, so check back with them later while we wait at their bar.  This was fine but we had to walk back to the host ourselves to check in again when it was time since no one approached us when it was time.  What type of wanna be fancy restaurant requires you to go check back with them again instead of having someone come get you at the bar?  Oh yeah, while we waited at the bar, we saw people dressed in sweaters, t-shirts, Nike tennis shoes, and other items not recommended to wear.  Did they all get warned?  I doubt it.We were both furious and even talked about leaving before we got seated but we ended up staying. We still had hope that the food would make up for experience we had to get seated.  The service from the waiter was good, the food overall was just ok to not that good. We ordered the "homemade bread" (important they point that out to you), pig ears, ox cheek donut, crab dish, duck & waffle, and rabbit.  The bread didn't have much flavor and it was difficult to cut with the butter knife that came with the bread. The knife was also brought to the table stuffed under the bread so the handle was greasy. Pig ears was ok. Tasted like a very crunchy bbq flavored potato chips from the supermarket. The ox cheek donut was disappointing since so many people raved about it. The donut itself didn't have much flavor. The meat had a hint of spiciness to it but you would never be able to taste it if you eat it with the sauce the donut rests on. The sauce was so overpowering that you could not taste the donut at all. The crab dish was a special for £6 and it was actually good tastewise and price.  The rabbit was also a dish that used a strong sauce to give the rabbit more flavor but it was so much that you couldn't take the rabbit at all. Finally, the dish the restaurant is known for, the duck and waffle. The duck confit was ok. We had duck confit at a random Paris cafe last week and it tasted much better. We also went to Borough market yesterday and got the duck from Le Quartier du Marche which also taste way better than this. The waffle was a joke. It tasted the same as the waffles we make at home with our waffle maker. I'm not even comparing them to the waffles in Belgium. They had a light syrup with these small seeds in there that was weird. The egg on top was fine but the yolk should be a little bit more runny or else what's the point. Outside of the view, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. If you take away the location, do you think this place would be relevant at all?

Q8UMQU1FxwllVh74ban_cQ.text: Plan ahead as it seems to always be booked at all hours. You can have an incredibly view for breakfast and I was pleasantly surprised that the food was also very delicious. Service was fairly inattentive - it took ages for us to flag down our waiter for the bill, even after he cleared the last plate - but it wasn't exactly terrible to gaze at the city of London for a little longer. The Elvis waffle didn't disappoint - a massive, crispy waffle with a generous slathering of peanut butter, strawberry jam, fresh berries, and 2 hearty scoops of the most delicious vanilla cream. (Not for those on a diet). Mains were £15 or less per plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. The Elvis Waffle

j4gyNNicZgXox8nY8cGRfQ.text: A little turned off by the strict dress-code at the door when heading into the restaurant, but the food was definitely delicious. We ended up getting the beef tartar (amazing), duck and waffles, the BBQ flavored pigs ears, and the steak. All were really delicious and the service at the bar/restaurant were great! The view on the 40th floor was also a plus!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. BBQ pig ears
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffles and Caesar salad and steak

tgf3d7TqgHBjAcvdsceciQ.text: Extremely overhyped restaurant, they require reservations and have a dress code, but for mediocre food. Good views can't save soggy waffles and greasy poultry, and terrible service.

Oe75fVQfEZxYPeVUV201Vg.text: A must in London. I'd probably give it a 4.5, but I'm nostalgic and missing my favorite city, so...The food is great, though portions are on the small side. Service is impeccable. Cocktails aren't worth it - you could get another dish for the price of one only-okay drink.- Duck & waffle: you have to try it at least once. Do not argue with me about how it's £17 or about how you don't like duck or that meat on the bone is too much work. Just do it.- Ox cheek doughnut: the perfect mix of savory & sweet.- Goat meatballs: very good.- Banana brulee waffle: I'm not a big fan of sweet breakfasts, but I loooooved this.- Shakshuka: good, but felt a little small and left me wanting second breakfast.- You can't go wrong with the breads, either. Always warm and fresh from the oven.Definitely make reservations in advance (you can do it online). I usually booked about a month ahead of time. If you go in the winter, be prepared for disappointment in case fog surrounds the restaurant and all you can see out the windows is a blanket of white.

0OOvfn-vQM_v8xs9VrpW-Q.text: After reading previous reviews, I was a bit skeptical about my reservation. It was my third day here in London, and I wanted to wear my walking sneakers. I was afraid that we would be turned away at the door. Instead, we were greeted with friendly smiles and a welcoming atmosphere. The reservation was for 8am and the place was half empty. We were immediately seated by the window with a nice view of the Tower Bridge and the Gherkin building. The waiter was very helpful and attentive. I ordered the namesake Duck and Waffle dish and a mimosa. The duck was well seasoned and crispy on the outside and the waffle was a bit over done. However, with a fantastic view and excellent service, I was able to over look it. The elevator ride was a treat!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & Waffle

jtEqBq9rxv6bCWVEOPyKew.text: I loved everything about our experience at Duck & Waffle! The elevator ride to the restaurant on the 40th floor is the first great thing. A fun perk! Obviously great views. And then you walk through to the restaurant and even more amazing views! And with their open floor plan it's easy to see in every direction. With it's easy enough to walk around other tables to snap a few pictures, even if they are busy (be mindful of others of course). We came for breakfast with an 8am reservation. I was surprised to see that there were already several tables filled already (mostly couples) but they weren't completely full yet. For food we had the Colombian Eggs and Full Elvis (the pb&j waffle), which I was worried would be too sweet, but was absolutely delicious!!! I will admit that I came here for the Instagram-worthy views but the food definitely held it's own. Waiter was friendly and left us to enjoy ourselves with the views. No pressure to give up our table after we finished eating, although I'm sure when it's really busy they enforce their 1-hour limit and encourage you to linger in the bar area instead.Tip: You can make reservations online but I learned that calling is the best way to find out their real availability. The online reservation doesn't always reflect exactly what reservations are open. I tried to book online first and it said they were book solid for the whole week but then I called and they had tons of availability. Also be sure to ask specifically for a window side table if possible. Views are great even if you don't get one but it never hurts!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Bar area in foyer
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. View from the bar area
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. View from the south-facing window side

R2zXER2SjYh6pi_cb6BN9w.text: Sorry this review is so late.  I came here back in December 2016, so here goes...I love this restaurant... After seeing so many posts on FB, I decided to make a reservation to celebrate a mini reunion with my siblings.  The decor was beautiful and the ceilings were ornately decorated with all things festive.  We had a window table and the views were beautiful.  Our table was booked for 2 pm and since there was no bookings after us, we stayed  and chatted till sundown and the night view of London was so beautiful.The signature dish duck and waffle did not disappoint.  The combination of sweet maple and crusty skin of the duck together with the waffle was really interesting, definitely worth a try, while you're there.  The rest of the food we ordered was really good too. We tried each other dishes and they were really delicious.The wait staff were super friendly.  Since they open long hours, the waiter told us, this place is popular with tours who want to view the sunrise early in the morning whilst eating breakfast.Apparently they have a bar next door which does not require reservations, which also serves bits and drinks.  A great way to enjoy the fabulous view without spending a bunch of money.Would like to revisit again oneway.

Vt2pbg84OedrhhTxEe9pDQ.text: Went to this restaurant 2 years ago at 7am and couldn't get it to the main dining room because we didn't make a reservation in advance (who knew they would still be booked up at time like that of the day? 7am?!!) ended up having continental breakfast at bar and enjoyed coffee and great London view from their 40th Fl location. Knew that we are coming back to London and wanted to try this restaurant for real. husband made reservation 1 week in advance. With someone last minute cancellations, we got a 645pm golden hour reservation. From the elevator ride (hope you are not afraid of height and speed) to the stunning 360 view of London and the iconic duck & waffle (it is delicious) , I was impressed! Great wine selection as well ! (We had a bottle of South African chenin blanc, buttery with French oak but fruity with hind of green apple at the same time?) Wonderful service (we met manager Tania, she is caring and kind) we had a blast time. Images speak a thousand words, will attached some views from the restaurant. I highly recommended this place and yes! Book in advance!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Grill eel
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. The famous duck and waffles
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Another angle from restaurant

7KcWv-6oHU_swPqQK0MBSw.text: Great location, good food! The view is inspiring and amazing. The food was good and nothing to be sad about but also not absolutely amazing. Enjoyed the experience and would recommend for the view alone, the fact that the food is also good too makes this a great place to go. Would be 5 stars if food blew my socks off.

LK5xhZJgpFLiHKYUZuYgGA.text: So, first of all this place might not have the absolutely best food in the world....... BUT all things considered me and my wife just love Duck & Waffle!  We went here for brunch last summer and the first thing you notice is the exciting elevator the roughly 40 floors up where you have an amazing view of London. A pro tip is to make table reservation since the Place is popular and fills up fast.  I booked about 3 weeks before arrival wich was enough.  After checking the menu we started our brunch-Sunday with Bellinis and bbq spiced crispy pig ears. The Bellinis where really fresh and the pigs ears was a real little treat and came in a brown paper bag.  After the little starter snack we had these dishes: *Foie Gras Creme Brulée with pork crackling brioche Fun idea with creamy luxurious foie gras that tasted really good with the soft brioche *Smoked eel with horseradish & samphire Subtle but tasty with this  thaonet was more towards a fine dining dish. *Spicy Ox Cheek Doughnut with Apricot jam & smoked paprika sugar WOW and DAMN IT! This one was nothing short of spectacular. The warm soft doughnut with a center of slow cooked ox cheek spiced just right against that sweet Apricot jam.....Mmmm i just wish a could have this dish every weekend.  *The Full Elvis Waffles with peanut butter, jam, banana and whipped cream.  Looked and tasted good though im not sure it was worth the 15 £ since its not too hard to replicate at home as some of the other dishes.   The service was good and the food was quirky and tasty with lots of new combinations of flavors. A long with the view i would love to go back. With a price tag of about 130 £ with two Bellinis and two glass of house rosé it doesnt come cheap.  Luckily for us we are not in London that often so will make sure to eat there the next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Smoked eel
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

pknCeyB0hVgFMEE5cCrj-w.text: Such an incredible place. Great views of the city, beautiful decor in the main lobby area. The food was delicious, great options for everyone. I am vegetarian and I was able to select a delicious menu item. Also the staff was very nice. Our waitress overheard someone's request for Nutella and brought a small jar over to our table without us having to ask directly. We were a little late and the restaurant strays true to the table time slot, so unfortunately, we were asked to leave when our time was up, but a great experience nonetheless!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

48CyFVZpdhnPgFxMCWSHMA.text: A must in London!Food: delicious! I love their duck and waffle!View: AMAZING! I love watching London from above. Service: The only downside. We came for breakfast and we were seated by the window where the sunshine were directly in our face. My eyes were hurting and tearing up so we asked to change table. There was a table on the other side of the building. However, our host says no. Then we asked people to pull the blinds down a bit but it still didn't help much. Twenty minutes later, we asked our waiter and the manager eventually changed our table to the other side. The situation does not worth the hassle!Tip: - Reserve ahead of time!- Entrance: A small door by the building with the fish tank.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. the Gherkins
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and Waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Egg Benedict

6_MXDhA9-8xtmWnLjbcmpw.text: All the food blogs said this was the place to come. It was on all of our lists. It was an incredible experience but definitely wish we would have known more about it prior to coming in to eat.Open 24 hours- keep in mind unless it's anytime before midnight there is no use coming with no reservation.It's like a club or rave during the later part of the evening and most patrons are dressed to the nines. They apparently don't let you in the door at the floor to come up the elevator if you have on any sort of athletic trainer on, I.e.,  Nike's. If we could redo our experience we would come for brunch as I'm sure this is when the best of the best is working and because you won't feel like you just went to Vegas. Our service was stellar once we finally got in. The restaurant itself is stunning. Duck and waffle don't disappoint along with the salty grilled cheese. Would love to see what we missed on their normal menu. The whole food and service and ascetic is killer. The late night experience of it all wasn't for us.

2QIYipL3th4Jrf11HsamNg.text: Never have I thought of a combination like duck and waffle - It's truly amazing! I've been to duck and waffle twice for breakfast, and it still amazes me, it's the highlight of my London trip! I've tried their duck and waffle (5/5), full Elvis waffle (3/5) and caramelized banana waffle (4/5). (Ratings are in brackets). The duck and waffle - duck is very crispy on the outside, juicy and flavorful in the inside, the maple syrup and the sunny side up has compliment the duck so well as you taste savory and sweet both at once! Full Elvis isn't that worth it as it is just combination of fruits along with banana brûlée creme, feel like I can get it in any other shop. The caramelize banana is a good choice for sweet tooth, loved the harden caramel/ sugar layer coated on the banana, which gives a sense of crunch and soft when you eat it.The view from the 40th floor is great, don't be shy to ask for a change of seats if you're not seated next to the window. The waiters are accommodating and will try to make good seat arrangement. Remember to make a booking before heading to the restaurant through their website, and book earlier for a reasonable time slot! (My friend tried to book last minute, and only left with the choice of 6am in the morning for weekend brunch)

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle, full Elvis

t1g8bjEh2FCe50_Z3fuhCw.text: I stopped here from breakfast on my way to work and while the meal was satisfactory, it wasn't outstanding. The English breakfast was great, but perhaps it's because a proper English breakfast should be found at a pub instead...Nevertheless, the meal was a nice way to start my morning though I can't say I found my favorite breakfast spot in London.

ckhf6Sy30ZmmTyqj9AZaFg.text: OK, you come here for the view and 24 hour service if you get a table here at whatever time you want.  I tried the famous duck and waffle.  I am unsure if I went in with a high expectation after all the hype.  However, I don't think I was particularly impressed with the dish.  I felt that it was just normal and nothing special about it.  Even the duck itself was not as juicy and tender as some of the places I have tried.  I would say no point going up there unless you want the view and impress your partner.  They are opening another branch near Piccadilly Circus.  Hopefully the dish is cheaper there as there is no view and not that high up.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

rh33sHMbJTpDvwtB53xEOQ.text: Didn't have a reservation, but looked amazing. On the 38th floor with a tremendous view.

Ipg8ARDgG9kENAxRlXjNMQ.text: I have only found myself here around 2/3am being far from sober. I recall feeling disappointed with the food with all three times of visiting. The food is only okay (can't go wrong with fried food) but that mediocrity hasn't stopped me returning. Great that it is opened 24 hours.

NTgeYn0H4RsSlA1mn6VRjA.text: When in London, I need to Duck & Waffle. It's a verb. When you're in London, you need to Duck & Waffle. No joke. Get that reservation, whip out that credit card and GO for it! Two years after my first review and 5 visits later, I can't state anything else than.... You owe it to yourself to Duck & Waffle!* The food is impeccable. Ooooh you foie gras crème brûlée, you make me so insanely happy. Every. Damn. Time.* Do make a reservation; they're open 24/7 but always packed.* Apparently, they now have a Dresscode - no sneakers allowed. Maybe they've always had it, but ehm, I guess I was properly dressed. Just found out last week as I have trainer-wearing-colleagues. * When you're there with a group, they automatically switch to the concept that you receive dishes "Dinner at home style, all dishes in the middle of the table and share". I'vet totally made friends with the wrong peeps in my childhood, WHO has these dinners at home?! I'll never leave your house...Until we meet again you cheeky D&W!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Goat's cheese salad
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Asperges
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Octopus

gbkfqTjbf0U0altS6IojBw.text: The dishes is delicious. However, the booking time in the midnight always make people confused sometimes...

sX56pAB1Lywkaw4R1lpcMg.text: The menu here works so that you get a bunch of small plates to share for starters and then get a couple mains to share or to have for yourself. The food is quite good and not badly priced. I highly recommend the restaurant's namesake dish, the duck and waffles! It's quite sweet, especially if you drizzle all of the maple syrup, so take that as you will :) The crispy skin on the duck was perfection, as well, and deserved a mention here. I also really enjoyed the salted hazelnut choux bun for dessert. Ah, and for the small plates, I liked the lentils, which were sweet with a hint of miso, and the ox doughnut.NOW I must say something about the service. Our waiter was nice, but he definitely took down our order incorrectly. My group was served the corn dog small plate, when we had ordered the corn bread, but he insisted that we had ordered the corn dog and that it was on the ticket for proof. Well, of course it will be on the ticket if you took it down wrong! I was mainly surprised that he would not acknowledge the opinion of 6 people versus himself in what we had ordered... he basically forced us to eat and pay for the dish, adding on that the corn bread had also been ordered. However, the corn bread came out much later after the main dishes, and we saw on the bill that it was added later. Obviously, he had added it later after realizing his mistake but did not admit it to us. Quite disappointed with his service!!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. The lentils were sooooo good
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and Waffle. Never going back to chicken and Waffle!!
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Baked Alaska. Not for those who don't like chestnut!

_m-S6hjskk30UGrVzysicw.text: Truly excellent customer service and management. I am completely happy. I will return again and again to the much beloved Duck & Waffle. Why? There was a bit of a mix-up with a group booking I had made a few weeks in advance for a special dinner. I believe there were miscommunications on both sides of the equation -- regardless, the reservation was cancelled, unbeknownst to me, so I rocked up with a group of 9 at 6:30pm on a Thursday evening....and no reservation. Eeeeeps. The manager, Rosario Cappiello, was nothing short of exceptional. Right away he was on the challenge, set us up at the bar for a few drinks while he resolved, found us a great table for 9 and checked in several times to ensure everything was going well. Far beyond expectations. I was so pleased and really thankful for his ability to problem solve. He easily could have said "well, tough shit lady." -- but instead, he handled perfectly. His manner is also very calm and professional (of course, so is mine so that helps!). SO, thank you very much Rosario! Also, the food is SO great, the group menu is delicious and overly indulgent (I'm still full after 15 hours). The Eden cocktail highly recommended as well. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Namesake dish

RQ8WQ9yKl6Q0kExTWM0uWA.text: This is where you go when you want someone to say "Wow!". Start to finish, this was a happy experience and delicious meal. Zooming up to the 40th floor watching the view change was a promising start and it only got better. After a short and fun wait at the beautiful bar area enjoying the gorgeous view with a drink, we got seated. Although the dining area is not as stunning as the bar, they service was friendly and helpful and the FOOD. So. Good.Out of the starters we tried, I love the polenta starters the most. They come as fried balls with the yummiest creamy sauce that I would love to know the recipe for. The portion is small, just 2 little pieces, but they are worth it. The freshly baked rosemary bread was also quite nice if you're feeling snackish at the bar while you wait.Now the main course- the duck and waffle itself. I did not know duck could be so fantastic. It was succulent and both the crispy skin and the juicy meat inside were cooked to perfection. The waffle was great and went well with it. I'm not really into sweet food but I tried my syrup and it was actually pretty good with the rest, although I would have it in small doses. The duck and waffle are quite filling. All in all, with the great views, welcoming atmosphere, and fantastic food, I left extremely satisfied and happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Love the view
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Elevator to the top with a view!

ltsa1r35GIZCU4hqaQR8nA.text: Oh my gosh! I cannot rave about this enough. The entry is a little difficult to find at night but once you get to it, you automatically feel "important." They have a private elevator manned by a doorman that takes you up to the sky high restaurant. It does have a pretentious vibe but I did not mind it as much here as opposed to other restaurants. The view is amazing and the food even better. I highly recommend the maple glazed cornbread that has jalapeños baked in I was so surprised by the flavor but loved every bite. I also recommend ordering the duck and waffle- I was either way too excited to try it or it was actually the best waffle I have ever had! The mixed drinks are delicious and the staff is so kind. Highly recommend!! I will return any time I'm in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

hnHQsDBiD979eQaBLMeSAg.text: The security guard and host made us throw away our food before going in--we walked in with street food from Camden area to save for a late night snack, and had no intention of eating it at duck and waffle.  Very very annoying. However the rest of our time there was enjoyable and the food was awesome and unique.  If you come in here and don't try the duck and waffles, go away pls.  They're phenomenal.  The scenery from the floor of this restaurant is amazing..I want to definitely come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. A definite must try in London.  The 360 deg view of the city, itself makes it worth it..

bNhBaBMKSVycZQAiDn_JPQ.text: Oh my word, one of the best breakfasts we've had...EVER!Found this while looking up must eat places in London and man was it ever that. Had a reservation and got an amazing window seat. My wife ordered the Elvis and I ordered the duck and waffle. Both were to die for! We went halfsies on both and they were so damn good. Next time in London, I will be here first.

KOenculdmTbZuW1SAf0fPA.text: Horrible place, bbq pig ears were way overcookdf and the flavor taste like brunt black coal. The duck itself was not well prepared as to the waffle was soft not the way a waffle should be made.  Finally we had the angus beef which was just so so nothing to be trilled about as it said it suppose to be aged old. Will not go again.

t8rp6wmbCROoUW47rDNfdg.text: This has to be the best view for a meal in all of london! I'm sure everything is amazing, but I suggest their signature item "the duck and waffle".  The sauce that comes with it is amazing! If your looking for something lighter, the 2 eggs on toast with hash Browns was really good too.Bring your camera!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. 2 eggs and hash Browns
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle

22MQiyGiFdXOFxtnOg6u7w.text: This place exceeded my expectations! On my last evening in London, my cousins and I came here for dinner. First let's start with the guy at the door... Loved him! He was professional but still down to earth! We then went inside and rode the elevator up I think 39 floors. What a sight to see! We were greeted by the hostess, super nice and then taken to our table. My cousin asked the hostess if by chance there were any tables available by the windows and after checking, she apologized, but said there weren't any. No worries b/c the view of the city is still visible no matter where you sit.  We placed our order and then next thing we knew, the server picked up our glasses and indicated that a table became available near the windows!!! We were so excited and the fact that they watched for an open table for us just gave them extra points in my book! Next the food... The menu had many items that looked good, but I opted for the Duck and Waffle. Can I say nom nom!!! It was so delicious and cooked perfectly!!! I didn't want the dish to end! As I write this review, my mouth waters for the tasty dish!!! Lol!!!One other thing that was a plus in my book is the server did not rush us. He allowed us to take our time and enjoy our meal and good conversation. I definitely have to go back to this restaurant when I visit London again! Bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Another view of the city... So cool...
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Open kitchen...
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. The menu...

S3KfQYbNQ76X-Rw5bANiGQ.text: I called on Saturday morning for available reservations the same night, and the first availability for 2 people was at 1am. Contrary to our expectations, the restaurant was not, in fact, full of drunk people snacking after a night out, and was in fact very classy.The duck & waffle dish deserves to be the name of this restaurant. The duck is crispy on the outside, all melting in your mouth on the inside, and goes perfectly with a morsel of the sunny-side-up egg and waffle, drizzled in maple syrup. There were some interesting cocktails. I got one that involves beet and chocolate, and it was very tasty. The "English Cherry" belgian waffle + ice cream combo dessert was a very sweet ending to a great late-night dinner.I'd love to visit again! Maybe for brunch next time.

4i6ZUolxVdMSgCMbTw0HxA.text: Duck & Waffle is a great place to go if someone is taking you out for dinner, someone with a lot of money to spare that is... It is almost worth spending the extra cash as their renowned dish, the Duck and Waffle itself, is absolutely delicious. Sweet and savoury all mixed into one, it really is a yummy place to go. Their service wasn't as great as the food unfortunately, as we had to remind them our drinks order that was taking a bit longer than expected. The food did make up for the service, but it is a shame that when you are paying so much for the food, that the service doesn't reflect what you're paying.

eaK-ymNkz29Z_QgLRz_Qpw.text: It can be hard to get a booking, lucky it's open 24 hours - so you're bound to get a slot at some point during the day. I managed to get an 11pm booking. Service was good and prompt. The view was AMAZING and so worth going up there for. Too bad there was a bit of condensation on the windows. The next time I go, I'll opt for a clear sunny morning!To start I had the BBQ spiced crispy pig's ears. These were yummy and so moreish. But the way it was served was a little startling. It was just a paper bag dumped onto the table. The waiter didn't even think to tell us what they'd given us. So a star down for that. My confit duck and waffle was of course the star of the night! It's served with a mustard maple syrup which was so good. The duck wasn't as tender as I'd preferred, but it was still enjoyable. The best part of the dish had to be the runny duck egg - which the waffle was perfect to slap up! As much as I enjoyed my meal, I did think it was a bit much for just a piece of duck and waffle. I think there's so many other dishes to try here and hopefully they'll be better. I'll be sure to come back soon to try the rest of the menu!

QnoYPhX5v5A5iT4iLvlXTg.text: My sister had a bad day, so I took her here after work to cheer her up. Our reservation was for 6pm and she arrived on time. I arrived at 6.15pm, a little out of breath only to find a queue for the lift at Heron Tower that stretched round the block. It was full of women in very high heels, dresses and elaborate hair dos. My leggings and boots shrank a little in shame... I headed to the front of the queue to talk to the two doormen and explain that not only was I late for my reservation, but that my sister was already upstairs at the table. They let me in swiftly, and suddenly the high heels and hair dos were jealous of me. I had been up in the particular lift before - it's glass and stuck on to the side of the building. It offers a fantastic view of the city and it's pretty quick - climbing 38 floors in a few seconds. The high heels that I was in the lift with screamed as we ascended swiftly but my boots just relaxed nonchalantly, enjoying the vista. The lift stopped at 38 and the heels were hesitant. "This is the floor for SushiSamba, but I am going up to Duck and Waffle on 40" I explained. The heels were impressed - they had not been there before and I obviously had. My boots felt vindicated. I followed the long passageway round to the D&W bar. I was pounced on by a woman wanting to know what I was doing there. I think it was supposed to be helpful and welcoming, but perhaps they shouldn't have picked someone who had obviously had Eastern European military interrogation training. I finally made it through a lot of staff to our table - and I have to say, I was impressed. If you don't LOVE height, don't go to this restaurant. If the lift doesn't kill you, then the floor to ceiling glass windows that you sit right next to will finish you off. The view up Bishopsgate and over Spitalfield's Market was AMAZING. As we got there so early, we watched the sun go down during the evening and the twinkly lights start to show up over London. By the time we left at around 9.30pm, it was a stunning night-time view. We turned to the menu and ordered a few things to share.  We had what was basically the best garlic bread I have ever tasted - hot, very garlicky with a gorgeous hint of rosemary. I would swear that the bread had been made less than 20 minutes before we ate it. We had the half dozen oysters - a mixture that were all delicious. We also tried the baked beetroot that was so sweet and tender, complimented by a goats curd that was just sharp enough to cut through the sweetness. Followed by the aubergine - I was less keen on this, although my sister loved it. It had a charred taste to it that I don't love, although the naan and the yoghurt that came with it were delicious. Then came the duck and waffle to share. I really wish that we had gone for one each - it was sublime. Why does a duck leg, a fried egg, a waffle and some maple syrup work so well together? I can't tell you - perhaps it's the combination of salt and sweet, the textures of the doughy waffle, crisp duck and runny egg. I'm not sure, but it was absolutely out of this world. What did we wash all this down with, I hear you ask... well, I happen to love viognier, and I spoke to the sommelier about his viognier offerings. He kindly pointed me to a reasonably priced bottle from Australia...but I was in the mood for decadence and asked if he had anything from Condrieu. His eyes lit up, he lost 15 years, and confessed that he did have some, and that it was his favourite. I saw the price tag, but decided to go for it anyway. It was heaven. It was really really delicious - fruity but not sweet, complex and dry but not harsh. It was a bouquet in a glass and way too easy to drink! The service was fantastic. There was no sense of being hurried or that they wanted to turn the table over. Everyone was exceptionally warm, helpful and welcoming. We stayed for three hours and were treated very well. The only thing I would urge them to change is that they only have two ladies loos, which means a queue every time you want to go. Moving swiftly from loos to dessert... we ordered the pistachio & dark chocolate macaroon sandwich (mainly because it came with 'drunken cherries' which may have been my favourite dessert item I have ever eaten!) and the vanilla baked alaska, because the Great British Bake Off had just featured Baked Alaskas. They were both delicious - I think I preferred the baked alaska as a dish, but have been spoilt by the cherry version that they serve at the Ivy. Having finished our way-too-easy-to-drink viognier, we had the dessert wine that was recommended for each dish - which meant that going down in the lifts was interesting as we were quite squiffy! Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion or a time when someone needs cheering up. It worked a treat for my sister and we both loved the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. That's what Bishipsgate looks like at night from the 40th floor of the Heron Tower.
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful view... (And London doesn't look bad out the window either!)

p6P-jHnGrYPNNUcRfGX-yQ.text: Do not judge a book by its cover. When I first heard "duck and waffle," I thought the concept sounded weird. But visiting London, I figured why not try it. It's different and is highly recommended. I placed my order and will say, their special did not disappoint. The duck was right on point and the waffle was tasting very fresh. The added egg on top was a nice unexpected addition to the meal. Eat the three together and your tastebuds are left with magical bliss. As far as the venue, the restaurant's location gives a wonderful view of London. But let's be honest, after my first bite into my meal, all I cared about was a second serving.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle with maple syrup.

x4fU47Xva87GIjAzZ4l8Pw.text: We came here without reservations around late afternoon and were squeezed in. We only had to wait about 10 minutes.Even though I typically do not like duck, I decided to try the duck and Waffle (why not, right?). It was spectacular. The duck was so crispy and light. The whole dish was amazing. Service was great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and Waffle :) paired with a wonderful 2008 red wine

IGRCelcWftxfcWKIx5WbYg.text: Probably my favourite "restaurant with a view" in London.Open all hours for food, with a great little cocktail bar to get drinks if you have to wait for a table (book well in advance to secure a window seat).Get the duck and waffle platter.

OXWEGMaKmPqAN7ikw7HPgQ.text: "You're wearing sandals and it's night time." - Bouncer behind the velvet rope.This is how the story starts, but it does get better!A and I were both taken aback. I had made reservations online about a month ago and this was how we were greeted after landing in London that morning & doing a full day of sightseeing and waiting on buses to arrive here at midnight. Suddenly my sparkly gold leather Mephistos felt totally lame. We were starving and we weren't going to get in! We had to pull the honeymoon card. The bouncer called the manager upstairs. After what seemed like forever they said because it was our honeymoon, it was OK, but never again. Kinda harsh, but at least we were in!Our window table wasn't ready so we waited at the bar super subconscious about my sandals. Then I noticed girls wearing dirty $50 converse & I was totally offended. But! Moving on...At our bar table, we met this pair of awesome guys that turns out were originally from California. We talked all about our honeymoon and A's love of UK rock & punk and they ended up getting us a couple of glasses of champagne to celebrate. This pretty much made everything better. I had also indulged in a green juice with kale juice, agave, lemon, soda (Verde) and A got a JD&C (Gentleman Jack whiskey, Aperol, cacao, salted cola reduction, cider vinegar) that was poured out of a flask when served. Both were quite delish and made semi in front of us at the island bar in the middle of the room.We were led to our window table. It was a nice view. The server was friendly and to the point. We already knew what we wanted. The duck & waffle, spicy ox cheek doughnut, BBQ-spiced crispy pig ears, and the foie gras creme brulee. First up was the BBQ-spiced crispy pig ears. Served in a brown paper bag with a wax duck seal. They were warm, crispy, and slightly sweet from the BBQ flavor. We polished it off.Next was the foie gras creme brulee. It was topped with chunks of lobster and served with brioche toast points. Tap tap tap to crack the top and smeared that foie gras creaminess all over the buttery brioche. The lobster was perfectly tender with some give.Then the spicy ox cheek doughnut. Think of the best fluffy doughnut you've ever had filled with a melt in your mouth savory ox cheek mixture inside. So f-ing good.Lastly was the duck & waffle. Perfect crisp skin and melty duck meat on top of a waffle with mustard maple syrup and an over easy duck egg. It was pretty entertaining seeing the place slowly fill with clubbers/drunkies that really should've just gone home. This was definitely one of our best honeymoon meals even though it was the first night. Though the sandal thing definitely made the whole thing awkward.

k_SSvh7SYTI0qLDMI3rVNg.text: Over the top in every way, the menu especially.Just look at my photo of the private party menu. Some might say it's innovative, others say mad. I'm somewhere in between.I say the Duck and Waffle is more of an experience, a journey through creative dining. Having said that, one would be advised to come with an open mind but belly half filled (in case satisfaction proves elusive).Not sure what looks good? The namesake dish is always a safe bet.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Sharing menu for conference groups

x1VhegUqfkCHZRbjgHPdpA.text: The view, cocktails, and food is fantastic here. You start with a private entrance that has a special elevator take you up to the 40th floor. Here you can see stunning views of the London skyline. I've been here before for breakfast but had the privilege of coming here today for lunch. My husband and I ordered the crispy polenta and dates to start. They are very small so you'll need to order 2 of each if you plan to share as it only comes as a single piece portion. Still- it was very good. To share with our mains we ordered the rosemary & garlic bread- which was amazing and so fresh and also the heritage tomatoes which had a great flavour. For my main I ordered the small plate of the wild mushrooms which comes with a fried duck egg, sprouts, walnut & truffle. My husband had the "duck and waffle". We finished the meal with the homemade biscuits. Good service and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. View from our table
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Wild mushrooms and duck egg
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Bloody Mary and Virgin passionfruita

UyQDa1LDfyZtmNJs_PufaQ.text: Made a reservation a week earlier and was lucky to be seated at one the best side window tables for the view of London. Duck n waffle was delicious. The vegi dish was listed in the main course menu but it's actually a salad with beats (which I am not a fan). A little bit cold for the main course in my opinion. Overall a lovely dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Lovely view
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Bread with chili paste and cheese, fusion?
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. it makes me think about NYPD...

i-2M__zLKhfJWL5CT4-FAw.text: We went in for a 6:45 am reservation. We literally spent no longer than 5 seconds in the bar to take a picture of it before the host (didn't catch his name, a middle eastern man?) gave us an annoyed sigh and wanted the name of the party. The view from this place is amazing!One thing they tell you to do is to look over the menu prior to visiting; something that bothered me was that they have a menu called the "All Day" menu, when it's actually only available M-F 10:30 am -11:30 pm. They shouldn't call it All Day if it isn't actually available all day. The food was good, nothing too innovative; brother ordered the ox cheek benedict and I got the duck & waffle. Service was excellent, our server (french man, didn't catch his name again... sorry) saw me pouring water and came to take it and said, "let me do that for you."During our meal the host (same guy from before) was having a dispute with another server behind us, something that took from our experience.

O1-wHrEdMHWSNXCmuDchpw.text: Theme park (location, decor, clientele.)  Food is excellent though.  Location, unbeatable.Bizarrely, you should expect a full body pat down on arrival!

gPAMCkEl78L6Us25Tjiqaw.text: Love this place so much! Classy and delicous food and cocktails with spectaular views. I love this place.

BPiuJ5qrRMt8h4eotMx5Cg.text: Made a special trip to Duck & Waffle after an event, since it was my friends birthday and she always wanted to go there.   Who am I to say no, I was hungry, it was a 24 hours restaurant and it was supposed to be a big deal!We tried to call a few times to make a reservation but no one picked up.  My friend said it's likely we wouldn't be seated if we went down there as it's so popular, so of course we went anyway to try are luck.The bouncer that greeted us promptly asked for photographic ID which I didn't have.   I had to do a bit of persuading for him to let me in without it.  It worked!  But he told us there were no tables available unless we waited an hour.  We said we would wait in the bar, but when I got up there I spoke to the hostess to see if we could get a table.  I also slipped in that it was my friend's birthday, but I really didn't need to as they had a few empty tables anyway.   Enough so that we could change our allocated table to one with amazing views of night time London, next to the floor to ceiling windows.Being in the early hours, we were given the Late Night menu.  I'm not exactly a huge waffle fan so wasn't that enthusiastic looking at the savoury options, they just didn't appeal to me.  However when I saw they had a waffle dessert called 'English Cherries', including cherry & yoghurt ice cream and white chocolate crumble, it had my name written all over it!Our waiter was very friendly, polite and patient while he took our orders.  My friend ordered 'Bananas Brûlée Belgium Waffle'.  When they arrived they both looked wonderful (mine had pretty little purple flowers, awww) and they tasted as good as they looked.  The ice cream was really impressively good, I could have eaten that on its own.  It tasted sweet (but not sickly) and fresh which complimented the slightly sour taste of the cherries and fresh whipped cream.  The dish size was generous,  came with this moorish sweet red berry sauce and was sprinkled with tiny meringue pieces. The waffle was very light and flavoursome.  It was all delicious and I was scrapping my spoon across the plate when I finished, trying to retrieve the last bits of tasty morsels.  I can't remember the last time I did that in a restaurant.  My friend liked her banana dish too but said it came with a tad too much chocolate sauce.The restaurant was kind enough to give my friend a glass of wine on the house, and after we finished our desserts presented her with a plate that said 'Happy Birthday' written in chocolate  sauce, with some tiny squares of chocolate brownies.  It was decorated with flowers and a tiny lit candle.  So pretty and unexpected.  My friend loved it.  A great end to her Birthday.Needles to say, the food was delicious, staff (apart from the bouncer) were super helpful, going beyond to make our experience a great one and to top it off the view looking across night time London was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. A dish called ENGLISH CHERRIES: cherry & yoghurt ice cream with white chocolate crumble.  From the Late Night menu.
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Surprise happy birthday treat!
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom

CBqUMd5AHhyEMJ_ljX4YXw.text: Conveniently located round the corner from the Liverpool St tube stop on the 40th floor of the Heron Tower is Duck and Waffle. Once you exit the elevator, it's a bit confusing on where to go but just follow the hallway around. You end up at the bar which has gorgeous views of the skyline. I made our reservation about a week in advance and could only get a lunch time of 215pm or dinner of 915pm on a Saturday. We opted for a late lunch and as a result we were starving and ready to feast! We were a bit early so we waited in the bar area. No one came to serve us until about 15 minutes later which was a bit irritating. The service from beginning to end left something to be desired. Oddly though, once we ordered the food came out fast and at a nice pace.The food was amazing and innovative! Although we loved everything we tried and want to come back again to try their other dishes, the highlights were the doughnut and the duck and waffle. The doughnut  was as big as a baseball and  covered in a spicy sweet dusting. Inside was some very juicy and tender oxtail and the combination was mouth watering. Can't wait to come back!Dark & Stormy- dark rum, lime, homemade ginger beer - bottled and baggedpea & mint arancini / truffle mayonnaisespicy ox cheek doughnut / apricot jamhandmade pasta of the dayherdwick mutton slider / harissa / charred tomato jam duck & waffle / crispy leg confit / fried duck egg / mustard maple syrup

miPGvPg5BBapnaIx3sRw-g.text: This is my second visit to this restaurant and I can honestly say they are improving day by day. I went there after Mid night and although it was late, staff were still very energetic and helpful.On to the food, this place never fails to impress me. Tried almost everything on the menu. There were two dishes that stole the show for me - the duck egg en cocotte, and the banana brulee waffle.Prices to me were very reasonable as well, considering the breathtaking view and comfortable seating.The only criticism would be the loud music, but guess can't complain on a Saturday night !

oR5FwscR4xxqDnbmCz3ybQ.text: Love, love, LOVE this place. I've only been for breakfast but (for me at least), this is the best time to go. A 7am sitting means that you will (British weather permitting) see London at its finest from the view that you have from your table. Stunning view aside, the food is also sublime. Smoked salmon royale on the 40th floor is the best way to start the morning. And it goes without saying that the service was exactly what you would expect from a top end London restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Banana brulee - I ordered the salmon royale and suffered a not so mild case of food envy. Safe option - order both
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Smoked salmon royale

A6kCQzvYWCKOGrjCSiL-kA.text: Duck and Waffle definitely lives up to the hype! My flatmate and I were lucky to secure a reservation at 8 pm on Friday night right next to the window. We got drinks and I ordered the artichoke cocktail. It wasn't exactly my taste so our waiter had a surprise drink prepared for me. It was spicy and had half of a passion fruit floating on top!We ordered some bread, the tuna small plate, oxtail donut, fois gras crème brulee and of course the duck and waffle. The tuna small plate wasn't as exciting as I had hoped as it was small and I'm sure you could get good quality like that at Sushi Samba downstairs. The stand outs were the oxtail donut and fois gras crème brulee. The duck and waffle was also perfectly prepared, but it wasn't especially new or innovative. Just good food executed perfectly.Had a great night and highly recommend for the views. Its a plus that the food is also fantastic!

KRMoKHfzZqxkZbLVy2wPkQ.text: Make a reservation. If you don't...We arrived Sunday at 10:15. Waited at the bar just under 2 hours for a table for two. We were seated, waited on and served alarmingly promptly. Delicious. I guess the breakneck-speed service makes up for the seemingly interminable wait?Make a reservation; have a great time. We're out-of-towners; we learned our lesson. :)

9tlDMAeEj-oGbH9SKkpE2A.text: Amazing views, just went for a drink but £8 for a bottle of beer was very expensive.

4D6eiTsyYlp-rWKxVLDISw.text: It can be pretty frustrating when trying to get a reservation for duck and waffle, but don't give up! It's best to go during the wee hours, as it's much less crowded and the late night menu is amazing. You probably won't need a reservation if you do this, unless you're going in large parties. I honestly found the duck confit a little too dry, but the combination of flavors with waffle, the fried duck egg and the syrup was great! The banana and Nutella  waffles were good too, but nothing extraordinary. The fried BBQ pigs ears were great, for a very affordable price of £5. One dish I wouldn't quite recommend is the foie gras and lobster creme brûlée as it was far too rich and pungent for my liking. Overall the food was pretty damn amazing, and the 360 degree view of London from this restaurant is the cherry on top of the sundae!

Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Lobster and foie gras creme brulee with brie bread
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck and waffle

H4xA0wuvhtuFYIX12eBWpw.text: This place does NOT DESERVE EVEN 1 STAR. I was part of a group of 4 and the "bouncer" low life told us my friend was "too drunk" to enter. Of course, the friend he singled out was the designated sober friend of the night. And I asked the bouncer how he came to this outrageous conclusion and he said it was based on his walk: this is pure discrimination! Completely unacceptable. DO NOT SUPPORT THIS ESTABLISHMENT.

xyiLIo6E3toueMGv5yNoUw.text: First time I went up it was just for a cocktail. The view was amazing and the cocktail was nice, although it looked like I'd drank half of it on arrival.After the first experience I decided to take my husband for breakfast. The service and food were amazing. We got to sit in the window as the sun was beaming in and look down onto the streets of London. It was a very relaxed atmosphere and and at no point were we rushed to leave.I would recommend this as an experience to try, it isn't cheap particularly just for a cocktail and they will automatically add the 12.5% service charge.
