SN_VbTrmIF-g4zT0p4S15A.text: A little bummed that I only thought D&W was OK. Things just weren't working in my favor... first of all, it was a crappy rainy day (thanks a lot, London) so the view was basically non-existent & all I saw out the windows was fog. Secondly, the only good thing out of 8 dishes we ordered was the Duck & Waffle. I mean, thankfully that tasted good, because if it didn't I would seriously be pushing them towards a name change.Getting a reservation was challenging. You need one unless you like eating after 11PM at night (which you could since this place is open 24/7). The only time I could get was 3:30PM in the afternoon, an awkward time to eat but since reservations were so hard to come by I took it. So 3:30PM, took the speedy fast lift to the 40th floor of the Heron Tower, got out and walked through awkward corridor to D&W. Walked through a very nicely decorated bar to the restaurant on the other side. We were seated and given menus and decided on the following:-BBQ Spiced Crispy Pig Ears - A little weird. Never had pig ears before, but if I had to describe it, it was like eating really hard chips (or crisps for the non-Americans). Some were even hairy.-Cherry Tomato & Goat Cheese Bread - Freshly baked right to the table. Even burned my tongue a little bit, but overall pretty good. Nothing spectacular about it though.-Jerusalem Artichoke Tortellini - My friend loved this, but I thought it lacked flavor. Comes with 4 of these bad boys.-Pollock Meatballs - Essentially, breaded fish balls. This was alright.-Charred Sprouting Broccoli - Greens are always good, but I thought it could've used a touch more caesar dressing. -Duck & Waffle - Now we're talking. Duck, good. Waffle, good. Egg on top, amazing. Maple syrup with mustard, OH. EM. GEE. Best dish of the entire meal. I just wish there was more of it. Like, there's hardly any duck meat in this thing since there's the bone in the way... -Deep-Fried Mars Bar - My friend had his heart set on this. Since I didn't want to have a heart attack, I settled for a bite. Good stuff.-Rhubarb & Custard Rice Pudding - I wish this had more pizazz to it, but it just wasn't there. It wasn't very sweet, which isn't a bad thing, but when you order dessert you kinda want it sweet, right? So, to conclude my review... nice venue, great view (if the skies are clear), decent food but sadly, nothing really top notch, food orgasm amazing. Yeah, I'm sad about it, and if I'm wrong and you want me to change my mind & try it again, I'll gladly do it... as long as the meal is on you. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Rhubarb & Custard Rice Pudding and Deep Fried Mars Bar
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Duck & Waffle
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Jerusalem Artichoke Tortellini

2ZqUYf-xSbADB5edk6fMag.text: Every dish a delight, every interaction a good one. Staff are happy and knowledgeable but the place itself, although smart & stylish, has a slightly contrived city vibe. City restaurants are still trying to be cool, it doesn't seem to come naturally; unlike just down the road in Shoreditch or further west in Soho.The views will ensure it always stays on the map though and the food will keep the punters, with big city expenses, coming back time and time again.

TerzrM7aa2u6f4jfFi2qgw.text: Okay, so I work in Liverpool Street and had passed the tower that D&W sits upon numerous times, watching the glass lifts shooting up the tower. Having booked about 3 weeks in advance, I managed to get a table. Whats great about this place is the service, the food and the spectacular view. So what's possibly left to be bad? The other diners. I the crowd is unbelievably pretentious, but who cares. I had their trademark dish, the Duck and Waffle and it's spectacular. Definitely worth a visit

zkgur7dm2bz0l8NAYWCriA.text: We did not make a reservation and so we fell for "we are booked but please pay for expensive drinks while you wait." Still... paying 109 pounds for some Duck and Waffle was well worth it and we would do it again. A highlite of our trip.

XxsgO86ay3KhO5lEVoaRqg.text: I hate to sound cliched, but at the very tippity top of my "Most Instagrammable Brunch" list is this fine establishment, Duck & Waffle - both literally, and figuratively. The ascent to the top of Heron Tower is an experience in itself - my husband described it perfectly when he said it was as if London "opened up" like a pop-up book. The brunch at Duck & Waffle is particularly enjoyable - not only for the views and superb food - but also because it doesn't hurt the paycheck too much. Nope, you can get granola and pastries for under £10, which means that it's not as fancy as everyone assumes it is.The signature dish, duck and waffle, does not disappoint: I'm a fan of the mustard and syrup, which works well with the savory flavors of the duck (which was perfectly tender, by the way, and not too dry) and the soft, sweet pillow of waffle upon which it was served. As an American, I HAD to try the fried PBJ (that's peanut butter and jelly, to all you American food luddites), which also didn't disappoint. The spiced ox-cheek doughnut was a joy though: it tasted like a char siu bun mash-up with a sugared donut. Why didn't anyone think of this sooner??New life goal? To make the most of its 24 hour promise ... the perfect way to handle jet lag.Tip: although all the views are worth the visit, try for a window seat - particularly if you're dining as a couple. Memorable and awe-inspiring.

SD0gdihkBW1ikU914AWAHw.text: Nice place, great food and smashing views. Have been here quite a few times, with both groups and on dates - the atmosphere is always upbeat. It is on the expensive side (especially drinks).

AxiZoWXhHXVCI33VFhH4nA.text: Great place!! Polite and attentive service, great food (we had pig ears, octopus, rabbit, tartare, 2 duck and waffle, different kinds of bread) and I was really happy I could get asahi here!! I've never had it in a non Japanese restaurant! The view is obviously spectacular and it's worth a visit even just for that. The dessert I got (mushrooms on toast) was a bit weird, I loved the porcini ganache but I'm not quite sure about actual mushrooms on an almond cake... 4 stars because of that and the music- way too loud, seems to be in a club. I prefer quieter spaces for supper, we had to scream to hear each other.

HnWKLO0KE2Uzve_a6MoMFQ.text: Stunning view of the city here, especially at sunrise. The breakfast was excellent and not as expensive as I expected. Definitely worth doing at least once

KXkwl7V3LHih0gzsjW-yPA.text: Needless to say, this place has a great view of London. If you're afraid of heights, beware of the elevator. It's a glass elevator that runs up the side of the building! Anyways, we made a booking for dinner on a weekday. The place has a nice vibe. Very chill but definitely dressy chic.  Service was good. We ordered several dishes to share.  Had the duck and waffle, aged bone in rib eye, Dorset crab, and yellow fin tuna. The food was just ok. The highlight really is the view and the vibe.

EDeNAbfSyJzGN59XRfvtGQ.text: Love love love, cannot get enough of this place. The crispy pigs ears is my ultimate favourite, bbq spiced gets me every time. The full Elvis fills me up nicely, everything is perfect on the plate. Dan Doherty has done this place proud!! The views are also phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. New summer overnight menu: English Cherries Waffle with Yogurt Ice cream, Cherries and White Chocolate Crumble! #musttry
Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Love this place, best hospitality and service, amazing cocktails and food

cz-6xcBu0F8wuyf7wMZ4fQ.text: Bad attitude of the receptionists. Not worth the effort to visit. The receptionists gave an attitude that I personally think is not appropriate for a restaurant this classy. Having read another review about bad receptionists, please reconsider having those two guys as your receptionists.

photos.caption: Photo of Duck & Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Arrogant receptionists.

NO2g4D405rlYT_e3g2WVwg.text: This takes chicken and waffles to an entirely new level.  There is something about duck that just makes it pair spectacularly with waffles.  The maple jalepeno cornbread and crispy polenta dishes were incredible too.  This is a must stop if you are in London.

76fBkYHujezcKRkNsYXTgg.text: Five stars for the view, three stars for the food, one star for the vibe. Worth it for the novelty value but eat beforehand and nibble while you're up there; for what you get, the prices are as high as the restaurant.

crgMel1rEOoggmaxBRBjdQ.text: Amazing view. The food bbq pork chips were also great. Our main entrees were roughly 3 stars. I am reviewing as 1 star due to the person at the door. I walked up asking for a table for 5 and was told there would be a 40 minute wait. The girl behind me was let in right away with their party. A female in our party decided she would ask again and we were then let right in. I could understand if this was a club, and having guys wait longer than girls, but we were just trying to eat dinner. Half of the tables were also empty. Not sure why this would ever happen.

_j0ohc27XN5QfRkHgmsYNQ.text: Four stars only because the price of everything seems high even for such a prestigious location.  Other than that everything was great!I came here one morning by myself because everyone else couldn't make it that early. It was fine because the atmosphere is quiet enough for you to enjoy. With the big windows to have what must be the best view in London also helps.I am of course when's for the duck and waffle which the waiter knew right away. What was really crazy to me was how quickly it arrived. They must know that a lot of people are going to order that dish and have them nearly ready always. I guess it's not really something that needs a huge prep though. I also had a bloody Mary with my breakfast but that was not very interesting and very pricey.If you want to have a great breakfast with an amazing view and fun dishes then this is your place.

7dfGW7itzOFKWHvzrRRNrQ.text: I went here for one purpose only, the view. I did not eat, only had a drink and took some photos of the view. If you go to London and don't go on the Eye, this place  is worth going to. I had just eaten lunch and the hostess informed me that there were no more lunch reservations. I was dressed for walking around the city, not posh drinks, but she begrudgingly admitted me into the elevator. I soared 40 stories up to the bar. I ordered a gin and tonic. Yes, the gin was Blue Sapphire, but 11 pounds? I don't pay eleven dollars for a gin and tonic at home. Anyway, my mission was accomplished, so I would recommend going here.
